loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 14 años atrás del distrito  y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 58 años de edad, no cuenta con estudios, es soltera y no tiene hijos.
Juana se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela R. que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital comprando oveja, chancho y gallinas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar un toro brounsis.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su alimentación y vivir tranquila. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Juana, 58, has been a member of the "Tupac Amaru I" communal bank, in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno department, for the last 14 years. She never went to school, is single, and has no children. Juana raises small farm animals and tells us that with her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela R. Movement she bought a sheep, a pig and chickens. She is requesting 1500 new soles to buy a Brown Swiss bull. Her dream for the future is to improve her nutrition and to live peacefully. What she likes best about her communal bank is the get-togethers with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a Brown Swiss bull.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El señor Adrián Ramírez es casado con la señora Liliana quien labora para una Institución Medica del Gobierno, y son padres de familia de 2 niños, el labora para una empresa comercial como Gerente de la misma, y anteriormente habían solicitado este crédito para iniciar  la construcción en un terreno que tiene para su familia; y sus pagos se han registrado muy puntuales y por lo mismo se esta tramitando este nuevo crédito para la terminación de su proyecto.
texts.en:
Adrián Ramírez works for a commercial business as its manager. He is married to Liliana, who works for a public medical institution. They are parents of two children. The couple had previously obtained a loan to begin construction on a plot of land that their family owns. Their payments have been very punctual and now they are requesting a new loan to finish the project.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish home construction

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun M., who lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province, is 43 years old. She is the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other three are enrolled in the local public school.

Mrs. Aun M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Yoeurn Khiev, sells salt. He is shown on the right of the photo.

This family tries to work hard with their businesses but they earn less income because they do not have enough money to support their businesses. Thus, Mrs. Aun M. decided to ask for a loan to buy salt to sell door to door.

loans.use: To buy salt to sell door to door

loans.name: Tesoro Del Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal "Tesoro del Triunfo" está conformado por 14 socias, quienes desarrollan sus negocios gracias a los préstamos que reciben del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se dedican a diferentes actividades y todas sueñan con el progreso de sus familias.

Este Banco Comunal recibió un prestamo inicial de S/.  6,200 soles.

Su presidenta es la señora Irma Tayt, forma parte del Banco Comunal desde hace 1 año.
es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en la región Ucayali, tiene 27 años, es madre de dos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, esta actividad la realiza en su casa y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en un chacra cosechando maíz. 

Actualmente las socias requieren de un préstamo de S/ 6,500 soles el cual les permitirá comporar productos diversos al por mayor para sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The Tesoro del Triunfo Communal Bank is comprised of 14 members. They develop their businesses thanks to the loans they receive from the Manuela Ramos Movement. They work at different activities, and all of them dream of family progress. The communal bank’s initial loan was for 6,200 soles. The president is Irma Tayt. She has been part of the communal bank for one year. She is a very dynamic woman, and she lives in the Ucayali area. She is 27 and has two minor children. She sells groceries in her house. She has her husband’s support. He works on a farm harvesting corn. The members currently need a loan for 6,500 soles. This will allow them to buy diverse products wholesale for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for their businesses

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: A. Julienne est née en 1970 et vit au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 15 ans.  Mariée à ATCHE Alphonse, un maçon, elle a six enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à sa charge.  Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Julienne n’a jamais été à l’école.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Julienne vend de maïs, haricot, et riz à son domicile à Agla.  Aussi, elle vend du soja et de mil.  Julienne s’approvisionne à Bemberéké (au nord du Bénin) et a  déjà 10 ans d’expérience dans cette activité.  Julienne a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Julienne sollicite un autre crédit pour renforcer ses activités.  Plus tard, Julienne envisage acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
A. Julienne was born in 1970 and has lived in the Agla neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin, for fifteen years. Married to ATCHE Alphonse, a mason, she has six children, all in school and in her care. Julienne lives together with her husband and children. The couple pays the family's expenses jointly. Julienne has never been to school. In order to meet her needs, she sells corn, beans, and rice from her home in Agla. She also sells soy beans and millet. Julienne gets her supplies in Bemberéké (in north Benin) and already has ten years' experience in this business. Julienne has already received a loan through ALIDé which she has fully repaid. She is seeking another loan to bolster her business. In the future, Julienne plans to buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her business and purchase corn

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila A. is from the village of Bago, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 55 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Cirila owns and operates a general store. Cirila has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Cirila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cirila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used the previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Cirila is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It uses the Grameen model to reach out to the rural poor . 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Maryel

texts.en:
Maryel C. is from the village of San Isidro, La Paz, Tarlac. She is 20 years old and married with one small child. To make a living, Maryel has a store selling DVDs (disks). She has been in this business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Maryel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maryel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maryel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Mario Jorge

texts.es:
Mario vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de comida. El socio tiene 43 años es una persona responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. 

Mario pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa y es socio nuevo. Mario se encuentra deseoso y entusiasmado de participar en el banco comunal y quiere aprender administrar mejor su dinero y aprender de los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación. Actualmente, el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, azúcar, verduras, carnes y muchos productos más para preparar una variedad de platos de comida ya que su clientela empezó aumentar pues el socio Mario tiene una buena sazón. El anhelo del socio es abrir su propio negocio de venta de comida.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mario, 43, lives in Urubamba and has a small food sales business. He is a responsible person who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead in life and provide, through his own daily efforts, for his family’s wellbeing. Mario is a new member of Asociación Arariwa ‘s “TERCER MILENIO” (Third Millennium) communal bank. Mario is enthusiastic and hopeful about belonging to a communal bank and wants to learn how to better manage his income as well as to learn about the credit, savings and training services available. He needs funds to buy ingredients like: rice, pasta, sugar, vegetables, meats and many other products so that he can sell a variety of dishes since the number of customers he serves has been increasing, thanks to his tasty cooking style. He hopes to open his own food sales business. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, pasta, sugar, vegetables and meats.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Mrs. Suy H. is 60 years old and since 1979 has made a living as a farmer on a plot of land that she owns. She grows all kinds of produce and is able to raise two crops a year. She is also the devoted mother of three children, one of whom lives with her. The other two are married and have already started families of their own. Suy H. is married to Mr. Orm Yam, 63, who earns an income from fishing. Suy H. has applied for this loan to hire laborers to clean up her farmland and prepare it for a new crops.

loans.use: To hire laborers to prepare her farmland for planting.

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tièssiri est  composé de cinq femmes  mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles  élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, 5 enfants et  habitent  toutes  à Sakoïba (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
 Les membres du groupe font  essentiellement  de la restauration et la vente du bois de chauffe qu’elles cherchent en brousse ou achètent avec les hommes. 
Le besoin d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les incita à collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire, le précédent fut remboursé sans difficulté. 
Madame Abibatou Traoré fait de la restauration, avec les rôtis de petits ruminants. 
Elle utilisera son prêt pour acheter, 3 moutons et 4 chèvres sur place dans le village. Elle fait égorger ses animaux, dépecer puis les cuit dans les mesures d’hygiène requises  en rôtis (dans des fours traditionnels). 
Elle vend  sa viande cuite (dibissoko) à domicile et en ambulant à travers le village. la vente se fait généralement au comptant et à  crédit à une clientèle essentiellement composée d’hommes et quelques rares fois aux femmes. 
Madame Abibatou jouit d’une grande réputation dans la commune pour son activité (pratiquée généralement par les hommes) et  pense réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 22.500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour, rembourser son prêt et contribuer à la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales. 
Son ambition est l’embouche ovine et acheter  du matériel agricole afin d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans son foyer.
texts.en:
The Tièssiri group is composed of five married women who live mostly in large, traditional extended families. They are, on average, 43 years old, have five children and they all live in Sakoïba (the fourth administrative region of Mali). The members of the group are mainly involved in food preparation and the sale of firewood which they gather in the woods or buy from men. The need to increase their working capital motivated them to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second joint loan, having repaid the first one without any difficulty. Madame Abibatou Traoré has a business of roasting meat. She will use her loan to buy three sheep and four goats in her village. She has the animals slaughtered and butchered and then cooks them according to the hygienic codes of roasting (in traditional ovens). She sells her cooked meat (dibissoko) from her home and traveling throughout her village. She generally makes her sales in cash and on credit to an essentially male clientele, and only rarely to women. Madame Abibatou enjoys an excellent reputation in the community for her work (which is generally done by men) and believes that she can clear a monthly profit of 22,500 FCFA which will be used to repay her loan and to contribute to meeting certain family responsibilities. Her ambition is to raise sheep and to buy agricultural products in order to have her own sustainable food supply at home.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy small livestock

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane A. is from the village of  Baikingon , Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Jane is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jane owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jane has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Jane is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Jane from HSPFI. 
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal German Busch, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Fortaleza. Su presidenta es Geoma Urquizo  que tiene el negocio de venta de calzados ella trabaja con su esposo  hace 5 años y conocen muy bien el mercado, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando Bs.- 1500 y tiene planificado comprar materia prima. 
Geoma y su esposo se organizan para atender su negocio y su  familia y no descuidar ambas tareas, así su esposo es quien produce los calzados y Geoma los días Jueves y Domingo vende sus productos.
Las demás integrantes de este grupo tienen diferentes actividades que se dedican al comercio, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
The Fortaleza (Strength) communal bank meets at the German Busch Focus Center every two weeks. The group president is Geoma Urquizo who has sold shoes with her husband for the past 5 years; they know this business very well. She is asking for 1500 bolivares to buy raw materials. Geoma and her husband organize themselves to tend to their business and to their family not neglecting either task. Her husband makes the shoes and Geoma sells them on Thursdays and Sundays. The other group members are in a variety of commercial, production and service activities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: United Family Group

texts.en:
Aminata F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Family. She is 43 years old and married. She has four children who range from 15 to 23 years old. 

She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support.

For four years, she has been selling charcoal in the Old Road Market, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. 

She plans to use her 6,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She describes herself as a respectful, determined person.

Her hope is to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites has provided for her family by operating sari-sari (variety) store for more than two years. The profit from this business has been the main source of family income. Now that Marites has secure access to working capital, her profits are better than before. Marites is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for the amount of 10,000 PHP to increase her inventory of foodstuffs for her store. This will allow her to grow her business further so that she will support the educational needs of her five children until they complete college.

Marites is hopeful that her sari-sari (variety) store will generate steady profits to improve her financial stability and provide a better life for her family in a decent way. Marites’s biggest dream is to manage a full-fledged mini-grocery store someday. She believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed while helping her family rise out of poverty. The financial opportunity of her sari-sari (variety) store is one of the best ways to help provide for her family and she very much wants to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of foodstuffs for her store.

loans.name: Antonio Francisco

texts.es:
Antonio Francisco G. Z. tiene 45 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 niños de 14, 13, 12, 8, 5, y 3 anos. 

Antonio es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Antonio se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, yuca, y maracuyá. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para sus cultivos para cambiar su economía. Su sueño es poder dar una buena educación a todos sus hijos. 

Le gusta practicar el deporte de indoor futbol.
texts.en:
Antonio Francisco G. Z. is 45. He is in a common-law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has 6 children ages 14, 13, 12, 8, 5 and 3. Antonio is a member of the rural El Placer solidarity group, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn and cocoa. This is their first loan with the Cooperativa San Jose. Antonio is a farmer who cultivates corn, cocoa, plantains, yucca and passion fruit. He makes his purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao every weekend. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of inputs for his crops and to change his economic situation. His dream is to be able to give a good education to all of his children. He enjoys playing the sport of indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of inputs for his crops

loans.name: Maria Eliza

texts.es:
Doña Maria Elisa L. J. es viuda, madre de cuatro hijos , comerciante, vive junto a su familia en el barrio San Agustín,  toda su familia y ella se dedican a la venta de muebles que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación ella es el pilar más importante de su familia ya que es una señora muy trabajadora, emprendedora de carácter fuerte 
 Doña Maria Elisa L. J. es clienta activa desde hace más de cinco años con dieciocho créditos cancelados, todos estos créditos los ha utilizado para la inversión de su negocio ya que constantemente tiene que realizar inversiones para mantener estable su negocio y ofrecer mucha variedades de sus producto para atraer más clientes y hacer frente a la competencia una de sus virtudes es de mantener unidad a su familia trabajando en el mismo negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Elisa L. J. is the widowed mother of four children. She and her family live in the San Agustín neighborhood and they sell furniture out of her home. She is the family’s most important pillar because she is very hard working, entrepreneurial, and of strong character. Maria has been an active client for more than five years and has had eighteen previous loans, which she has repaid. She has used the money from all of the loans to invest in her business, because she needs to constantly make investments to keep the business stable and to be able to offer a large variety of products in order to attract more customers and beat out the competition. One of her virtues is to keep her family united and working in the same business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum P. is a 41-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Phnom Penh City. She owns a piece of farmland on which she and her husband always cultivate crops to earn a living. Besides this, she sells a few grocery ingredients out of her home and her husband provides a motor-taxi service for additional revenue. This couple are good parents of four children, one of whom is employed as an English teacher. In order to generate extra profits, Sum P. needs a loan to pay for hiring a parking lot in the school which she will use to look after a student’s vehicle for a fee. (Mrs. Sum P.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To pay for hiring a parking lot.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mr. Phy C. and his wife, Mrs. Mach Pel, have been married for more than 26 years and have 6 children--5 sons and 1 daughter. The daughter is married and lives outside the family home; one son is an elevator technician, and the other four children attend school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Mr. Phy C. has been a wooden house builder for more than 28 years. His wife used to be a silk weaver, but she quit her business. One of his sons finished his baccalaureate; he wants to continue his studies at the university. So Phy is asking for a loan of US$ 1,000 to pay school fees for his son. He will use a part of the loan to purchase additional materials for his business.  
Photo: Phy’s wife.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his son and buy additional materials for his business

loans.name: Andrea Adelina

texts.es: La sra. Andrea Adelina M. tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 29, 27, 25 y 23 años, reside en el Barrio Bella Vista en la ciudad de Catacamas, Olancho. Andrea tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de productos alimenticios como lo son las tortillas de maíz, nacatamales y golosinas, entre otros productos. Inició vendiendo tortillas de maíz para poder mantener a sus cuatro hijos. En la actualidad ella, dos de sus hijas y una nuera se levantan todos los días a las 3:00 am, ya que tienen un contrato y deben entregar las tortillas a las 8:00 am. También vende nacatamales de carne y pollo, tamalitos de frijoles, y los domingos hace tacos de carne.  Su ventaja es que trabaja en su propia casa y una dificultad que enfrenta es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para elaborar una mayor cantidad de productos. Andrea solicita el préstamo para poder comprar materia prima como maíz, frijoles, leña, hoja de mata de mínimo verde para envolver los nacatamales, carne, aceite y condimentos.  Con el apoyo del préstamo podrá elaborar sus productos y obtener ganancias, y mejorar su condición su vida y la de su familia. Es su tercer ciclo en FAMA y con el apoyo de los préstamos ha podido ir creciendo en su negocio y en la diversificación de los productos que elabora.
texts.en: Andrea Adelina M., 49, is a single mother of 4 children aged 29, 27, 25, and 23 years.  She lives in the Bella Vista neighborhood of the city of Catacamos, Olancho.  Andrea has been making food such as corn tortillas, nacatamales (a type of large tamale typical of Central America), sweets, and other dishes for 15 years.  She started out selling corn tortillas to support her 4 children.  Now, Andrea and 2 of her children and a daughter-in-law get up early every day at 3am, since they have a deal where they must deliver tortillas at 8am.  In addition, she sells nacatamales made of chicken and meat, small bean tamales, and on Sundays she makes beef tacos.  Her advantage is that she can work out of her own house.  One difficulty she faces is that she doesn't have enough money to make a greater quantity of products.  Andrea requests a loan so that she can buy supplies such as corn, beans, firewood, green plantain leaves (to wrap the nacatamales in), meat, cooking oil and condiments.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to make her products and have better earnings so that she can improve the living conditions of herself and her family.  This is her 3rd loan cycle with FAMA, and with the support of these loans she has been able to grow her business and diversify the products that she makes.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, firewood, meat, cooking oil, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Rocío Emperatriz

texts.es: Rocío Emperatriz A. G. de 20 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, junto a su esposo y una hija de 1 año de edad. Rocío posee su propia panadería, en la cual se encarga de elaborar el pan y posteriormente comercializar tanto en su casa, lugar en el cual esta ubicada la panadería, como a sus clientes, a los cuales debe ir a repartir el pan. Cuenta con el beneficio de poseer muchos clientes los que hacen pedido en grandes cantidades y que son fieles a su negocio. Rocío solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina por mayor para poder obtenerla más barata, así como también manteca, azúcar, miel, levadura y otros productos más los cuales son muy importantes para la realización del pan. A pesar que salir adelante con su negocio ha sido bastante difícil, ella ha sabido mantenerse firme con el deseo de crecer como micro empresaria y así brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Rocío Emperatriz A. G. is 20 years old and lives in the municipality of Soyapango, together with her husband and one year-old daughter.  Rocío has her own bakery, where she makes the bread and then sells it.  She sells from her house, which is where her bakery is located, and at her customers' homes, where she goes to deliver the bread.  She is lucky to have many customers who order large quantities of bread and are faithful to her business.

Rocío is requesting a loan to make it possible for her to buy flour wholesale, which will be cheaper.  Likewise, she will buy wholesale butter, sugar, honey, yeast, and other ingredients, all of which are important for breadmaking.  Despite the fact that it has been difficult to move her business forward, she has remained firm in her desire to grow as a small businesswoman in order to offer her daughter a better future.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, honey, and other ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en: Narantuya D. is a 42-year-old single mother who lives with her three sons in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her sons live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her older two sons, ages 19 and 21, are students and both live and study at universities in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. Her youngest son attends a local secondary school. Narantuya started her trading business in 2006 and has been operating a clothing and shoes trade business out of container in the local market in her town since then. She sells a variety of clothing items and shoes imported from Korea at a wholesale price. After some years of positive growth with her business, she could afford her two sons' tuition fees. She is focused on expanding her trading business and offering different kinds of products to her customers in order to increase her sales in the future. She is a very hardworking person who wants to raise her children to become good people with high educational backgrounds. Narantuya is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to procure more products, such as winter boots, before demand for such products rises for the upcoming winter months.

loans.use: To procure more products

loans.name: Hamziya

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 69 years old and she is a widow with no children.

She started her business in 1995 selling grains, tea, sugar, flour and other foodstuffs. She well known in her community and she has a reputation for being nice and trustworthy. This is her fourth loan.  

She applied for US$ 2400 to renovate her shop and extend it. She is planning to grow and expand her business so she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: renovating and extending her shop

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en: Encarnacion E. is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Encarnacion is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Encarnacion raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cows for sale. Encarnacion has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 500 Philippines pesos a month from it. In 2010, Encarnacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Encarnacion is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Encarnacion from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kukola Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
51-year-old K. Margaret is affliated with Kukola Development Group-Mukono.  She has been operating a small retail shop selling mostly soap, sugar, and bread for the last 16 years in Kirinya.  Her shop attracts people from all walks of life from the lowest, middle, and highest income earners in and around Mukono. 

She gives credit goes to her husband whom she says was the motivating force in getting her started in this business. Prior to that, she was selling mostly tomatoes.   Her business profits are 600,000 shillings monthly, and she says with this loan she will add more retail items to her shop.

loans.use: To purchase items to resell

loans.name: Emilda

texts.es:
Emilda  solicito 500 $us. Trabaja como peinadora en su salón de peinados, su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. Vive en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene tres hijos pequeños.

El crédito lo destinara para  amurallar un pequeño  terreno el cual lo adquirió recientemente. Es el tercer  crédito en impro y el segundo vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Emilda requests a loan of US$500. She works as a hairdresser in a beauty salon. Her husband works in the interior region of the country. She lives in the region called Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. She has three small children. 

The loan will be used to build a wall around a small plot of land that she recently acquired. This is the third loan she accesses through Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and the second through Kiva.

loans.use: To build a wall around a plot of land.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita F. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Benita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Benita operates a motorcycle transport business for local community members. Benita has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Benita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Benita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Benita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will also be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the fifth loan taken by Benita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: José Eusebio

texts.es:
Don José tiene 62 años de edad y vive en la localidad de San Agustin Mextepec, es casado, vive en casa propia, la esposa de don José es ama de casa y cria animales como borregos, puercos y pollos para sacar un poco de dinero extra, en total de la familia de don José son 6 integrantes, 4 hijos, 2 hombres y dos mujeres su esposa y el, ya ninguno de sus hijos depende de el, los 4 ya estan casados y tienen a sus hijos.

Don José tiene un oficio que es la albañileria pero no es un trabajo diario, mas bien es por unos dias, tambien se dedica a la merceria, don José los fines de semana sale a vender al mercado de su municipio, el dia mas grande de tianguis es el dia domingo, ese dia sale a vender desde muy temprano, acomoda un puesto y vende estambres, hilos, agujas, estropajos, cotonetes, algo de aseo personal como cepillos dentales, pasta para dientes, zacates etc.

En este negocio ya tiene 40 años de experiencia, a don José no se le hace dificil su actividad, esta acostumbrado al trabajo, tambíen sabe lo que significa ser un comerciante por eso no se preocupa demasiado, comenta que en un negocio hay dias buenos y hay dias malos pero todo negocio es bendecido y no hay que quejarse para que le vaya bien.

Como don José ya no mantiene lo que saca de ganancias es para poderlas invertir, comprar nuevas, uno de sus hijos le ayuda a escoger las compras, escoge cosas nuvas que ve que se puedan vender facilmente y no se queden, tambíen si le da algo de dinero a su esposa pero no es mucho ya que su esposa tambíen obtiene ganancias de sus animales.

Entre su esposa y don José se apoyan en los gastos y salen adelante en el negocio de cada uno, tienen un ahorro que van guardando poco a poco para gastarlo en una emergencía o por si uno se llegase a enfermar.
texts.en:
José is 62 years old and lives in the town of San Agustin Mextepec.  He is married and lives in his own home.  José's wife is a housewife and also raises animals such as lambs, pigs and chickens to make a little bit of extra money.  There are 6 people in José's family: himself, his wife and four children (2 sons and 2 daughters).  None of his children are dependent on him any longer, however, as they are all married and have their own children.

José is in the building trade but this does not provide daily work so he also works selling household products.  Every weekend, José goes out to sell his products in the town market, the busiest market day being Sunday.  On Sundays he goes out very early in the morning, sets up his stall and sells yarn, thread, needles, scouring pads, cotton buds and personal hygiene products such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, sponges, etc.

José already has 40 years of experience in this business.  His does not find his business difficult and is used to the work.  He knows what it means to be a salesman and doesn't worry too much.  He comments that there are good days and bad days in every business but every business is blessed and grumbling doesn't make things go any better.

José re-invests the profits that he makes in his business, buying new products.  One of his children helps him choose what to buy.  He chooses new products that he sees will sell easily.  He also gives some money to his wife but not a lot since his wife also makes income from her animals.

José and his wife support each other in covering their expenses and each of them manages to get ahead in their business.  They are slowly building up savings so that they have money available in case of emergency or in case one of them should fall ill.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (thread, yarn, needles, scourers and cotton buds).

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Doña Maria Elsa vive con una de sus hijas y un nietecito,  labora para el Minsa desde hace 33 años con gran dedicaciòn  y esmero, es una mujer emprendedora, que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia y darle lo mejor, es bien responsable con sus compromisos adquiridos, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores los cuales son independiente y muy trabajadores.  

Solicita su 9no credito a la instituciòn con el apoyo de Kiva que desde ya agradece mucho, requiere este financiamiento para cambiarle el zinc a su vivienda, 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es gozar de mucha salud y que su familia sigan las cosas de Dios y cuenten con un trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Elsa lives with one of her daughters and a little grandson.  She has worked for the Ministry of Health for 33 years with great dedication and commitment.  She is an enterprising woman who fights to get ahead with her family and provide the best.  She is quite responsible with acquired responsibilities and she can count on help from her two oldest children who are independent and very hard working.

She is asking the institution for her 9th loan with Kiva’s help, gratitude for which she is expressing already.  She needs the loan to replace the zinc metal sheeting on her house.

Her greatest dream in life is to enjoy good health and that her family follows God’s will and have proper employment.

loans.use: To replace the zinc metal sheeting.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Ángela se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, negocio que ella misma atiende todos los días, y con mucho ánimo y el buen trato ha hecho que su establecimiento sea el más concurrido Una de las cualidades que cree poseer, es el orden que siempre lleva en sus cuentas y eso le permite saber cuánto gana por cada producto que vende. Es por ello que desea tener una tienda más llena de mercadería y muy variada. Este crédito es para comprar calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, sabanas entre otros productos.
texts.en: Doña Ángela sells general goods. She has run this business every day for more than 16 years, and with a great deal of energy and good service she has made her establishment the busiest. One of the qualities that she believes herself to have is order, which she uses in her accounts, allowing her to know how much she earns from each product that she sells. Consequently, she wants to have a better stocked shop with a wide variety of products. This loan is to buy shoes, clothing in general, cosmetics, and sheets among other products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Magsarjav

texts.en: Magsarjav is 21 years old and lives with his parents and a younger sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His parents have been operating a spare truck parts retail business for many years in “Uguumur market”. His two youngest sisters are attending local secondary school. Magsarjav has been running a spare truck parts retail business for the last three years and he adopted this business from his parents. His business is doing very well because brand new spare parts for big trucks are very expensive. He has his own customers and his products are in good demand. In the future, he wants to get a higher education. Therefore, Magsarjav is requesting this loan because he wants to increase his working capital and inventory.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Joe Ann

texts.en:
Joe Ann B. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Joe Ann is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling retail rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $920 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Joe Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Joe Ann is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. This will be her 20th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La señorita angélica es soltera, es buena la satisfacción saber que es una chica que lucha en la vida por valores de crecimiento así mismo con la institución Emprender de la misma manera mejorar  su educación profesional, la actividad que tiene es la venta de ropa en un puesto fijo y gracias al apoyo de la institución emprender podrá adquirir mercadería de temporada a bajo costo, sacrificada pero rentable, inicio su negocio el 2002 de manera muy humilde obteniendo buenos resultados debido  a esta razón es que se animo a solicitar crédito para comprar mercadería de temporada en pantalones es muy trabajadora , responsable con ganas de superación, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Miss Angelica is single. It is good to know that she is a young woman who fights for her values of development. With the Emprender institute, she hopes to improve her professional education. She sells clothing for a living in a fixed stall, and thanks to the Emprender institute's support, she will be able to obtain seasonal merchandise at a low cost. Her business is hard work, but lucrative. She started her business humbly in 2002, but got good results, which is why she decided to request a loan to obtain this season's merchandise, like pants. Responsible and with the desire for self-improvement, she is grateful to the institute for the support it has given her.

loans.use: to purchase this season's merchandise.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, está separada y tiene 3 hijos.  Francisca cuenta con grado de instrucción secundaria.
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos. Con éste préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará un saco de papa, chuño, camote, pollo, chancho.  Paralelamente se dedica al cuidado de niños (Wawa Wasi), junto con su amiga Nancy.
Su sueño es seguir teniendo su Wawa Wasi y mejorar poco a poco.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la ganancia.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower) which is located in the District and Department of Puno. She is 31 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three children. Francisca has a high school education.

She is a new member who recently joined Manuela Ramos and earns her living by selling food. With this loan of 500 PEN, she will buy a sack of potatoes, dried potatoes, yams, chicken, and pork. In addition, she operates a day care center with her friend Nancy.

Her dream is to continue with her day care business and make gradual improvements. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank are the savings and the interest that is earned.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of potatoes, dried potatoes, yams, chicken, and pork.

loans.name: Myriam Rosemery

texts.es:
Myriam es una joven de 21 años de edad que vive  en la zona rural de la provincia de Pacasmayo – La Libertad, en  casa de sus padres.

Myriam desde pequeña buscaba la forma de ayudar a sus padres, trabajando y vendiendo ocasionalmente cualquier tipo de productos. Sin embargo, desde hace 3 años Myriam se dio cuenta que la venta de ropa le resultaba rentable. Así que, comenzó a vender ropa de manera ambulatoria   (sin puesto fijo)  en el mercado de Pacasmayo. Myriam es conocida y cuenta con una clientela ya fija por lo que realiza ventas a crédito.

Myriam solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería (prendas de vestir y zapatos) debido a que actualmente cuenta con una gran cantidad de pedidos que ella no puede abastecer por sí sola.

Myriam es una joven muy eficaz en su negocio, lo conoce a la perfección a pesar de su corto tiempo en él  y espera ganar  clientela para poder tener un puesto fijo en un futuro.

Myriam cuenta con cuatro créditos cancelados puntualmente.
texts.en:
Myriam is 21 years old and lives in her parents’ house in the rural zone of the Pacasmayo – La Libertad province.

Since she was young, Myriam has been looking for a way to help her parents; working and occasionally selling any type of products.  Never the less, three years ago, Myriam discovered that selling clothing was profitable, so she began selling clothing on foot (without a fixed location) in the Pacasmayo marketplace.  Myriam is well known and has fixed customers to whom she sells on credit.

Myriam is asking for a loan of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise (clothing and shoes) because she has many requests that she can’t fill herself.

Myriam is a young woman who is very effective in her business.  She knows every detail about it despite her short time doing it, and expects to gain customers so that she can set up a fixed location in the future.

She has had four previous loans and has repaid them on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Laneh Kuru Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Laneh Kuru” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. Fatmata is 35, married, and has five children. Three are in primary school and two are in secondary school. 

Fatmata sells cooking utensils – spoons, knives, plates, pots, etc., and has been doing this business for 22 years now. With the help of this loan, Fatmata will invest in her business by buying different kinds of cooking utensils in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Félix Pedro

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, señor Félix Pedro,   se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy honrada  trabajadora con buenos valores y principios  morales. 
Se presento ante esta oficina  de  Ceprodel para solicitar  crédito para ser invertido en mejoramiento  en su vivienda en realizar un anexo de un cuarto, en compra materiales de construcción como  bloque, cemento, hierro, arena y mano obra, para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Felix Pedro is from the city of Managua and is characterized for being an honorable person with good values and moral principles.
He showed up at the Ceprodel offices to solicit a loan that would be invested toward home improvements for his home, specifically the addition of a bedroom, and will need to purchase construction materials such as: blocks, cement, iron, sand, and labor costs.  This will improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Jolinda

texts.en: Jolinda is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and five children. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a shop where she sells spices such as onions and garlic. She is applying for a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more spices to sell to her customers. Jolinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 and hopes to expand and improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of spices to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Basbi

texts.ru: Басби проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 51 год. Вдова, имеет 6 детей. Дети работаю заграницей. Сама Басби занимается растениеводством и одновременно животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кроме того она при доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где сеет рис. Этим видом деятельности она занимается два года. Кредит берет для посева риса и закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Basbi lives in Jilikul. She is 51 years old, a widow, and has six children. Her children work abroad. Basbi works in farming and in animal husbandry.  She raises cattle at home. Additionally, at home she has a small plot of land where she grows rice.  She has been doing this for two years. She is taking out a loan to sow a rice crop and to buy cattle.

loans.use: to sow a rice crop and to buy cattle.

loans.name: Jose Cristobal

texts.es:
José Cristobal tiene 47 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla son 12 miembros se en su mayoría dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz, actividad mas antigua.

José Cristobal se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial PRONACA y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y falta de dinero para seguir invirtiendo. Su sueño es incrementar la producion para dar mnejor nivel de vida a la familia y la mejor educacion.

Le gusta ser una persona responsable y trabajadora y festejar toda fiesta en compañia de la familia.
texts.en:
José Cristóbal, 47, is married living with his wife and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank are located in the hamlet of San Luis de Zapotal that belongs to Ventanas Canton.  It has 12 members.  Most of them farm corn and rice, a very ancient activity.

José Cristóbal farms corn and rice.  He buys his products at the PRONACA supply store and his sales take place at the Ventanas wholesale market.

He is asking for the loan for his corn and rice crops; he will buy supplies and fertilizer for them.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like illnesses among his field hands and lack of money to reinvest.  His dream is to increase crop yields to provide his family with a better standard of living and better education.

He likes being a responsible, hard working person and to celebrate all the festivals in the company of his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man with three children, age 24, 21 and 12. His wife works as a teacher.

Nelson is a farmer who works in Banga, South Cotabato. He has been growing rice for 17 years. Nelson sells his harvest to rice traders. He earns about 8,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Nelson said he is able to support his family and send his children to school through this business.

Nelson will use this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. He hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is married with three children. She sells food items. Her grocery store is located in their community, which is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries. She is a hard worker and works long days to make sure that her family has everything it needs. Genelyn has been running this business for six years. Her monthly profit is PHP 2,500.

Genelyn's business is the only source of income for her family. She realizes this responsibility and is doing her best to meet the needs of her family. 

Today she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more food items. Genelyn is hoping that from the increased profit from her business, she can expand her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack food, spices and bread

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina tiene 39 años, es una mujer amable, sencilla y sobre todo muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edwin de 40 años y su querido hijo Cristian de 05 años, a quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. La tienda de abarrotes de Reina es una de las más concurridas en el poblado de Quimbiri, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus consumidores sobre la calidad y variedad de cada producto, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda en espera de clientes ya que de eso depende sus ingresos económicos gracias a la venta de sus mercaderías, Reina compró variedad de bienes para su hogar y para el bien de su negocio solicita el crédito para poder comprar las provisiones necesarias para su puesto de ventas. Este será su tercer crédito de Reina y esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de ustedes para seguir prosperando. En su banco comunal es una socia participe. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche y entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Riena is 39 years old. She is a friendly, simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her 40-year-old husband Edwin and her dear 5-year-old son Cristian, who she hopes to provide with a better future. Reina’s grocery shop is one of the busiest in the town of Quimbiri. Her great charisma and the kindness in her customer service have made her the favorite among her neighbors, who do not hesitate to make their purchases starting very early, since they know that hers is the first store to open and the last one to close.
What she likes the most about her job is giving advice to her customers about the quality and variety of every product. She has been in this business for 10 years, and what she considers the most difficult is having to stay in her store all day waiting for customers, since this is what her income is dependent on – thanks to the sale of her merchandise. Reina bought a variety of goods for her home and, for the good of her business, she is requesting the loan to be able to buy the necessary provisions for her sales point. This will be Reina’s third loan and she is very happy to know that she will once again have your support to continue prospering. She is an active member in her communal bank.  With the three thousand new Peruvian soles requested, she will buy provisions for her grocery store: sacks of rice, sugar, milk and other goods.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, milk and other goods.

loans.name: Candelaria De Jesus

texts.es:
Candelaria vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y se dedica a la venta de carnes frías y también aprovecha su mercado, para solucionarles cualquier necesidad a las familias, de adquirir mercancías variadas como cosméticos, calzados, ropa de cama, toallas etc.  Este negocio lo inició Candelaria hace 10 años y vende las carnes frías de contado y las mercancías establecen créditos adaptados a sus requerimientos y a las necesidades de sus clientes. Candelaria goza de una buena clientela y necesita seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo, esta es la razón por la cual acude a   su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará carnes frías y mercancía variada como cosméticos toallas, calzado sobre pedidos solicitados por sus clientes, para la época en la cual Candelaria obtiene un repunte en sus ventas el Mes del Amor y de la Amistad.
Su cartera es muy buena,  presenta una buena recuperación, pues  rota  sus cuentas por cobrar  en 18 días, de acuerdo a las características de este negocio y así mismo una rotación de inventarios de 17 días, indicadores desde los cuales auguramos su éxito en la inversión planeada.
texts.en:
Candelaria lives in the city of Cartagena and sells cold cuts but also takes advantage of her market to also take care of any other family need, to acquire assorted merchandise like cosmetics, footwear, bed linens, towels, etc.  Candelaria started this business ten years ago and sells cold cuts for cash and the other merchandise on credit plans adapted to the needs and requirements of her customers.  

Candelaria has a well-established clientele and needs to continue to increase working capital.  This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy cold cuts and assorted merchandise like cosmetics, towels and footwear to fill pending customer orders during this season when Candelaria’s sales spike thanks to the approaching festivities related to the Month of Love and Friendship.

Her portfolio is quite good.  Her recuperation is good because her accounts receivable rotate every 18 days according to this type of business’ characteristics and her inventory turns over every 17 days.  These indicators augur success for the planned investment.

loans.use: to buy cold cuts and assorted merchandise like cosmetics, towels and footwear to fill pending customer orders.

loans.name: Nie

texts.en: Nie, 25 year olds, is a grocery seller and earns $7 per day. Her husband is a trader, buy and resell bamboo earns $10 per day. This couple has two children, they are 4 and 2 year olds. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy more grocery goods to sell in her store. Her family use to do farming before, but they change their career after they have children and enough money to start a new business. In the future, she wants to buy a plot of land near the road and build a small house to sell grocery. She also wants to send all of her children to study in the university when they can finish high school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is in her early twenties, is married with one small child.  She has been running a fruit and vegetable business for one year now.  She works from 5 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Elizabeth’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Limited. She used the previous loan, which she paid back successfully, to buy items she was lacking and for household expenses.  She wants a new loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Blue", which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила живет и работает в городе Новомосковске. Она – рыночный торговец. Людмила занимается торговлей женской одеждой на одном из местных рынков города, а именно на Славянском рынке. Она продает костюмы для женщин, платья, юбки, блузы, свитера. Точка Людмилы расположена очень выгодно, у нее есть свои постоянные клиенты. В этом бизнесе Людмила находится уже более 6 лет. На данный момент у нее в товаре уже 30 000 гривен. 

Людмила планирует закупить на 10 000 гривен женскую одежду на осень-зиму, а именно купить классические женские свитера, платья и пальто для сезонной реализации. Кредит КИВА позволит ей обновить модный ассортимент и увеличить объем продаж.  Людмила знает потребности женщин, она наработала своих клиентов. Она всегда старается учитывать предпочтения и запросы как стройных, так и полных женщин, поэтому предоставляет в своем киоске разные модели для клиенток разной комплекции и с разными вкусами. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Ludmila lives and works in the town of Novomoskovsk.  She is a market salesperson.  Ludmila is involved in selling women's clothing at one of the town's local markets, specifically at the Slavyanskiy market.  She sells suits for women, dresses, skirts, blouses and sweaters.  Ludmila's retail outlet has a good location, and she has her own loyal customers.  Ludmila has been in this business for over six years.  She currently has 30,000 hryvnia invested in her merchandise.  Ludmila plans to use the 10,000 hryvnia loan to buy women's clothing for the autumn-winter, specifically to buy women's sweaters, dresses and coats for seasonal sales.  Kiva's loan will allow her to update the contemporary merchandise and increase sales volume.  Ludmila knows what women want since she was able to attain her customer base.  She always tries to consider preferences and requests from both slim and heavy women and provides various models for clients with different body compositions and taste in her store.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing for the autumn-winter, specifically to buy women's classic sweaters, dresses and coats for seasonal sales

loans.name: Dzimbabwe Group

texts.en:
Janet, a 39-year-old married mother of five children, four of whom attend school, sells groceries in Harare, the capital city of Zimbabwe. In business for five years, her main challenges are price increases and competition.

Janet has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy groceries for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the well-being of her family, and in the future she plans to open a giant retail shop.

loans.use: to buy grocery stocks.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 47 years old and is a widow who lost her husband a few years ago as a result of his sudden death. After his death, she moved to her brother’s home with her three daughters. She didn’t want to become a burden on her brother which is why she started a business making bakery items.

She works very hard to earn money for her family and also provides full support to her brother financially. She takes orders from different bakery shops in the market and fulfills them by providing them with finished goods like biscuits, cakes, bread, etc.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, because she wants to buy flour, sugar, ghee and other bakery ingredients in bulk quantity. This will allow her to expand her business and increase her sales and profits. She has operated her business for many years and is very confident that this investment will help her to earn more profits and save more for the future marriage of her daughters.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the Asasah passbook is Robina.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, ghee, etc. in bulk quantity to make bakery items

loans.name: Nonvignonto Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNONTO est composé de trois personnes qui cohabitent ensemble. C'est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Catherine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Catherine est âgée de 43 ans et vit au Bénin. Catherine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Catherine est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Philippe. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Catherine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Catherine vend depuis une vingtaine d’années, de la nourriture (riz, pâte alimentaire, haricot) qu'elle prépare et vend à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Catherine vend des savons. Catherine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Catherine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNONTO, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les cinq premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group NONVIGNONTO is composed of three persons who live together. This is the sixth time the group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, named Catherine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. 

Catherine is 43 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a shipping agent named Philippe. They have four children, all in school and in their care. She lives together with her husband and children. To cover the diverse family expenses, she has been selling food (rice, pasta, beans) for about twenty years. She makes the food and then sells it out of her home. Secondarily, she sells soaps. Her supplies come from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Catherine and the other members of the group NONVIGNONTO are requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé. The five previous loans have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and beans and some soap

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El señor Sergio es jubilado y recibe una renta mensual. El crédito que requiere es para la construcción de muros en la planta alta de su domicilio. Sergio es casado y tiene cinco  hijos de los cuales cuatro de ellos se encuentran casados .Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de Obispo Bosque  de la Ciudad de La Paz. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos anteriormente otorgados ya que le ayudo a construir su vivienda. Esta es la cuarta vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Sergio is retired and receives a monthly pension. The loan he is requesting will be used for the construction of walls on the upper floor of his home. Sergio is married and has five children, four of whom are married. He lives in his own home in the District of Obispo Bosque in the city of La Paz.

Sergio is very pleased with the previous loans that were granted to him because they have helped in the construction of his house. This is the fourth time that his loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to build walls on the upper floor of his house.

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Meraluna has a shop that sells spices, food seasoning and vegetables, like eggplants and cabbages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy food seasoning, spices and vegetables.

Meraluna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Meraluna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasoning, spices and vegetables

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки зимнего ассортимента обуви. Предыдущий кредит помог ей сделать удачные закупки и получить дополнительную прибыль на продаже весенне-летнего товара. За счет полученной прибыли Ирина улучшает свои жилищные условия - делает мелкий ремонт, покупает бытовую технику.

У Ирины трое взрослых детей. Ирина живет вместе со старшей дочерью в своем доме. Дочь пошла по стопам матери и начала свой бизнес. Сын и младшая дочь с семьями проживают отдельно.
texts.en: Irina is requesting this loan for the purchase of a winter selection of shoes.  Her previous loan helped her to make successful purchases and earn an additional profit from the sales of spring-summer merchandise.  Irina uses her profits to improve her living conditions - makes small repairs and buys household appliances.  Irina has three adult daughters.  She lives with the oldest daughter in their own house.  Her daughter followed her mother's steps and started her own business.  Irina's son and youngest daughter live with their own families.

loans.use: to expand the selection of winter shoes

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 46 years old. She is married and has three children. With all her children in school, Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for seven years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, detergent and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is a married woman with three children. Ma. Glenda is 27 years old, residing in Baliango, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Ma. Glenda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for two years. She earns 1,500 PHP each month from it. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2010, Ma. Glenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Ma. Glenda wants to fund her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Fredrick Get New Photo It Is Dull Zaverio

texts.en:
Zaverio is 34 years old, married, and a father of two children. For the last four years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transportation services in Malindi town. He earns a monthly profit of 10,000 (KES). 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for his first loan,of 30,000 KES. He will use a portion of the loan to service and repair his motorbike and use the remainder to put up a fruit and vegetable grocery for his wife to run. 

Zaverio will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children. His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses so that he may give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to service and repair his motorbike and start a food kiosk

borrowers.first_name: Fredrick Get New Photo It Is Dull Zaverio

loans.name: Iosefina

texts.en:
Iosefina has many family commitments but her husband is the only provider for them being a taxi driver which earns him a net income of $50 weekly. She wants to help her husband earn more money to satisfy their needs and wants. She joined SPBD programme for a business loan so she can start a sausage sizzle business!

Given a loan of $100 she’s purchased raw sausages and oil for her sizzle to take to the local school daily. Her supplies consist of 30 sausages a day that she sells for 30 cents per sausage. She does these 5 days a week, earning her a $150 a week.

She is aiming at increasing her stock and may be opening a small takeaway in the future with more help from SPBD.

loans.use: Purchase sausages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Judy would like to buy a high grade dairy cow

loans.name: Suy Bun

texts.en:
Suy Bun T. is 29 years old and works as a tailor earning $2.50 per day. Her husband is an electrician and earns $5/day. Together, they have 2 children who are students, and they also have one niece who also lives with their family. This loan will be used to buy a motorbike for their transportation.

In the future, Soy Bun T. hopes to hire a couple of workers to start a small garment manufacturing company. She hopes to see her children graduate from university someday.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Mrs. Soa L. is 43 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their 3 children.  She works as a small farmer and housewife, taking care of her famiL..  Her husband is the village chief, and earns $5/day in this occupation.  Mrs. Soa L. will use this loan to purchase construction supplies.  The supplies will be used to help fix their current house, but also so that she and her husband can be hired to make small repairs to other people's homes.  In the future, she hopes to save enough money to send their children to university.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona has been making bread for over 15 years now. She says her main difficulty is having to buy the flour, oils, and seeds she uses for bread making. However, she states that she now needs a more modern oven to bake her bread. She's presently using an oven fueled by wood. She says that she wants to have an alternative to using fuel which she knows is wasting trees.

When we sat down to do some math relative to the cost of energy, we found that for her, wood is cost-effective, plus the fact that wood as a source of cooking heat is unbeatable with respect to flavor of the final product! Thus we concluded that if she could buy more flour and other cooking needs, she might have just the right combination of cost and product effectiveness. Hence, Ramona is 'counting the hours' until she can get her loan, so as to stop "beating around the bush" to make a living!

loans.use: baking bread for her community

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
MERCEDES is 20 years old, she is a single mother and has 1 son, and at her home she bakes artisan bread to later resell it on the streets of the City of San Cristóbal. She belongs to the group Flor de Pascua 4 along with Mrs. Carmen Hernández Díaz (who sells coffee, corn and pinole [parched ground grain, sugar and spices] and Mrs. Maria Guadalupe Maldonado (who sells candies on the street markets). Together, they will invest the money from the loan to better organize the place where they make their products and buy utensils that will help them on the making of the products.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

MERCEDES, tiene 20 años es madre soltera de un hijo, se dedica en su casa a hacer pan artesanal y posteriormente lo sale a vender de manera ambulante por las calles de la ciudad de San Cristóbal. Pertenece al grupo Flor de Pascua 4 junto con doña Carmen Hernández Díaz (vende café, maíz y pinole molidos) y doña Maria Guadalupe Maldonado (vende dulces en las ferias) .Todas ellas invertirán sus prestamos adecuando de mejor manera el lugar donde hacen sus productos y comprando utensilios que le faciliten la preparación de los mismos.

loans.use: SALE OF ARTISAN BREAD

loans.name: Adassou

texts.fr:
Born in Djita in the prefecture of Vo, Adassou A. is a good, well-known farmer in his area. At 55 years of age, he is still very active, and is the father of nine (09) children. Due to the quality of his crops, his goods are sought after by the women in his area. To meet their needs, he wants to enlarge his farm and to buy fertiliser and pesticides.

Due to a lack of financial means, he is asking for $400. The achievement of this goal will bring him new customers, which will provide maximum income. Thus, he will be able to better meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer
