Né à Djita dans la préfecture de Vo, A. Adassou est un brave cultivateur bien connu dans sa localité. Agé de 55 ans il est encore très actif, et père de neuf (9) enfants. De part la qualité de ses récoltes, il est sollicité par les bonnes dames de sa localité. Pour les satisfaire toutes, il a eu l’idée d’agrandir son champ et d’acheter des engrais et les produits phytosanitaire.

Faute de moyens financiers, il vient solliciter $400. Ce but atteint, lui permettra d’avoir de nouvelles clientes source d’un revenu maximum. Ainsi il pourra mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and pesticides

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheng D., 37, works as a housewife, while her husband and her oldest son can collectively make only about US$ 2 each day from working as construction workers. The big expense for Mrs. Cheng D.’s family is supporting her other five school-going children. Day to day, she has concerns about her family’s income generation and she would like to raise her family's standard of living.

Mrs. Cheng D. has recently requested a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use to operate a motor-taxi. With a new motor-bike, she believes they will have more income which will enable her and her family to raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use to operate a motor-taxi

loans.name: Ida Isabel's Group

texts.en:
Pelaya, Ida, and Vilma have all been members of the community bank “Dignidad” for close to one year. In that time they have learned about punctuality, responsibility, and investing in their businesses.

Pelaya is 53 year old. She has been selling coca, the medicinal plant from which cocaine can be produced, in the region of Huancavelica for ten years. Pelaya buys coca in and around the city of Ayacucho and then travels between four and seven hours two or three times per week to sell in the neighboring region.

Ida Isabel is forty years old and has owned a restaurant for one and a half years. Before that she traveled around the region buying and selling fruit at different markets. Thanks to a loan from her community bank she was able to start her new business and is much happier.

Vilma is 28 years old and on Sundays she travels to different markets selling clothing. During the week she works at a day care. She has been doing this for one year.

Pelaya, Ida, and Vilma need loans of 400, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in expanding their businesses. They will buy more coca, a new refrigerator, and a larger variety of clothing. Pelaya, Ida, and Vilma dream of continuing to work, furnishing their homes, and that their children will have a better life

loans.use: Pelaya, Ida, and Vilma need loans of 400, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in expanding their businesses.  They will buy more coca, a new refrigerator, and a larger variety of clothing.

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: Araz is a low-income, vulnerable man. He is 22 years old and lives with his parents in a village near Saatli, in the central part of the Azerbaijan Republic. Araz has a herd of cattle. He started his business five years ago with one cow and has increased the number of cattle in the herd to five. He has applied for a $500 loan through the Normicro Saatli branch, which he plans to use to build a shed for his cattle.

loans.use: To build a shed for his herd of cattle

loans.name: Kurbonova

texts.ru:
H. Kurbonova is 53 years old and is the mother of 5 children. She is married and has a specialized high school education. She has been selling lingerie and clothing since 2005. She became a client of MircoInvest in 2006, when she had assets of $200. Prior to this she traded in different places without her own spot and with a small product assortment. Today her position is different, she has a permanent sales spot, a higher product assortment and she plans to transition to wholesale sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонова Хосият- 53 года, мать 5-ых детей. Замужем и образование средне специальное. Занимается торговлей нижней бельем и одеждами с 2005-го года. Стала кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвест в 2006-ом году с активами на 200 долларов. Перед этим она торговала в разных местах без собственного место деятельности и с не большим ассортиментом товара. Теперь дела обстоят иначе – у нее постоянная торговая точка, увеличился ассортимент, а в будущем хочет перейти на оптовую продажу

loans.use: Transition to wholesales sales

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun S., 52, and his wife married in 1978. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. One of their children married and lives outside the family home. Of their daughters, one works in a garment factory and other one is in school. Of their two sons, one has full time employment and other one does construction work with his father. The family is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Saroeun has been a mason for twenty-seven years. He does his work in his village and in nearby villages. His wife stays at home takes care of children.

Mr. Saroeun is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to use for work.

loans.use: For purchasing a motorbike to use for work

loans.name: Gwladys

texts.fr:
Born around 1956 in Sahoue, in the Mono department in southwest Benin, Mrs. Gwladys N. is retired from the Postal and Telecommunications Service in Benin. A mother of six children, two of whom still live at home, she is a trained hairdresser and has a beauty salon in her home. She also sells beauty products and various brands and types of hair extensions. In addition, she sells cloth that she displays in her salon. Considering her increased client base, Mrs. Gwladys N. is requesting a third loan in order to purchase more supplies and meet her customers’ needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1956 à SAHOUE dans le département du MONO au Sud-ouest du BENIN, dame N. Gwladys est retraitée de l’Office des Postes et Télécommunications du BENIN. Mère de 6 enfants dont 2 sont encore à sa charge, elle s’est formée en coiffure et a ouvert un salon de beauté à son domicile. Elle vend également des produits de beauté et différentes marques et qualités de mèches. Parallèlement, elle revend des tissus qu’elle expose dans son salon. Compte tenu de l’augmentation de sa clientèle, dame N. Gwladys introduit sa demande de renouvellement pour son troisième crédit afin d’augmenter son stock pour répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 15 dozen hair extensions, 15 cosmetic kits, 10 pieces of cloth and other beauty products

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a 45-year-old mother of 4 children. Ten years ago, Ama decided to sell charcoal at the Obuasi market. Since then, she has become one of the most popular charcoal sellers at the market. She has good customer relationships, which make customers enjoy buying from her all the time. Charcoal still remains the most popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes.

Ama will be using the loan to purchase charcoal in bulk and retail it to her customers for a profit. This, she believes, will decrease her costs significantly to enable her to raise a good income to support her children in school. She is a member of the community group called The Lord Is My Shepherd Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is married and since 2003 has made a living running a general store. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

In the past, Neema took out two loans from BRAC Tanzania and used them to successfully expand her business. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children between the ages of 20 and 5. She also takes care of one other person who is 55 years old. She has sold clothes since 2000. She works every day from 8 am to 4 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma, a 49-year-old divorced mother of one child aged three, has been a food seller since 1994. She works daily from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Fatma is now requesting a loan to buy more food items such as rice, wheat flour and beans for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en: Gulnoza K. is 27 years old. She is the loving mother of 2 adorable kids. Gulnoza and her husband are living together with her husband's parents. In order to help her husband to support their large family, Gulnoza started her own business. For the last 5 years, Gulnoza has been raising cattle and then selling them at the market. At the same time, she provides her family with milk products. With the help of loan, she plans to increase her livestock and also to construct a comfortable winter cowshed.

loans.use: To increase livestock and construct a winter cowshed

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La Sra. Irma López reside  en el bario Naciones Unidas, su esposo el Sr. Wilfredo Choque con el cual tienen 5 hijos, se dedica a la venta de piedra, arena Y ripio en la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, Bolivia. La actividad  principal de la señora Irma, es la venta de alimentos para animales, en el mercado central de la localidad de El Torno, Santa Cruz. Trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año 2004, comenta que desde entonces  se encuentra identificada con nuestra institución, nos considera unos de sus principales apoyos para que su negocio sea prospero, por tal motivo ella solo trabaja con nuestra entidad microfinanciera.
texts.en:
Irma López lives in the Nacional Unidas neighborhood. Her husband, Wilfredo Choque, with whom she has five children, sells stone, sand and rubble in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Irma's principle job is selling animal feed in the central market of El Torno, Santa Cruz. She has worked with our institution since 2004. She comments that since finding herself linked with our institution, she considers us to be one of her principle supporters of her business being successful. For that reason, she works only with our microfinance entity.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An increase in capital.

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.en:
B. Tutiniso has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. She has proven herself a serious and reliable client; she has not any problems with previous loan repayments.

Mrs. B. is engaged in the commercial service and trade. She has sold eggs in the Panjshanbe bazaar for the last 8 years. She is very polite and kind by nature, so she has a lot of repeat customers. Mrs. B. applies to KIVA for business development loan of 2300 STJ for 6 months to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: Increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Haydee Yovana

texts.es:
Haydee   es socia del Bancomunal Teresa de Calcuta. 
Haydee es casada, tiene 32 años y dos hijos  de 8 y 3 años.   
Tiene su negocio desde hace más de diez años, ella vende en el Terminal pesquero de Villa María del Triunfo vende pescado todos los días junto a tres  personas más.
Desde que esta en Finca le va bien ha podido invertir más  y con las ganancias que saca puede comprar más mercadería y ahorrar.

Haydee solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado y mariscos, ella compra por dobles al por mayor.
Su sueño con comprarse un terreno poder construirlo y también poder darle los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the communal bank Teresa de Calcuta. She is 32 years old, is married and has two children ages 8 and 3 years old. Haydee has had her business for more than ten years. She and three other people sell fish daily at the fish market at Villa Maria del Triunfo. Since she has partnered with FINCA she has done better and has been able to invest more. She has used her profits to purchase more merchandise and to save. Haydee is asking for a loan in the amount of $400 which she will invest in purchasing fish and seafood wholesale. Her dreams is to purchase land to build on and to provide her children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fish and seafood.

loans.name: Cristian Jackson

texts.es:
Con veintiocho años de edad Cristhian  maneja una pequeña empresa junto con el esposo de su hermana. Ambos manejan un negocio de repuestos de artefactos y venta de repuestos para cualquier electrodoméstico. Aunque el negocio tenga más años de los que él lleva trabajando ahí, fue con su entrada que cobro mayor fuerza y empezó a crecer. 

Anteriormente, él trabajaba solo como obrero de construcción pero fue su cuñado quien lo animó a integrarse al negocio de repuestos. Ahora a pesar de que dedica el mayor tiempo a su pequeña empresa, eventualmente trabaja también como obrero. Esto con el fin de poder ayudar también a su mama en los gastos del hogar.

En un futuro, junto con su cuñado, quisiera comprar otro local para abrir una sucursal de su negocio.
texts.en:
Cristhian, who is 28 years old, runs his own small business together with his brother-in-law. They run a store that repairs and sells electronics. Even though the business was already running, it didn't really picked up until he joined in. Cristhian worked in construction before but his brother-in-law convinced him to join the repair business. He dedicates most of his time running his small company, but he also works contruction whenever he can. He also helps his mother with the expenses in the home. In the future, along with his brother-in-law, he would like to buy a location to open up a second store.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the first payment for a new location

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 53-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mouhamad is a carpenter and he has owned a cocktail shop. Mouhamad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his cocktail shop as well as change its décor. Mouhamad has been a microcredit client for ten years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business as a carpenter and start a new work which was the cocktail shop. Mouhamad is very satisfied and grateful for the opportunity to work with A. Majmoua. His clients are his family members, friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on purchasing the cocktail shop.

loans.use: Mouhamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his cocktail shop as well as change its décor.

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Alvin T. is 25 years of age and works as a "tricycle" (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) operator in their village. He lives in Barangay Minante 2, about 3 kilometers away from the city of Cauayan proper. Alvin is still single. According to him, he does not want to hurry marrying his girlfriend because he believes that entering into married life needs proper planning since poverty strikes in their place.

Alvin is hardworking; he plans to use his loan amounting PHP 7,000 as additional capital for his livestock and barbecue business to help his parents. And the other part of the money will be used in purchasing motorcycle spare parts and equipment to repair his "tricycle". He is confident and proud enough to handle a business since according to him he has enough experience that made him tough.

loans.use: Additional capital for livestock and barbecue business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda M. C. is 28 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two young children. She sells shoes 6 days a week in the main market of Urubamba, a town in the Sacred Valley, about an hour outside of the city of Cusco. She has been in this business for the past 6 years.

Hilda is a member of the Sayhua 2 Village Bank, an experienced group that has been taking out loans from Asociación Arariwa for years. She is requesting a loan of 3,500 nuevos soles to buy a variety of different shoes for men, women, and children. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. Her goals for the future are to expand her business and save up enough money to buy her own house.

loans.use: Buy shoes for men, women, and children

loans.name: Marjie

texts.es: Marjie tiene 46 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 3 hijas que la apoyan mucho. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas) en un local alquilado, y para la atención cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas Para Marjie es muy importante dar una buena atención para que los clientes regresen en otra oportunidad. La rentabilidad de este negocio se basa en la demanda de estos productos en su región, ya que su ciudad es una muy calurosa y las personas están constantemente consumiendo bebidas heladas, además vende productos de marcas reconocidas y buena calidad a precios al alcance del cliente. Con MFP, ya tiene 10 préstamos y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque son personas responsables y unidas. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas, y el arreglo de su local para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marjie is 46 years of age and a single mother. She lives with her three daughters who help her out a lot. For the past three years she has been working selling beverages (beer and soft drinks) in a rented space. She relies on her daughters to help tend the shop. It is very important to Marjie that they give good service to the customers so that they will come back again. The profitability of this business depends on the products of the region. Now that her city is getting very hot and people are constantly consuming cold drinks. What's more, they sell well known and good qualtiy products at prices that the customers can afford. She has had ten loans now with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She likes working with her communal bank because they are all responible and united. The money being requested will be invested in the purchase of beverages, and on fixing up her shop so as to be more inviting to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory of beverages.

loans.name: Princevelle

texts.en:
Princevelle P. is a very young married woman. She is pregnant with her first child. She and her husband are finding it hard to survive with no fixed income. The couple lives in P5 Gango, Ozamiz City. Princeville has a Bachelor of Science degree in Hotel and Restaurant Management. Her husband works to support her, but his income is not enough, so she decided to engage in a sari-sari store business. Initially, she borrowed money from her mother to start up her business. Now, she wants to expand her business and build a bigger stall in order to earn more.

With the encouragement of her mother, one of our members, she joined Paglaum MPC. She has applied for an amount of PHP 7,000.00 for her business expansion and to prepare for the upcoming baby.

loans.use: To expand her sari-sari store business.

location.town: Ozamis-P5 Gango, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Vending of cooked foods, native cakes and vegetables is the chosen business of Lolita.  Her request of PHP 6,000.00 would be of great help for the growth of her small enterprise.  She sells her merchandise in their village in Sta. Ana, Echague, Isabela. 

Lolita has seven children, five of them are married and two are still studying: Elizabeth - 15 years old, fourth year high school and Frederick - 12 years old, grade school. She hopes that she may be able to support the education of their children and for them to become successful.

loans.use: Business growth

loans.name: Kibrie

texts.ru: Бакаева Кибрие проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 29 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Кибрие по специальности медсестра, но по специальности не работала. Она более 4 лет работает портнихой. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы закупить сырье для предоставления качественных услуг.
texts.en:
Kibrie B. lives in the Rumy district. She is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. Kibrie is a nurse by profession, but has not worked in her field. She has been working as a tailor for over 4 years. Our client is requesting this loan in order to buy raw materials to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita es socia del Bancomunal Las Amapolas.
Anita es casada tiene 52 años, dos  hijos  gemelos de 22  años y uno de 16 años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Anita   es de Cajamarca, llego a Lima a estudiar enfermería técnica, se puso a trabajar pero cuando  se caso y su esposo no quiso que trabaje con el tiempo abrió una tienda en su casa y  empezó vendiendo cerveza y gaseosa, poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio.
Desde que Anita esta en Finca empezó ahorrar y a superarse en el negocio.
Anita necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles para surtir su tienda, y comprar sacos de arroz, azúcar, harina, aceite y leche.
El sueño de Anita es crecer más en su negocio de bodega y poner una panadería
texts.en:
Anita is a member of the Communal Bank group called “Las Ampolas” (The Poppies). She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of three sons – a set of twins who are 22 years old, and a 16 year old who is studying at a state school.

Anita is from Cajamarca. She came to Lima to study nursing, but she went to work when she got married because her husband could not find a job. At that time, she opened a store from her home and began selling beer and sodas. Little by little she grew her business. Since then, Anita became a FINCA client. She began saving money and excelling in her business.

Anita needs a loan of 2400 soles to restock her store and buy bags of rice, sugar, flour, oil and milk. She dreams of expanding her grocery business and opening a bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, sugar, flour, oil and milk

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are currently in the senior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana.

Emilia is a food vendor. She prepares kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves -- often accompanied by fried fish) and sells it at the market square in her community. She also distributes the kenkey to other retailers and she treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She buys bags of maize from nearby communities.

Emilia has been in business for sixteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her children a quality education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Vicenta Eliana

texts.es:
La señora Vicenta es socia del banco comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 01 hijo, ella cuenta pudo estudiar educación secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años, su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar  sacos de sal para vender en forma ambulatoria.

Su deseo es convertirse en mayorista de venta de sacos de sal.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Señora Vicenta is an associate of the communal bank called "the 30th of August", in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 51 years old, a single woman and mother of 1 son. She tells us that she was able to complete secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 9 years. Her business is the sale of groceries. Her first loan was for 300 Soles, an amount that allowed her to acquire groceries. At present, she requires an additional loan and has requested 600 Soles. The loan will allow her to buy bags of salt to sell on foot. Her desire is to be become a wholesaler of salt bags. She likes saving.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy salt bags for resale.

loans.name: Zorayda Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Zorayda tiene 44 años de edad, casada. Reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, procreó dos hijos, que ahora tienen 12 y 14 años de edad que estudian la primaria. Ella trabaja de regente de Farmacia en una empresa ONG, y en tiempos libres vende cosméticos y prendas  de plata, ella comenzó con el deseo de obtener otros ingresos para sastifacer las necesidades de su hogar. Sus planes es poder tener su propia farmacia que espera en días no  muy lejano tener. Con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción para construir un muro y poder tener mejor seguridad y presentación de su vivienda. Se siente contenta por el apoyo de la institución ya que es su décimo ciclo el cual ha invertido en negocio y mejoras para su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zorayda is 44 years old and married. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in Managua, the capital. She has two sons, 12 and 14 years old who are in elementary school. She works as a manager of a pharmacy in an NGO. As the needs of her home increased, she sought other means of income and in her free time she sells cosmetics and silver jewelry. She soon plans to open her own pharmacy. With this loan she will buy construction materials to build a wall to have better security and presentation of her house. She’s very happy with the support of the microfinance institution as it is the tenth loan and has invested in her business and in improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs to use to make dishes to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana E. is a chicken raiser in their peaceful village of Rizaluna Cordon, Isabela. She is already 49 years old, she is married to Danny E. Sr. who is a house carpenter. They have been blessed with five children, one of them are already married and have their own family now. Her four children are still single and some of them are still studying. They are as follows: Joy-25 years old; Rica-22 years old; Danny Jr.-19 years old they are all high school graduate and the youngest is Debby-14 years old who is now a second year high school student. Juliana hopes that she could continue to support the schooling of her youngest daughter by making her business productive. 

		Juliana said that raising chicken is quite hard especially when she doesn’t have enough capital to buy for their needed feeds. Though it’s hard, Juliana still continue raising her chicken because it is beneficial to them particularly the profit they get from it. Juliana would like to develop her business but her capital is insufficient that is why she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP4, 000 for her business improvement.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Las Obreras Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Obreras” esta representado por la señora Carmen Delia y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales desempeñan diferentes actividades comerciales venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, refrescos, elaboración D. pan y masitas, venta D. comida, elaboración D. prendas D. vestir, repuestos, construcción y al trasporte público D. pasajeros todos los negocios se encuentran instalados en la zona D. Loreto. La competencia siempre existe por lo que ellas deben esforzarse el doble pA. lograr el ingreso diario que es necesario pA. el sustento D. su familia. El destino del crédito es pA. incrementar su capital D. operaciones que servirá pA. la compra D. materiales , insumos y algunas herramientas D. trabajo. En cuanto a al experiencia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en créditos mancomunados gracias a financiamientos en entidad similares a la fundaron Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The group "Las Obreras" is represented by Mrs. Carmen Delia and is maD. up of 12 members who carry out different business activities, such as selling groceries in neighborhood stores, selling soft drinks, making bread and dough, selling food, making garments, selling spare parts, construction work, and public transportation. All of these businesses are set up in the zone of Loreto. Competition always exists, so they must make twice the effort in order to achieve the daily income that is necessary for supporting their families. The purpose of the credit is to increase their job capital, which will assist them in purchasing materials and some work tools. In regards to experience, our partners already have experience with joint loans, thanks to financing in similar entities like Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Job capital

loans.name: Hnadi

texts.en:
Mrs. Hnadi, 38, lives in Nablus city of Palestine, where she has a beauty salon business. She attends to it everyday, offering stylist and cosmetology services to her customers.

Hnadi is asking for a loan of $2500 so she can purchase more cosmetics and hair products to meet the demands of her customers. Among her goals are letting her four children continue their studies so they can achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and hair products.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila, who is married with one child, sells men's clothing at the central market in Melitopol city. Ludmila has been in this business for 12 years, and during that time has developed her business well. She currently has three business locations and many repeated clients, and her goal is to open a small store to sell clothing. Ludmila would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventories, hoping to thereby increase sales and move closer to achieving her business goal.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
A business-minded woman from San Roque, Cardona in a beautiful province of Rizal has been engaged in her business for more than two years. Her business is direct selling of Avon products. She is also involved in the Fish Cage business. She believes that if her proposed loan is granted, it will be a big help for the expansion of her business. That is why she is very determined and disciplined to use the money which is lent to her. 

She disciplined herself to use all the money borrowed from ASHI, a KIVA partner, for her business to gain more profit. This profit is what she uses for daily expenses. She got involved with ASHI because of the family's dreams to send her children to school and finish their studies with a degree. She is a good mother of her two children and still dreams of the best for her family. She belongs to a poor family who needs help to change their standard of living and provide a beautiful house for her family in the future. All of these goals in life are supported by her loving husband, Norman A., a 23-year-old factory worker. Through the love between the couple, they are blessed with one child, Angelica A., 4 years old. This is the story of 28-year-old Gerlie A., a focused mother who is hopeful for her dreams.

loans.use: To purchse Avon products, bamboo, fish net, and "banyera" (a big basket) for fish

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali. Ella tiene 49 años, es madre D. seis hijos D. los cuales cuatro son mayores D. edad.
Teresa se dedica al alquiler D. cuartos desD. hace tres años y su negocio està creciendo progresivamente ya que se encuentra bien ubicado. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Libertadoras” desD. hace dos años y el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300.00 nuevos soles. Actualmente ella necesita un crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra D. paneles solares para ser colocados en los cuartos que alquila.  
La meta D. Teresa es construir màs cuartos para seguir alquilando y asì seguir generando màs ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa, 49, is a hard-working woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has 6 children, four of whom are adults. For the last 3 years she has rented rooms and her business has been steadily growing because it is well located. She has been a member of the "Las Libertadoras" communal bank for the last 2 years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles. Currently, she needs 300 new soles to buy solar panels to be installed in the rental rooms. Teresa's goal is to build more rooms to rent in order to continue to produce more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy solar panels to install in her rental rooms.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
La señora Elida B. la misma es casada posee casa propia es micro empresaria es propietaria de una finca agrícola en donde produce sus productos que luego comercializa en su puesto de venta que la misma cuenta con 20 años de entiguedad en el rubro lo que le perite contar con muy buena clientela he ingresos. 

El destino del crédito sera para compras de insumos limpieza de su huerta y compra de una vaca lechera para la produccion.
texts.en:
Elida B. is married and has her own home. She is a small business owner for a farm that produces goods that she later sells her farmstand. Having her stand for the last 20 years has allowed her to enjoy a good clientle and salary. This loan will be used toward the purchase of farming tools and a dairy cow for milk production.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farming tools

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old, is widowed, and has two infant children. Margie owns and operates a business selling a variety of different products like shoes, dresses, shirts and more ready-to-wear items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Margie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Marco Jara Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal "LAS TRIUNFADORAS D. MARCO JARA", D. Distrito D. Yarina coha, región Ucayali, está conformado por 10 socias.  Su primer préstamo fue D. 5,700 soles, dinero que permitió a las socias a implementar sus negocios.

Su presidneta es la señora Enith C. E., ella es una mujer muy laboriosa, vive en el Distrito D. Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 39 años, es madre D. tres menores D. edad, se dedica al sembrío D. camu camu (fruta D. la región), esta actividad la realiza en su chacra y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien es mecanico. La meta D. Enith es, tener un Minimarket y mas adelante un supermercado, en donD. se venda sus productos. 

Actualmente, requieren D. un préstamo D. S/ 4,600 soles, las socias utilizarán su crédito en los diferentes negocios que tienen, permitiendo que se desarrollen economicamente.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Triunfadoras D. Marco Jara," from the Yarina Coha district in the Ucayali region, is maD. up of 10 members. Their first loan was for 5,700 Peruvian soles, money that the members used to carry out their businesses. Their president is Enith C. E.; she is a hardworking woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucayali region. She is 39 years old and is the mother of 3 minor children. She cultivates camu camu (a native fruit of the region.) She carries out this activity on her farm and she has the support of her husband, who is a mechanic. Enith's goal is to have a Minimarket, and eventually, a supermarket, where she can sell her products. Currently they need a loan of 4,600 Peruvian soles. They will use this loan in the different businesses that they have, allowing them to develop economically.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: they will use the loan in the different businesses that they have

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: D. Félicité est née en 1972 et vit au quartier Sodjatimey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis neuf ans.  Mariée à GBEDO Pascal, un soudeur, Félicité est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à sa charge.  Félicité vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Félicité vend des gâteaux (fait à base de maïs, sucre, et lait) au ciné concorde à Cotonou, et parallèlememt, elle vend du « akpan » (bouillie faite à base de maïs).  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Félicité s’approvisionne.  Félicité exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Félicité a déjà bénéficié de quelques crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Elle sollicite un autre crédit pour acheter le maïs, le sucre, et du lait en boîte.
texts.en:
Félicité D. was born in 1972 and has lived in the Sodjatimey district of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin for the past nine years. She has four children, all of whom attend school and live at home. Félicité lives with her children and her husband. She is married to Pascal GBEDO, a welder. As a couple, they work together to meet the needs of the family. To meet their needs, Félicité sells biscuits (made from corn, sugar and milk) at the Concorde movie theater in Cotonou and also sells “akpan” (corn-based porridge). She started this business five years ago. Félicité gets her supplies at the Dantokpa international market in Benin. Félicité has previously taken out a few loans from ALIDé and has repaid them all. She is requesting this new loan to buy corn, sugar and canned milk.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, sugar and canned milk

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Mrs. Angelie U., is 30, married, and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is married to Renante.  They are blessed with 4 children, several of whom are pictured with Angelie.  Three of their children are infants, and the oldest is school-aged. 

Renante dives for shells, known locally as “amahong" and "burnay,” while Angelie sells the shells.  They have shared this livelihood for several years, and earn an average net income of about P5,000.00 a month.

Angelie joined the cooperative in the year 2008. Given her good credit record and capacity to pay, she has been approved for a loan of P14,000.00 to install electricity in her family's home, with the remainder to be used to support their business. The future income that results from this loan will be used for the family's daily basic needs, loan repayments and to save for their children’s future needs, especially in their education.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To install electricity and to support the family business.

loans.name: Rosie Serino Group

texts.en: Rosie S. is from the village of Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Rosie is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Rosie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Rosie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es: Abelardo R. P. es un hombre trabajador que se preocupa por el bienestar de la familia. El es padre de 3 mujeres por lo que el piensa en darles una mejora calidad de vida. La casa que el tiene es de interés social pero con el tiempo le fue haciendo mejoras y la vivienda ya es de dos plantas, pero le falta terminar con los acabados del baño es por eso que pide el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Abelardo R. P. is a hard-working man committed to ensuring the well-being of his family. He is father to 3 girls for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. He lives in social housing but over time he has made improvements and now it has two storeys but the bathroom is still unfinished. It is for this reason that he is asking for support to allow him to finish his project.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish off the bathroom of his house

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa A. W. deals in farming as a business in Lwanyange, Nambale division, Busia district. She started farming in 1986, the year that she quit her school matron job. She plants and harvests twice a year in tandem with the seasons, but also runs a few kitchen gardens in her homestead.

Teresa would like a loan of KES 20,000 to expand her farming area and to increase her food production. Her plans is to venture into a retail shop business in order to guarantee education for her 4 children.

loans.use: To expand the farming area.

loans.name: Progresando Group

texts.es:
“El banco comunal Progresando D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la  Asociación Arariwa es nuevo en su funcionamiento”.

Silberia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Progresando”  somos 10 integrantes (9 mujeres y 1 varón),  está en el primer ciclo y la junta directiva está conformada por Edith que es la presidenta, Eva que es la Tesorera,  Doris que  es la secretaria y Wilfredo que es el fiscal. Las reuniones  son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa seD. Cusco y en esta oportunidad  me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi principal actividad económica.  

Silberia, tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Silberia su principal actividad económica es brindar servicios D. cosmetología en el mercado el “Molino II” y se llama “Luyemi”. Antes, ella se dedica al negocio del turismo pero le fue regular. Silberia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que requiere el crédito para comprar una secadora D. cabello.   

La mayoría D. los socios son comerciantes por ejemplo algunos se dedican a la  venta D. comida, productos D. belleza,  ropa, pasto (comida para animales), cuyes y otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo son carpintero, guía D. turismo, cosmetología, etc.
texts.en:
The “Progresando” (Progressing) Communal Bank is a microfinance unit of Asociación Arariwa. This is a new group that just started operation.

Silberia says her Communal Bank consists of 10 members (9 women and 1 man). This is the group’s first loan and the board of directors consists of Edith who serves as president, Eva who serves as treasurer, Doris who serves as secretary, and Wilfredo who serves as auditor. Their meetings are held every thirty days at the central office of Asociación Arariwa, which is headquartered in Cusco. Silberia was provided the opportunity to represent her Communal Bank by giving her testimony about her main business activity. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Silberia provides cosmetology services from a salon called “Luyemi” in the Molino II Market. She previously worked at a travel business but found the work monotonous. Silberia is an enterprising and hardworking woman who needs a loan to buy a hair dryer.

Most of the members are merchants who sell food, beauty products, clothing, animal feed, guinea pigs, and provides services such as carpentry, guided tours, beauty consulting, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a hair dryer

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene C., 30 years old, is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is married and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living Arlene sells slippers and sandals in different sizes and also clothes for children in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Arlene joined HSPFI in 2009 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP which she used to purchase additional inventory. Arlene is requesting her second loan, for 7000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. .

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of photocopiers

loans.name: Ciprian

texts.es:
El Señor Ciprian T. P. de 29 años de edad, es soltero y trabaja para mantener a su familia, su madre y a sus dos hermanas menores ya que su padre falleció cuando el tenia 18 años y desde entonces el se hace cargo de su familia.

Ciprian T. P. es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, tiene un lote agrícola  en la colonia palmeras que está a 12 Km del camino a Ivirgarzama.- Puerto Villarroel, Quinta sección, el cultiva solamente cítricos como  mandarina, naranja, el cliente trabaja diariamente para el sustento de su madre y sus hermanas  para que en un futuro ellos tengan y gocen de las comodidades de las que él no gozo en su juventud.

El señor Ciprian se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para un reintegro para la compra de un vehículo para así poder facilitar el transporte de sus productos e incrementar la producción de cítricos y así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de su madre y sus hermanas y un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Ciprian T. P. is 29 years old and single. He works to support his family, which is comprised of his mother and his two younger sisters. His father died when Ciprian was 18 years old. He has been taking care of his family since then. Ciprian T. P. is a young man who is very devoted to his work. He has a small plot of farmland in the Palmeras neighborhood. It is 12 kilometers from the road to Ivirgarzama - Puerto Villarroel, Quinta Sección. He only grows citrus like tangerines and oranges. He works everyday to support his mother and his sisters. He does this so that in the future they can have and enjoy comforts that he did not have in his youth. Mr. Ciprian came to the offices looking for a loan to buy a vehicle. This would facilitate product transportation and increase his citrus production. Then he would be able to have greater earnings for his mother and sisters’ wellbeing and a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a vehicle to distribute fruit

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira D. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old, a widow, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $193 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Flamboyan Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek C. D. is a 25-year-old female living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Kadek is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Flamboyan (PK-10220).


Ni Kadek is married and has one infant-aged child.  To make a living, Ni Kadek owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Ni Kadek has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Kadek joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Kadek has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from MUK.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by Ni Kadek from MUK.  Ni Kadek plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Kadek C. D. (0) merupakan 25 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Kadek adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 11 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Flamboyan (PK-10220).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Kadek sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Kadek bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Kadek telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,000,000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha Q. sells foodstuffs at Takoradi.  Martha has attained senior high level of education.  She is married to a driver and has four children with him. She responsibly helps her husband in taking care of her children. Her loan will be used to buy additional foodstuffs for sale. She hopes to reinvest into her business, should there be any increase in her income.

loans.use: buy additional foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang M. is an older woman whose husband appears in the photo. Hang M. earns a living by selling fritters to nearby people who eat them as their snack foods. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a technical officer at the ministry of water resources and meteorology. Hang M. currently lives with two of her daughters who have already got good jobs. 

Hang M. is selling her items well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her clients. However, her profits are small as her business capacity is low due to insufficient financial capital. Hang M. wishes to have more cash to accrue her capital which will allow her to improve her income. This is why she has decided to look for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To accrue her capital.

loans.name: Dickson Kong'a

texts.en:
Dickson Kong'a K. is a 27-year-old businessman who lives in Eldoret town. He sells snacks to his customers at a profit. He is a single man. He has been in this business for the past two years and earns an income of KES 6,500 per month.

Dickson was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. He has no other history with any microfinance institution. He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase three crates of soda, cooking oil, baking flour, popcorn, and sweets. Adding these items to his stock will enable him to serve his customers well.

He hopes to expand his business and build a kiosk.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Haleluya Group

texts.en:
Genrose N. is in her late 40s and is widowed with three children. She has been running a charcoal business for the past five years. Her business is open between 6 a.m. and 7 p.m. daily and earns Genrose a good monthly profit.

This will be Genrose's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to increase her stock of charcoal in order to meet the demand of her clients. Genrose aims to use her third loan to once again increase her stock of charcoal. 

Genrose will share this loan with her loan group Haleluya, which totals 21 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the photo, Genrose can be seen in the back row, on the far right.

loans.use: Increase stock of charcoal

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Mrs. Pilar E. is 63 years old, a widow and blessed with three children who are now adults. She is from Bernad within the barangay of Aguada, a part of Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental province in the Mindanao islands. Pilar is presently engaged in selling barbecue and in RTW (ready-to-wear or used clothing) sales. She also receives a monthly pension and support from her son. She’s been in business for two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007 Pilar joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. As a member of PMPC under the pension loan program, Pilar was allowed to apply for a loan, her second from PMPC, of 30,000 PHP to be used for additional capital for her barbecue business and RTW sales. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, buying insurance and possibly expanding her businesses.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Mengsiluv

texts.ru: Рахмонова Менгсилув проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж, работает в ТАЛКО. Сама Менгсилув имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает овощи и приправы. В этой области более 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Mengsiluv  R. lives in Tursun-zoda. 41 years of age. Married, with five children. Her husband works for the Tajik Aluminium Company. Mengsiluv has received secondary education. She is a market vendor, selling vegetables and spices. She has been in this line for work for over 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a retail shop, whereby she sells sugar, rice and cereals from her home to her neighbours and passers-by. Flora faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sugar, rice and cereals for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice and cereals for resale.

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyz S. is the leader of this group loan. She is a resident of Balykchi, a nice town in the Isykul region. Jyldyz is 26 and married. Her husband works in construction. Together they are bringing up a daughter and a son. Both children are preschool age.  

Two years ago, with the initial investment of 15000 KGS, Jyldyz rented a space and started to sell clothes to make money. In this way she earns 10500 KGS per month. That profit made it possible for her to save money and purchase her own space. 

Jyldyz applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase jeans, sportswear and other clothes in order to increase the turnover of her products. In the future she wants to expand her business and build a big house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff

loans.use: To purchase clothes for sale

loans.name: Estrellas De Plan Autopista Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento ESTRELLAS D. PLAN AUTOPISTA es un banco nuevo, y la Sra. ARMINDA Tiene a su cargo la presidencia, ella se dedica a la venta comida en una parada D. minibús y  con el prestamos otorgado comprara insumos y abarrotes para la elaboración D. sus ricos platillos, así para poder seguir adelante y mejorando sus ingresos, ella es un apersona muy trabajadora. 
El Sr. CESAR ocupa el cargo D. secretario en el banco es una persona joven y se dedica a la venta D. celulares y es cajero en una empresa y con el préstamo a comprara celulares D. diferentes marcas y así variar su mercadería es soltero y muy pronto desea formar una familia.
Todas las socias son personas trabajadoras y con ganas D. superación se dedican a distintas actividades y están muy agradecidas con la institución.
texts.en:
'Estrellas D. Plan Autopista' is a new community bank.  Arminda is the group's president.  She sells meals at a minibus stop and will use her loan to buy supplies and groceries for making her rich dishes so that she can continue making progress and improving her sales.  Arminda is a very hard-working person.

Cesar is the group's secretary.  He is a young man who sells cell phones.  He is also a cashier in a company.  He will use his loan to buy different brands of cell phone so that he can offer a wider variety of merchandise.  Cesar is single and very soon he would like to have a family.

All the members of the group are hard-working people who have a desire to improve themselves.  They engage in a number of different business activities and are very grateful to our institution.

loans.use: To buy supplies and groceries

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 30 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements, des condiments, du lait et du savon                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des habillements, des condiments, du lait et du savon                                                                         
AMINATA S. s’approvisionne en condiments au marché de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of Laïdou group are all married, are on average 30 years old with five children, and live in traditional extended families in the Banankabougou district of  the city of Fana, in the Dioïla prefecture of the Region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through family ties and are in the business of selling clothing, condiments, milk and soap.
The women of Laïdou group are on their sixth joint loan which will be used to buy clothing, condiments,  milk and soap.
AMINATA S. gets her supplies of condiments at the market in Fana.   She makes her sales daily from her home, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed mainly of women.
She plans to make a monthly profit of 25,000 CFA which will be used to pay the interest on the  loan and to pay for contributions to social ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her business of selling condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Phakna

texts.en: Mrs. Phakna M. is 25 years old and her husband, Mr. Vebull Ni is 27 years old. They have been married since 2003 and have two daughters. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh. In the past, Phakna was a weaver but  she quit her weaving business and now the family's main source of income is from her husband’s business. He is a wooden-house constructor. Phakna applies for a loan of $800 to repair the walls of her house and to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To repair the walls of her house and to build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: La señora Reyna Vázquez M., se encuentra localizada en Huitzililla, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 49 años de edad, estudio hasta el 2º. Año de primaria y después la termino en el INEA. Ella es soltera tiene 3 hijos Xochitl de 32 años de edad vive en unión libre, Maycot de 30 años de edad es soltero,  José Aurelio de 26 años de edad se fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar, ella tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y solicito su crédito para comprar aceite, refrescos sopas, toallas, arroz, papel higiénico y productos de abarrotes para surtir su negocio, ella ofrece a sus clientes azúcar, jabón, aceite, queso, crema, salchicha, chorizo, tocino, arroz, frijol, huevo, alcohol, shampoo etc. Su tienda se llama Abarrotes la Perla, este negocio lo inicio hace 20 años por necesidades ella enviudo muy joven y sus hijos estaban muy chiquitos y de su negocio los fue criando, anteriormente ella vendía comida, su negocio es importante para tener ingresos , para ayudarse y tener una actividad para trabajar, a ella le gusta mucho preparar la comida todavía vende comida cuando llegan a trabajar al campo llegan de fuera y ella les da de comer a los trabajadores, ella está orgullosa con su negocio por que tiene dinero, porque tiene para todo, y que saco a sus hijos adelante, sus clientes son los vecinos, las familias, su negocio es popular por el buen trato al cliente y los atiende desde las 7:00 de la mañana, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de una tienda enseguida de la suya  y un puesto de verduras, ella atiende a sus clientes desde las 7:00  de la mañana, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para volver a invertir, la señora Reyna quiere ampliar su negocio hacer su tienda como súper y lo piensa lograr trabajando y con lo que le den sus hijos, le ayudan en el negocio sus hijos  atendiendo a los clientes. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia a que crecieran sus hijos, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son echarle colado a su casa y a su cocina cuando llueve hay goteras, sus esperanzas y sueños son tener dinero para su vejez y casarse, la señora Reyna esta muy contenta con este préstamo que le dieron sabe que tiene esta responsabilidad y va a pagar, las mejorías que dese para el futuro de sus hijos son dejarles un buen futuro económico y este préstamo le va a ayudar invirtiendo en el negocio y trabajando. La señora Reyna quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les doy las gracias porque nos dan buen apoyo y la confianza con este crédito para que mi negocio siga trabajado. Huitzililla es un pueblo tranquilo no hay delincuencia, hay campo, hay vegetación.
texts.en: Mrs. Reyna Vázquez M. lives in Huitzililla, Ayala city, in the state of Morelos, México. She is 49 years old and finished the second grade of primary school and later finished in INEA. She is single and has 3 children. Xochitl is 32 years old and in a common law marriage. Maycot is 30 eyars old and is single. José Aurelio is 26 years old and went to the United States to work. She has her own grocery store business and asked for the loan to buy oil, soft drinks, towels, rice, toilet paper and grocery products to supply her business. She offers her customers sugar, soap, oil, cheese, cream, sausages, chorizo, bacon, beans, eggs, alcohol, shampoo etc. Her store is called Abarrotes la Perla. She started this business 20 years ago out of neccesity. She was widowed very young and her children were very small. She raised them in her business. Previously, she sold food. Her business is important for her income. It helps her and gives a an activity to work at. She really likes to prepare food and still sells food when they come in from working in the fields. They workers arrive and she feeds them. She is proud of her business because she has money for everything she needs. She has been able to get her children ahead. Her customers are her neighbors and relatives. Her business is popular because of the good customer service. Her business faces competition from a store close to hers and a vegetable stand. She starts serving customers at 7:00 in the morning. She uses the earnings from her store to re-invest. Reyna wants to grow her store into a supermarket and she plans on doing it with work and what her children can give her. Her children help her in the business, serving customers. Her business has helped her family by helping her raise her children. The improvements she wants to make on her house are puting a roof on the house and the kitchen, since there are leaks when it rains. Her hopes and dreams are to have money for her old age and to marry. Reyna is very happy with the loan that was given to her. She knows she has the reponsibility and she is going to pay. The improvements she wants for her children's future are to give them a good financial future and this loan will help by investing it in the business and in work. Reyna wants to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad that “I thank you because you have given us good support and trust with this loan so that my business can keep on going. Huitzililla is a quiet town and there is no crime. There are fields and vegetation."

loans.use: To buy oil, soft drinks, soups, towels, rice, toilet paper, etc., to supply her business.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Hector, de 34 años de edad, natural del distrito de Anco, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador; habita en la comunidad de Santa Rosa donde construyó con mucho esmero su propia casa. La labor que realiza Hector es labrar la tierra, donde tiene plantaciones de cacao y café. Sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra y gracias a ellos, lleva trabajando 15 años y hasta el momento trabaja en sus propias terrenos; es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo. En los días  de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de trasladar los productos cosechados hasta cierto tramo; para luego poder comercializarlo. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias; cuenta que la estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las lluvias son constantes así imposibilitando el rendimiento en su trabajo. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras y variar sus plantaciones, para  así darle una buena estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Este es su Primer crédito de Hector con MFP, por lo cual se siente contento de abonar puntualmente en sus cronogramas de pago. Con los dos mil  nuevos soles solicitados, comprará fertilizantes y abono para mejorar los frutos  de sus plantaciones y así obtener buenas cosechas.
texts.en:
Héctor, 34, is from Anco district.  He is a cheerful, hard working young man. He lives in the community of Santa Rosa where he built his own house with much dedication.  Héctor works the land.  He’s a farmer growing cocoa beans and coffee.  His parents taught him to till the soil and thanks to them he has been working for 15 years and to date works his own fields; he is well aware of how hard working the fields is.

During harvest time he hires day laborers who are the ones that transport the harvested goods a certain distance to be sold.  He feels very committed to his work because thanks to his daily effort he enjoys seeing that his plants are productive thus leading to good profits.  He tells us that he doesn’t enjoy winter much because during those months insects are abundant and rain is constant thereby making his work less productive.  In time he’d like to buy more land and diversify his crops to provide better economic stability to his future family.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is happy to repay on time.  He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy fertilizer and manure to improve his crops thus obtaining better harvests.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, D. 57 años, es una D. aquellas mujeres que cuidan D. la armonía D. los suyos. Junto a su esposo Santos cuidaron D. sus 9 hijos, los que ahora ya son mayores, pero constantemente visitan a sus padres en el caserío D. Huallquin, que es lugar donD. viven. Como buena mujer del campo; ella se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Sus 30 años D. experiencia le enseñaron a trabajar con ahínco para poder obtener buenas ganancias. Sus principales sembríos constan D. habas, arveja, olluco y papa, los que después D. cada cosecha; comercializa en el mercado mayorista D. su ciudad. Asimismo las 7 vacas que posee le brindan buena leche, con lo que hace un promedio D. 35 quesos a la semana, los cuales lleva a una tienda reconocida D. la ciudad. Ahora ella desea aumentar la producción D. leche D. sus vacas y D. esa manera obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer renovado”, y este es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, donD. es una tesorera responsable y cumplida. Juana, esparcirá entre sus terrenos agrícola semillas D. pasto, para que se alimenten las vacas que posee, asimismo invertirá en la compra D. una nueva vaca lechera.
texts.en:
Juana, 57, is one of those women who always see that her loved ones are in harmony.  Together with her husband, Santos, they cared for their nine children who are all now adults who constantly visit their parents in Huallquin which is where they live. 

Like a good woman of the land, she farms and raises animals.  Her 30 years experience has taught her to work with dedication to obtain good profits.  Her main crops are lima beans, peas, olluco (a tuber) and potatoes which she sells in her city’s wholesale market once harvested.  In addition, the seven cows she has produce good milk with which she makes, on average, 35 cheeses per week that she takes to a well-known store in the city.  She wants to increase her cows’ milk production to earn better profits.

She is a member of the “Nuevo Amanecer Renovado” (New Renewed Dawn) communal bank and this is her 6th loan with MFP where she is a responsible, dependable Treasurer.  

Juana will spread grass seed throughout her fields so that the cows she has can something to eat; she will also buy a new dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy pasturage seed so her cows can eat; she will also buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer is a married, 57-year-old, very active woman. She does not have any children, and she lives with her husband in a 2-room brick house in the colony of Fateh sher in Sahiwal, where she has lived for the past 30 years. Sahiwal, she explains, is a small city in Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. Her husband is 64 years old, and his name is S. A.. He works in court with a lawyer. By doing so, he has an extensive knowledge of the law and court matters.

To earn a living, Answer operates a jewelry-making business. At the same time, she effectively manages her household responsibilities. Due to the high-quality service she provides, she has both commercial (different jewelers throughout the city) and residential clients (community members who place regular orders with her).

Anwer hopes that her loan application through Asasah will benefit her jewelry-making business by increasing her profits. With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy wires, beads, and glue in bulk, which she will use to make jewelry in bulk for re-sale purposes. This would be her first loan through Asasah, and she plans on saving the money she expects to earn as a result of the loan for when she is older.

loans.use: To purchase wires, beads, and glue in bulk for her jewelry-making and -selling business

loans.name: Mercedes Moserrate

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Creciendo Para El Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el sector conocido como Parque Forestal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce porque en él hay un bello parque, además por su exuberante vegetación y por sus bellos paisajes.

La señora Mercedes es socia fundadora del Banco comunal 10 años, es la tesorera del banco y le gusta porque se divierte en las reuniones. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijas las cuales ya son mayores de edad, sus hijas viven en casa de su suegra. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz.
