Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo, el mismo que tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz, nos cuenta que su esposo se especializa en maquinarias pesadas por lo cual es muy común que algunas veces se desplace a otros lugares donde están las maquinas dañadas para darles mantenimiento, él trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Nos cuenta que desde pequeño él aprendió esta actividad y que antes trabajaba con su papá pero que hace 10 años se independizo.

Este crédito es para comprar ciertas piezas y repuestos para su trabajo.

Su sueño es tener su casa bien acabada.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Creciendo para el Futuro' (Growing for the Future) community bank meets in a sector known as 'Parque Forestal', in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its beautiful park and also for its lush vegetation and beautiful landscape.

Mercedes is a founding member of her community bank.  She has been a member for 10 years and is the bank's treasurer.  She likes being a member because she enjoys herself at the meetings.  Mercedes is 47 years old, married, and has three grown-up daughters.  Her daughters live in her mother-in-law's house.  Mercedes' husband is a car mechanic.

Mercedes is a good housewife who is taking this loan for her husband's business.  Her husband has a garage.  She tells us that her husband specializes in heavy machinery so he often has to travel to other places where the damaged machines are in order to repair them.  He works every day from 8.00am to 8.00pm and sometimes until even later.  Mercedes tells us that he learned his trade when he was very young.  He used to work with his dad but he started working for himself 10 years ago.

Mercedes will use this loan to buy certain pieces and spare parts for her husband's work.  Her dream is to have her house nicely finished.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline T. is from the city of Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old. Evangeline is married. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase dried fish, bagoong, rice and corn grits for sale. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, bagoong, rice and corn grits for sale.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Guaraguaos del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza hace 6 años. Adicionalmente es agricultor siembra mango y cacao.

El desea adquirir alimentos balanceado y animales, asi también comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 52, is a mother of a family who lives with her husband and her son in the Guaraguaos settlement of the Tambogrande district -- an agricultural district located in the Piura region, more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Blanca makes her living by raising and commercializing sheep livestock. She raises the animals in the backyard of her home and when they reach a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the merchants who visit the area. She has been in this business for over six years. In addition, she also grows mango and cacao.

Blanca would like to purchase livestock and balanced animal feed as well as manure for her crops. That is why she decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Maria Fany

texts.es:
María es una mujer soltera de 39 años de edad, tiene casa propia, contando con los servicios de agua luz solamente, la  casa está ubicada en el caserío Las Mónicas que pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande a una hora aproximadamente de la provincia de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla María es ha la venta de productos de primera necesidad (venta de arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, etc.), en su propio domicilio desde hace unos 4 años, al encontrarse su negocio en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse de otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para su uso personal.
El crédito solicitado por María a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos una vez que sus ventas aumenten.
El sueño de María es tener más adelante una tienda más grande que le genere mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y lo logrará con su trabajo y empeño.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and single.  She owns her own home which only has running water and electricity.  It is located in the village of Las Mónicas, in Tambogrande district, approximately one hour from Piura province.  This is an area whose residents work in agriculture, livestock raising and tourism.

María sells essentials such as rice, milk, oil and sugar from her own home.  She has been in this business for four years.  As her business is located in her home, she is able to serve in it at any time which allows her to differentiate herself from other stores and thereby make more income for her personal use.

María is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy a larger quantity of merchandise.  She will then expand her business with other products once her sales increase.

María's dream for the future is to own a larger store which will make her more income so that she can improve her quality of life.  She will achieve this through her hard work and determination.

loans.use: to buy more products and expand her store

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans de familles monogames, les huit femmes du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Angoulême  de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Médine de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de charbon de bois, de bois de chauffe, de chaussures, de pagnes brodés et d’échalotes. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  200 kg d’échalotes avec les forains de Niono au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait en détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché Médine à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Fatoumata  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif à l’image des autres membres du groupe de devenir grossiste dans l’activité qu’elle mène.
texts.en:
The eight women from the Benkadi group are on average 39 years old and have on average 5 children. They are married and for the most part in monogamous families. They all live in the Angouleme quarter of Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, and their income generating activities at Segou’s Medine market. The members of the group sell wood coal, firewood, shoes, embroidered “pagnes” [colorful wrap around fabric] and shallots.

In order to increase their working capital the members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan.

Mrs. Fatoumata wants to use her loan to buy 200 kg of shallots from Niono's itinerant merchants at the Grand Market of Segou. She sells retail for cash or on credit from her house or at the Medine market to customers who are both men and women. 

Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 17,000 Francs CFA and will use it to be reinvested in her activity and to cover the health expenses of her children. Her goal, just like the other group members, is to become a wholesaler in her line of business.

loans.use: to purchase shallots

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana es una madre de familia tiene 36 años de edad, ella es  soltera, cuenta con casa propia la cual está ubicada en le un sector llamado La Campiña en el distrito de Cayalti, situado aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ana se dedica a la comercialización de compra y venta de ropa, para damas y caballeros dicha labor la realiza todo l día.  Y está ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad.  Además se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, este negocio lo desarrolla en los distintos caseríos cercanos a  Cayalti  o en el mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

 Ana está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para poder invertir en su negocio de ropa y haci poder seguir ampliando sus estock de mercadería.

Ana desea mejorar su calidad  de vida, con esfuerzo y trabajo. Cuenta con buenas referencias , las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother who is 36 years of age. She lives in her own home in the subdivision of La Campiña in the District of Cayalti, which is approximately one hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Ana buys and sells clothing for men and women. She works all day at the central market in the city. In addition, she sells small animals that she raises in pens located behind her home. The animals are sold in different villages near Cayalti or at the Modelo Market in the city of Chiclayo.

Ana is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can invest in her clothing business. She will be able to continue increasing her inventory of merchandise.

Ana wants to improve her quality of life through effort and work. She has good references. The people who know her describe her as a peaceful and responsible individual.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her clothing business.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells bread, biscuits & canned goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, bread, eggs & detergents.

Medarda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Medarda hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bread, eggs & detergents.

loans.name: Canter Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 20s, is married with one pair of twins who go to school. She has had a business selling charcoal at a place called Mbezi for two years now. She works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This will be Fatuma's second loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to buy land, increase her charcoal stock and pay household expenses. She paid back that loan successfully.
Fatuma now hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She will share this loan with her loan group "Canter", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. Fatuma's dream is to one day have an individual loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marly Yensy

texts.es:
Al lado de su madre Marly Yensy aprendió el oficio de las confecciones, el cual se ha convertido en una fuente importante de ingresos para aportar al cubrimiento de los gastos del hogar y al mismo tiempo estar al lado de su hija de 19 meses. 

Tener un taller de confecciones en el que además de mejorar su calidad de vida pueda generar empleo es el sueño de Marly. Por ahora y con el objetivo de estar cada vez más cerca de sus sueños, esta emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadota que le permita agilizar sus procesos y así poder atender cada vez más clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marly Yensy learned dressmaking alongside her mother.  This has become an important source of income for her to cover household expenses while being able to spend time with her 19-month-old daughter.

Marley’s dream is to have a sewing shop that besides improving her quality of life can also generate employment.  For now and with the goal of having her dream come true ever nearer this entrepreneur needs a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine that will make it possible for her to do her work more quickly in order to be able to tend to more customers which will lead to increased income.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 9 children. 

Enriquita has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Enriquita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.  She grows a vegetable garden and sells eggplants & string beans. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetables.

Leonarda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leonarda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetables.

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut is 42 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali.  Ni Ketut often helps her husband. She also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for eight years.  

Ni Ketut is the head of the Tunjung Wiguna group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s third loan with MUK.  With the Rp 1,500,000 that Ni Ketut receives, she will purchase three or four piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork. With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: To purchase three to four piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro de 57 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadería.

Isidro desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para realizar la compra de una mototaxi para poder movilizarse con mayor facilidad, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Isidro es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejore económicamente para tener otras comodidades y oportunidades.
texts.en:
57-year-old Isidro lives with his family in his own home which doesn't have basic services.  His home is located in the rural part of Olmos district, in Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for its farming and livestock raising.

Isidro has been raising and selling goats for some years.  His pen is located behind his home.  It is suitable and spacious.  He feeds his animals balanced feed and natural fodder so that they achieve an optimal level of growth and he is able to sell them in the different markets in the area, thereby making very good profits with which to cover his family's daily expenses.

Isidro has requested a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a motorcycle taxi so that he can get around more easily.  He will use his income to repay his loan and improve his family's quality of life.  Isidro is a hard-working and very responsible person.  The only thing he wants is for his family to do well and improve financially so that they can enjoy more comforts and opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi so that he can get around more easily

loans.name: Pepito

texts.en:
Pepito is a 53 year old married man.  He lives with his wife and children and is engaged in an agricultural business.  He keeps livestock. 

With the loan's help, Pepito will increase the number of livestock in his business and purchase feed and vitamins for his hog raising business.  That will help him raise quality pigs to sell in the future.  This will make Pepito's dream of having a big piggery farm come true.   Increased income means a brighter future for Pepito and his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 45 лет, замужем и воспитывает двух детей. Супруг Эльмиры работает таксистом. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, Эльмира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве еще  1991 году,   использовав для этого стартовую сумму 35,000 сом (KGS). Успешно работая в сфере животноводства и имея доход от продажи молочных продуктов, Эльмира также выращивает кормовые культуры на участке в 1,16 га, что позволяет ей обеспечивать кормами свой скот и иметь дополнительный доход от продажи кормов. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. На прибыль от кредита Эльмира планирует закупить стройматериалы для постройки своего дома.
texts.en: Elmira is 45 years old, married and is raising two children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  In order to find a financial support source for her family, Elmira started her own animal husbandry business in 1991, using a starting capital of 35,000 som (KGS).  Successfully working in the animal husbandry field and having an income from sales of milk products, Elmira also grows cereal crops on a 1.16 hectare plot of land, which allows her to provide fodder for her livestock and have an additional income from the sale of fodder.  In order to further develop her business, Elmira requested a loan in the sum of 55,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls.  She plans to use the resulting profit from the loan to buy construction materials for building her own house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
At her age of 51, Elizabeth still works hard to improve her family's living conditions. She enjoys her daily routine in her retail store. She operates her business in front of her house. Elizabeth sells food and daily-use products, such as soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, and milk. She had been managing her business for almost three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. 

She has seven children. Four of them are married and live on their own. The rest of her children attend school and have daily needs.

Elizabeth is now asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, bread, eggs, instant noodles, coffee, and sugar. She needs to stock more grocery items in her store to increase her sales. 

In the future, she wants to establish a larger store to meet all her customers' demands for high-quality products. She wants to immediately get the attention of people in her neighborhood who might need an item such as a sachet of shampoo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, bread, eggs, instant noodles, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Las Flores De Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS FLORES DE NUEVO AMANECER” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de mantas, venta de muebles, venta de dulces, venta de comida, venta de polleras.

La señora María  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles usados que viene trabajando hace un año atrás, aprendiendo este oficio de su tío. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de muebles.) que comprará de las barracas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su local. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención.
texts.en: The 'Las Flores de Nuevo Amanecer' community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office. This group has six members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Maria. The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling blankets, selling furniture, selling sweet treats, selling food and selling polleras (traditional skirts). Maria tells us that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer which she joined through an invitation from a loan officer. She currently has a business selling used furniture. She has been in this business for one year and learned the trade from her uncle. Maria will use this loan to increase her capital (buying furniture). She will buy her products in builders' yards and then sell them from her sales location. This work allows her to make the money she needs to support her family. She is married and has six children. When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maria replied that she likes the service.

loans.use: to buy [used] furniture

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Rahel is a 41-year-old mother of two school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Rahel has operated as a fishmonger for the past five years; her potential clients are the local area's residents. She faces the major challenge of changes in the demand for her products. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 80,000 loan, she wants to start a shylocking (money lending) business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because they offer efficient financial services.

loans.use: To start a shylocking (money lending) business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La socia Paulina compra y vende granos secos como habas, frejoles, maíz de variedades, arbejas, cebada, trigo, y otros cereales tambien; la socia tambien vende maíz para la siembra, en esta ocasion la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de maíz para vender para la siembra y comprar cereales y granos secos para vender en su stand. La socia desea seguir creciendo economicamente para dar a sus hijos calidad de vida; la socia con el ingreso de sus ventas ha ido comprando su terrenito y construyendo junto a sus conyugue su vivienda. La socia desea invertir el prestamo para comprar maiz y granos para incrementar us negocio.
texts.en: The member, Pauline, buys and sells dried grain such as broad beans, kidney beans, different kinds of corn, peas, barley, wheat and other cereals. The member also sells corn for sowing. On this occasion, the member would like to invest the loan in the purchase of corn which she will sell for sowing, and also dried cereals and grains which she will sell at her stand. The member wants to continue to develop economically in order to provide her children with a good quality of life. With the income achieved from her sales, the member has bought her own small plot of land and built her home with her spouse. The member wants to invest the loan in the purchase of corn and grain to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and grain to improve her business.

loans.name: Celina Del Sagrario

texts.es:
Celina, vive con sus hijos, quienes estudian, ella tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos; Celina se dedica a la venta de juguetes, tiene más de 10 años de estar en dicho negocio, sus lugares de venta son las escuelas, fuera de las iglesias y en los parques.
Actualmente Celina solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes, dicha compra le ayudara para obtener nuevos muñecos, y juguetes de entretenimiento para los niños.
Las aspiración de ella es abastecer el negocio con este préstamo, para prepararse para la etapa de navidad, de esta manera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Celina, 47, lives with her three children, who are in school. She has sold toys for over ten years. She sells in schools, outside of churches, and in parks.
She currently needs a loan for the purchase of toys; she will buy new dolls and toys for entertaining children.
She hopes to stock her business with this loan, in order to get ready for the Christmas season. This will increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a resident and a farmer in the Muranga area of Central Kenya. He is aged 50 and married with 3 children; the first two are adults. His farm produce of milk and tea go to the local market. He also gets additional income from his retail business in the local market.

James has made a loan request from Juhudi Kilimo for 63,600 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will help improve the family livelihood. He intends to do intensive breeding once his dairy business is well established.

He adds the future will be great with the financial services available from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ganga Maya

texts.en:
Ganga Maya is 40 years old. She is married and has two children who are 15 and 5 years old. In 2004, she established her tailoring business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Ganga Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where storeowners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw material

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 38 years old, married to Anjwang, and they have three children. She has been running a fish-selling business for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 6000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET of Kes 20,000. She plans to use the loan to buy more fish. With anticipated profits she will educate her children and expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to open a hotel business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to stock for sale.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, 39, is married, resides with her mother, her grandmother, her husband and her four children in Banteay Mean Chey Province, Cambodia.  She is a tailor.  Her husband is a goods carrier who carries goods from the truck to store in the warehouse.  One of her children is employed in the RACHA organization. 

Sopheap is requesting a loan of USD 500 to pay for her child’s school fees.  By doing so, her child would be able to finish their university degree and find a job to make money to support the family.  In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of clothes and tailoring

loans.name: Novrasta

texts.en: Novrasta came to Baku from the Qazax district of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 2000. In 2005-2006 she borrowed a total of $1300. Now she wants to borrow 800$ to buy more materials for the business.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Alfredo Abílio

texts.en:
Alfredo Abilio S. is 68 years old; he was born and raised in Machanga, a Sofala province. Alfredo had limited opportunities to attend school, because during colonial rule the indigenous population was not allowed to attend school above 4th grade level. Since 1987, Alfredo has been working in agriculture. He owns a 12 hectare plot in the district of Boane. In 2007, he heard about HLUVUKU-ADSEMA through friends. Alfredo learned more about the conditions for access to loans, and decided to request a loan in order to expand his farming area. With the 25.000,00 MT loan, he intends to expand his maize farming area from 3 hectares to 6 hectares, to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and to clear and prepare plots, consequently increasing his production. Alfredo currently employs 3 full-time workers. With the increase of his farming area he plans on hiring 3 more permanent workers, in addition to hiring temporary workers which will be needed when the work load so requires. Alfredo’s activities have a great impact in his community because he generates work for 6 community members, and income for their families. His work also makes corn available for the local market and provides grains, in great quantities, for the Malanga market, located in the city of Maputo.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva volunteer.

Localizacao: Pequenos Libombos - Boane Cliente: Alfredo Abilio S. Sector de actividade: Agricultura Valor do empréstimo: 25.000.00MT (1,000.00US$) Aplicação de montante: Compra de ínsumos agrícolas Inicio: 10/04/2007 Fim: 30/09/2008 Alfredo Abilio S. de 68 anos de idade, natural de Machanga, provincial de Sofala, cresceu sob responsabilidade, teve poucas oportunidades de estudar, pois na altura da dominação colonial a população indígena não podia estudar para além da 4@classe. Desde o ano de 1987 que vem trabalhando na área de agricultura e possui uma parcela de 12 hectares no distrito de Boane. No ano 2007 teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA através de amigos tendo aproximado, depois de informado das condições de acesso, decidiu solicitar um empréstimo para ampliação sua área de produção. Com o empréstimo de 25.000,00MT, pretende aumentar o volume a área de produção de 3 para 6 ha de milho e compra de insumos agrícolas (adubos e sementes), assim como preparação do terreno (lavouras), e consequentemente vai aumentar a sua receita. Actualmente conta com conta com três (3) trabalhadores efectivos e, com aumento da área de produção ira contratar mais outros três (3), para além de mão de obra eventual que sempre é necessária quando o trabalho assim o exige. A sua actividade tem um grande impacto na comunidade, porque para alem de providenciar emprego a meia dúzia de chefes de famílias, coloca milho a disposição no mercado local e abastece em grandes quantidades o mercado da Malanga que localiza-se na cidade do Maputo.

loans.use: To buy seeds and land Preparation

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en: Q. Tofiq is 21 years old. He is a young businessman and owner of a small farm. Aqroinevst CU has approved his application this year for a 1200 USD loan to purchase 1 cow and 1 calf.

loans.use: Purchase of one cow and one calf

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is single. He runs a small business selling antennas, phones and bags in the local market of Vasilyevka. He is a skillful manager who knows how to survive in an aggressive market economy environment. Alexander has been in this business for over 10 years. Currently, his monthly profit is about $500. 

Alexander’s consistency, perseverant work and commitment to his business have ensured the growth and success of his small venture. He always treats people with respect which is one of the most effective methods of providing his business with a solid foundation. He also has a unique ability to reach and maintain the right customers. Moreover, Alexander is always willing to help his clients with some tips which oftentimes is something much needed. Alexander is very hard-working and finds time not only to do his business but also take care of his elderly father who needs much attention and help. At the moment he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase the inventory for sale in his kiosk. One of his long-term plans is to open his own little store facility.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory for sale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
ISABEL is 42 years old, she has 2 children, and she has a mini-market on her house where she sells: oil, sugar, salt, cookies, drinks, pasta, etc. The majority of her clients are people that live on her same neighborhood. With her business’ profits, she reinvests part of the money on her business and part she uses to pay for her house expenses. She belongs to the group Santiago 3 along with Mrs. Ramona Z. Pérez (who has a mini-market), Mrs. Maria Ángela Gómez Z. (who also has a mini-market), and Mrs. Eva Rut Navarro Gómez (who has a restaurant that sells traditional foods). With the loan, Isabel, Ramona and Maria Ángela will invest in buying more products for their businesses, and Eva Rut will buy bread, mayonnaise, tomatoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

ISABEL tiene 42 años, dos hijos, tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes en donde venden: aceite, azúcar, sal, galletas, bebidas, pastas, etc. Sus principales clientes son gente de su misma localidad. Con las ganancias reinvierte en el negocio y contribuye al gasto familiar. Pertenece al grupo llamado Santiago 3 junto con doña Ramona Z. Pérez (tienda de abarrotes), Maria Ángela Gómez Z. (tienda de abarrotes) y doña Eva Rut Navarro Gómez (venta de comida tradicional). Con sus prestamos Isabel, Ramona y Maria Ángela invertirán el la compra en un surtido de productos para abastecer sus negocios, y Eva Rut en la compra de pan., mayonesa, tomates, etc.

loans.use: MINI-MARKET

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Edoh A., age 24, is a young graduate who has devoted himself to the business of market gardening to carve out a place for himself in the world. A very enterprising man, he is requesting a loan of $900 to initiate a new season of intense activity. While he is unmarried, he has three younger brothers as dependents. He needs funding to buy seeds and an effective motorized pump for his plan to enlarge his garden.

This funding will enable him to meet customer expectations at harvest time and thus achieve major profit margins for a successful life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Edoh est un jeune diplômé de 24 ans qui s’est donné à l’activité de maraîchage pour se tailler une place au soleil. Très entreprenant, il sollicite un crédit de $900 pour amorcer cette nouvelle saison d’intenses activités. Célibataire mais a en charge trois (3) petits frères. Il a besoin de ce fonds pour acheter de la semence et une motopompe performante dans le projet d’agrandissement de son jardin. Ce fonds lui permettra de satisfaire d’autres clients à la récolte et ainsi dégager une grande marge bénéficiaire pour son épanouissement.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and a motorized pump

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 23-year-old married man. He lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. Mohamad is a butcher. He needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy more meat for his butcher shop in order to generate additional revenue to continue his house payments. This is the second time Mohamad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He is a hard-working and reliable young man.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell in his butcher shop

loans.name: Ines' Group

texts.en:
Rosa, Inés, and Faustina have been part of the community bank “Retiño” for the past 1, 11, and 10 years respectively.  
Rosa is 50 years old.  She is married and has three children and one grandchild that she cares for.  Rosa sells cheeses door to door.  Previously, she sold vegetables and worked as a household servant.  She opened her new business because working as a servant was affecting her health.
Faustina is 43 years old.  She is married and also has three children.  Faustina travels to different markets twice a week, there she buys grains, and potatoes, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho.  Previously, she also brought fruit, and fish to the market but she stopped because these products often didn’t sell before going bad, and they would have to be thrown out.  
Meanwhile, Inés is 34 years old, married, and has three children.  Inés owns a car wash, which she was able to start with the help of her children.  In addition, during festivals she sells traditional foods and flowers.  Previously she had a farm where she raised chickens and guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy in Peru.  Her home was destroyed in an accident and as a result she was forced to change businesses.  Inés is hoping to open a new business selling motor oil.
Rosa, Inés, and Faustina need loans of 400, 2000, and 1000 soles (3 soles $1), which they will invest in buying cheese, corn, wheat, barley, potatoes, and motor oil.
The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Rosa, Inés, and Faustina plan to use their savings to build or improve their homes, and pay their children’s school fees.  Their dreams are to continue developing their businesses, that their children will be professionals, and to have good health.

loans.use: Rosa, Inés, and Faustina need loans of 400, 2000, and 1000 soles (3 soles $1), which they will invest in buying cheese, corn, wheat, barley, potatoes, and motor oil.

loans.name: Begmat

texts.en:
E. Begmat is 39 years old. He is married with 6 children.

Begmat is purchasing and selling cattle and calves. As a rule, he is purchasing the animals in the central market of Dushanbe city and selling them in the local market of his home city. Currently Begmat has 9 head of cattle and 15 calves. The business of Begmat is stable, allowing him to support his large family and improve their living conditions.

Today Begmat requests 2,000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase the cattle and calves in the market for further sales. Begmat thanks all supporting him and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to sell.

loans.name: Fenias Matias

texts.pt:
Fenias Matias C. was born on and raised in the district of Boane. She is 28 years old. She studied only until the 7th grade because her parents could not afford to send her to school. She started apprenticing with a carpenter and worked for two years without a salary. When she mastered the craft she started getting paid but it was not enough to cover her expenses. She married at 24 and had a son.

Fenia has borrowed through HLUVUKU before. Her first loan was of 6.500mt which she repaid in full. She received more orders from clients and to fulfill those she is requesting a loan 13.000mt to buy more lwood. With the income from the business Fenia supports her family and tries to save. In the future she hopes to have credit to buy more tools and be able to expand her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: KM -16 - Boane Cliente: Fenias Matias C. Actividade: Transformacao Valor de Empréstimo: 13.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de Madeira para fabrico de Mobiliario Inicio: 25/02/2008 Fim: 31/05/2009

Fenias Matias C. Nasceu a 28 anos no distrito rural de Boane. Estudou ate a 7ª classe, devido as limitações financeiras dos pais teve de parar muito cedo de estudar. Depois de ter imterrompido os estudos decidiu juntar a um mestre carpinteiro da zona para aprender a arte, tendo estagiado durante dois anos quase sem salario. Depois de aperfeiçoar foi quando comecou a ter salario, mas como nao satisfazia as minimas necessidades dele optou por iniciar seu proprio negocio de fabrico de mobiliario. Casou se com 24 anos e tem actualmente 1 filho. Já teve um credito com HLUVUKU no valor 6.500,00MT para os mesmos fins, tendo efectuado muito bem os pagamentos.

Como as encomendas dos clientes foram crescendo, teve de recorrer ao segundo credito no valor de 13.000,00MT cuja aplicaçao sera na compra de madeira serrada. Com os lucros sustenta a família e poupa algum para os momentos difíceis da vida. A perspectiva futura e ter um credito para compra de ferramentas importantes, tais como a serra maior de madeira, assim como madeira em quantidade de modo a responder a demanda pela procura dos seus serviços.

loans.use: To buy wood for furniture

loans.name: Faizali

texts.ru:
Faizali S. lives in Rudaki region. He is married and has 3 children. He has not finished high school Faizali has a business. He has a large car, which he uses as a taxi. He works at a local market transporting goods for customers. He has been in this business for 4 years. The taxi brings him enough profit to live. Currently, this is the only source of income for his family. Any serious problem with a car puts his family in a financial crisis.

Now, Faizali needs to do serious car repairs, which costs money. This is why he came to us to apply for a loan. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Сафаров Файзали живет в районе Рудаки. Женат , имеет 3 детей. Образования не имеет . Но имеет свое дело. Имеет автомашину – грузовой москвич, использует который как такси. Работает на рынке и перевозит грузы покупателей. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 4 года. Такси приносит ему доход , который хватает на жизнь. Сейчас это единственный источник дохода его семьи. Поэтому любая поломка машины приводит к финансовому кризису. Сейчас ему необходимо произвести капитальный ремонт автомобиля, для которого нужны деньги. Ему пришлось обратится к нам за кредитом. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr:
Born November 26, 1979 in Avrankou, in the Oueme department, Mrs. Yvette D. is single, has no children and lives with her mother. At Dantokpa, the largest market in Benin, she sells onions, black pepper and green anise, which is used to flavor certain alcoholic beverages. However, Mrs. Yvette D. is facing financial difficulties in purchasing these products. She is thus requesting this loan to overcome these difficulties.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 26 novembre 1979 à AVRANKOU dans le département de l’OUEME, dame D. Yvette est célibataire sans enfants et vit avec sa maman. Elle vend à DANTOKPA - le plus grand marché du BENIN - de l’oignon, du poivre noir et de l’anis vert servant à parfumer certaines boissons alcoolisées. Pour s’approvisionner, dame D. Yvette éprouve des difficultés financières. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour faire face à cette difficulté.

loans.use: Purchase of three bags of onions, one bag of green anise and three bags of pepper

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Born in 1973 in Atakpamé, a town located 145 kilometers from Lomé, Mrs. Kossiwa M. lives with her husband Koffi YAKOUBA who is a taxi driver. She has two children and does business in grains such as corn and millet, as well as beans. The business that she began in 2004 brings her income that she uses to help her husband with the family’s expenses. She has already benefited from a loan that she successfully repaid. The second loan she is seeking will allow her to buy two bags of corn and two bags of beans to increase her stock and improve sales.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1973 à Atakpamé, ville située à 145 Km de Lomé, Madame M. Kossiwa vit avec son mari YAKOUBA Koffi qui est un chauffeur de taxis. Elle a 2 enfants et fait le commerce de céréales tels que le maïs, le mil et du haricot. Cette activité qu’elle a commencée depuis l’année 2004 lui procure de revenu et elle puise de ce revenu pour aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé. Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 2 sacs de maïs et 2 sacs du haricot afin d’augmenter son stock et de pouvoir bien vendre.

loans.use: Purchase corn and beans

loans.name: Violeth's Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Violeth is married and has two children, ages seven and three. She also takes care of another child who is 11 years old. She owns a general store which opened in 2001. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Violeth has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell from her store. She will share this loan with the members of her group, all of whom want to buy inventory for shops they own that sell clothes or vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from various shops.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is 53 years old and the mother of four children. She is a local manufacturer of soap. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce soap in large quantities due to lack of funds, however.

Beatrice wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise more income to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called King Jesus Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil

loans.name: Menghor's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. MengH. H., 41, sells fish in the Khpop market. Her husband, Mr. Yung Choum, 48, sells fish by transporting it to customers' home, and earns US$3.00 per day. They live with their nine children. MengH. would like to request a loan of US$350 to purchase more fish to sell. MengH. is the group leader of three members as following:
Mrs. Hean S., 54, a house wife. She would like to request a loan of US$350 to purchase a cart for her children to transport groups of tourists across the Cambodia and Thailand border; Mrs. Pov R., 59, sells fritters. She would like to request a loan of US$350 to add more business capital. The loan will increase her incomes to support her family's living payment adequately; Mrs. Muy C., 53, requests a loan of US$350 to stock more vegetable to sell. They live in Prek Loung Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Yoem Sopheap Group

texts.en:
The group leader of five is Mrs. Yoem S. and all of the members live in Rolaing Village in the Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Yoem S., 46, and her husband are farmers who own two hectares of land to cultivate rice. They currently face a small problem because their soil is infertile. She has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the soil and improve her crop. The couple has one child who is too young to work or study.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

Mr. Khun K.'s wife is present in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the soil and improve the rice crop.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte D. sells rice, oil, and foodstuffs wholesale to her customers who in turn sell the products retail (in smaller quantities) to consumers who cannot buy in bulk. Charlotte has received Junior high education. She is married and has 3 children, and her husband is a mechanic.

Charlotte has been selling rice, oil, and foodstuffs since 2003. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her stock of goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods for sale

loans.name: Mashrabkhon

texts.en: Mashrabkhon is a widow from Isfara, Tajikistan. She runs a business selling different kinds of food in the central city market. Despite losing her husband, Mashrabkhon has managed to regain her enthusiasm and determination. Three years of being in business have helped her venture flourish into a successful enterprise. Mashrabkhon would like to see her business grow further. She believes additional financial assistance will help guarantee expansion and higher profits. Mashrabkhon’s integrity, good reputation, stability and rich experience working in commerce should secure prompt repayment of this loan and consistent progress in her business.

loans.use: To increase her grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo M. G., es casado, tiene 1 hijo, labora como docente en el Ceta INATEC Nueva Guinea,desde hace un año, está solicitando su 2do crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar mejora de su casa de habitación reparando la sala y poder comprar material de construción como es ceramica y otros materiales, don Wilfredo asume con responsabilidad su deberes crediticios,  tiene alto espiritu de superación,  desde pequeño se ha desarrollado en el campo laboral para poder ayudarle a sus padres, es muy reconocido en su comunidad por ser una persona honesta las sus actividades que desarrolla. Se siente muy satisfecho por los beneficio que ha recibido por la institución,  su sueño  es   tener estabilidad laboral salud  y una vivienda  digna con buenas condiciones humana para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilfredo M. G. is married, has one child, and works as an educator in Ceta INATEC Nueva Guinea. He's been working her for a year. He is requesting his second loan to the AFODENIC institution in order to improve his living room in his home.

He wishes to purchase materials such as clay among others. Mr. Wilfredo assumes full responsibility to this loan. He has high hopes of improving his life. He has been a very hard-working person since a very young age, he's been helping his own parents and is very well liked in the community for all the support he has to offer. He is very grateful for all the help he's received from this institution, his dream is to have a stable health and to be able to provide a honorable home to his family.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of living room and purchase of building materials

loans.name: Grupo La Rubia 0200137-8 Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo La Rubia, compuesto de cinco integrantes que son las señoras: Marta del Socorro M. M., Rubia de Jesús N. E., Sandra Auxiliadora G. L., Juana del Carmen Q. C. y Damaris L. M., residen en el barrio Las 7 esquinas de Masaya, todas ellas son vecinas y amigas.
Doña Martha del Socorro M. M. de 42 años, casada, con un hijo adolescente, que estudia y está a su cargo. Su negocio es elaborar nacatamales y venderlos en su casa de habitación, es conocida en su barrio por esta actividad tiene 9 años de dedicarse a este oficio que lo aprendió de su madre que ya murió, además vende carne de cerdo.
Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, es comerciante de ropa.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar cerdo en pie y destazarlo para así ganar más y vender los derivados como: chicharrón, frito y carne.
La señora piensa que conservando su crédito con sus pagos puntuales ella podrá lograr hacer más grande su negocio.
texts.en:
These five women are the members of "La Rubia": Marta del Socorro M. M., Rubia de Jesús N. E., Sandra Auxiliadora G. L., Juana del Carmen Q. C. and Damaris L. M., who live in the neighbourhood of "Las 7 Esquinas" in Masaya. They are neighbours as well as friends. Martha del Socorro M. M. is 42 years old, married and has a teenaged son who is in school and whom she supports. She prepares nacatamales and sells them from her home. She is known throughout her neighbourhood as she has had this business for the past nine years. Her mother, who has since passed away, taught her to prepare nacatamales. She also sells pork. Her husband, who sells clothing, helps her with the household expenses. She will use the loan to buy pigs for slaughter and so earn more money and be able to sell the derivatives such as cracklings, fried pork and fresh pork meat. She believes that if she maintains a good credit profile with punctual payments she will be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her business by offering new products such as pork derivatives (cracklings, etc.)

loans.name: Berdila

texts.en:
Berdila I., a 23-year-old farmer with more than two years of experience, has decided to extend his business and so is requesting a loan from MicroInvest to buy working materials and the seeds needed to plant vegetables in the garden he owns. In the future he wants to plant some winter vegetables that are difficult to grow; the advantage is that the demand for these vegetables will be high, so after he has repaid the loan I. hopes to get another to buy constructI. materials for a greenhouse.
 	
Despite his young age, Microinvest trusts this client.

loans.use: To extend his business.

loans.name: Tashbubu

texts.ru: Ташбубу кредитуется в КИВА не первый раз. 2 прошлых займа она получала на покупку сырья для производства ручных ковров и погасила вовремя. Эти займы сыграли в ее бизнесе определенную роль и теперь ее бизнес имеет стабильность. Ташбубу планирует получить новый займ для покупки сырья (шерсти) так как наступает сезон стрижки у овец и цена на шерсть будет низкой. Новый займ планирует погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tashbubu has applied for Kiva loans before. She used her two previous loans to purchase raw materials and repaid the loans on time. The previous loans helped Tashbubu stabilize her business. This loan Tashbubu will use to purchase wool during sheep shearing season, while the wool price is low. Tashbubu plans to repay this loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool for rug manufacturing

loans.name: Amigos Unidos 2 Group

texts.en: The members of Group 2 from the Amigos Unidos Bank of Hope have successfully paid off two loans they've had with Esperanza International and are now requesting a third. Many of them started their businesses with the first loan they had, and the loans have helped them establish themselves as micro entrepreneurs in their area. Their activities range from running cafeterias and small grocery stores, to candy making. Louis K. is the group coordinator and he sells prepaid phone cards. Mobile communications are relatively affordable in the Dominican Republic, and a lot of people own prepaid phones. Phone cards range in price from 50 to 500 pesos (between $1.50 and $12 approximately), and for some people, their mobile phones are their only source of communication (most people in rural areas and urban outskirts cannot afford a landline). However, this is a business which is best served as a street vendor, and Louis would like to move to another business activity soon. His life goal is to own his own home. Please help us support these entrepreneurs with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase prepaid phone cards and other goods for resale.

loans.name: Gulshodahon

texts.ru: После получения своего прошлого займа бизнес Гулшодахон заметно вырос. Ассортимент теперь включает не только мужскую одежду, но различные мелкие товары. Гулшодахон довольна, что получила займ на КИВА и расширила свой бизнес. В ее семье все в порядке, муж устроился на работу, а дети продолжают учебу в школе. Гулшодахон надеется на новый займ приобрести еще больше товара и увеличить прибыль.
texts.en:
After receiving her last loan, Gulshodahon's business has noticeably grown. The assortment of goods includes not only men's clothing, but also different kinds small items. Gulshodahon is satisfied that she took out a loan from Kiva and has expanded her business. Her family is doing well, her husband has found a job and her children continue studies at school. Gulshodahon hopes to use her new loan to buy more merchandise and increase her profits.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Allua Group

texts.en: Allua is the group leader of the three members of Allua group. Each member wants a loan to progress his/her business. Allua wants  to assist her brother in his dish selling shop.He sells plates,different desings of tea cups and other utensils in his shop. Selltan M. requests a loan for his lock and key selling shop. M. Server wants a loan for the business of chicken soup selling cart. They have requested a group loan of 42,000 Afghani.They all thank AFS and Kiva lenders who support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding there business

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm P., 40 years old, is a vegetable grower from the Pursat Province. She runs her business on her own farmland where she grows different kinds of vegetables like cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. She currently earns an average of $2 a day and has been running the business for more than four years. Morm P. is married to Mr. Thouk Thoeun who helps her with the farmwork. She has now seven children: four are single and the other three are married and live away from the family home. Morm P. hopes to earn other income by investing as a wine distiller. Due to the lack of capital, she has decided to request a loan from Kiva to purchase distilling material and rice to make wine. She will use the rest of the loan to buy piglets and whatever is leftover from the distilling wine for her family's pigs eating.

loans.use: To buy distilling material and rice to make wine and to buy a piglet

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en: Ruel is a good father and husband to his 2 kids. He is a responsible husband to his wife, Virgie. Their two children are both still young, aged 3 and 1 year old. The family stays harmoniously in the rural village of Tandul in Cabatuan Isabela. People in the village are very kind and courteous and they also have clean surroundings and good camaraderie. Ruel is already 35 years old and operates a tricycle transport business to generate a daily income for his family. He is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 for his motorcycle maintenance. Ruel is an optimistic person and is used to believing that “In everything we do we must put God first”.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance.

loans.name: Rocio Margot

texts.es:
Roció es socia del Bancomunal El Grupo Real 
Roció  es casada tiene 36 años, tiene un hijo de 6 años que está estudiando  en la escuela estatal.
Roció  termino el colegio y estudio cosmetología, no lo ejerció por que se puso a trabajar en casas cocinando por seis años, hasta que se caso, nació su hija se dedico a cuidarla.
Para ayudar en la economía de su casa  su tía  la inscribió para que venda productos de belleza por catalogo, le está yendo bien. 
Desde que Roció esta en Finca  aprendió ahorrar, quiere seguir progresando. 
Roció necesita un préstamo de 800 soles,  para comprar productos en ofertas y comprar ropa para vender. 
El sueño de Roció es  tener un puesto en el mercado Jorge Chávez de venta de ropa y productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Rocio is a member of the Community Bank "El Grupo Real".

Rocio is married and is 36 years old, she she has a six-year old child who is going to school in the publci school.

Roco completed her schooling and studied cosmetology, but she never put it to use because she started working as a cook in private homes for 6 years. Then she got married and had her daughter and dedicated her time to her.

In order to help out the family's finances her aunt signed her up to sell beauty products through catalogue and it has gone very well.

Since Rocio has been with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) she has learned how to save money and she wants to keep improving herself.

Rocio's dream is to have a stand in the Jorge Chavez market to sell clothing and beauty products.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products that are on sale and to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married. She has a 10-year-old son named Roman. Natalya owns a small store in the local mall in her hometown of Berdyansk, a town in the south of Ukraine near the Azov Sea. It is a neat little resort that is popular in summer when many people from all over Ukraine, Russia, and other neighboring countries come down to the sea for vacations.

Natalya sells clothing and beach items. Natalya’s business benefits from the tourist season. She currently has about 35,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas.

Natalya has been in the trade for 12 years. She is presently seeking a loan of 12,100 Grivnyas to diversify assorted merchandise in her little store and increase her turnover capital. Fellow businessmen characterize Natalya as an entrepreneur of integrity who always has a professional approach and manages her venture very skillfully. We believe these characteristics will help her succeed in her business and repay the current loan without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Yunely

texts.es:
La señora Yunely, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Progresivas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de 01 hija, que aun dependen de ella.

Tiene años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicio de Internet, tipeos e impresiones, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Así, siguió superándose y hoy en la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, donde brinda el servicio, a los moradores de la comunidad y hoy se encuentra mas implementada. Sus principales clientes son alumnos, ya que esta ubicada cerca de un Instituto.
También se dedica a la venta de zapatos brasileños de la marca Grenda y Azaleia y nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00,  realizara sus pedidos a Lima, para el envió de mas zapatos brasileños, para así brindar un mejor servicio, satisfacer y poner a la moda a sus clientes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando cables de red, canaletas y así brindar seguridad a sus clientes.

Hoy en día es una mujer muy independiente y es ella misma quien toma las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Yunely nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Señora Yunely belongs to the "Progressive Women II" Communal Bank in the District of Tarapoto, Province San Martin, Department of San Martin. She lives in a shared home, is 28 years old and the mother of 1 daughter that still depends on her. She has for several years been dedicated to offering Internet service, printing and copies. Her business is located in her own home, in an area well setup to attend to her clients. She has managed this business up to the current day, where she offers this service to the inhabitants of the community and today she is even more well equipped. Her main clients are students, since her business is located near an Institute. Also she is dedicated to the sale of Brazilian shoes of the 'Grenda and Azaleia' brand. She tells us that things are going very well. With this loan of 1,300 Soles she will place her order to Lima for more Brazilian shoes, in order to offer better service, to satisfy her clients and make them fashionable. A portion of the money will also be used to buy network cables and firewalls in order to offer security to her clients. Nowadays she is a very independent woman and she is the one who makes the decisions and administers her business. Yunely tells us that belonging to a group of women has helped her to better know her rights and that together they can ensure those rights are respected.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Brazilian shoes and network cables for her business

loans.name: Los Lirios 1 And 4 Group

texts.en:
Evelyn F. is a valued associate of Esperanza and she is entering her second loan cycle after coming to Esperanza because of its easy payment facilities. Evelyn is from L. Alcarrizos, an industrial town outsiD. of Santo Domingo, where power and water utilities are unreliable and sparse. She lives with her husband and three children. Her house serves both as her business and her small living space. 

Evelyn business is a beauty salon and it has been successful, however, unreliable water from the utility company means that clients may sometimes be turned away or worse, have to wait for hours to wash hair products out of their hair. Evelyn's plan therefore is to purchase a water pump to prevent this from happening and attract more business. In addition, her dream is to use to use the new revenue from new clients to build a second story to her home so that her shop can be on the bottom floor and she can live upstairs. Also, since her home is also her business she notes that the pump will have the added benefit of providing her family with consistent running water. She thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: A water pump

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
Mercedez O. is shown in the picture posing with the motorcycle she intends to convert into a tricycle because, with the additional sidecar, it can shuttle more passengers in one trip than just a two-wheeled vehicle. Mercedez lives in the village of Brgy. Canggapas Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is 44 years of age and married to Romeo, who presently works as a security guard. The couple is blessed with two children: her elder, a 21-year-old daughter, now works abroad and sends money home to help the family. The younger, who is 14 years old, is in high school. Mercedez knew that she could never provide her children with a better future if the family just relied on the small salary that her husband earns as a security guard; it was not even enough to properly feed the family. So she drew on her own talents and, with complete faith that God loves her and her family and would bless her endeavors, she took the plunge and became a micro entrepreneur.

When she started, Mercedez wasn't very ambitious. Her plan was just to open a business that could supplement, even in just a small way, her husband's income and probably improve their quality of life somehow. She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 to borrow 3,000 pesos start-up capital for an electronic reloading business, selling E-load* to prepaid subscribers of mobile phone service companies.

As her income improved, she opened a refreshment shop serving local merienda (snack time) fare like batchoy (a pork and noodle soup popular in the Western Visayas region), pancit molo (wanton-wrapped pork dumplings cooked in chicken broth) and other snack fare. The new venture is symbiotically compatible with her eload business as customers in one business tend to patronize the other just because they are already in her shop. The food patrons who need load for their mobile phones buy it from her instead of going to another retailer, while load buyers stay to eat her snacks. The new venture has increased her income exponentially and it has also made Mercedes realize that she actually has good business instincts. Her later loans allowed Mercedes to improve and expand her businesses, and even to buy a motorcycle, which provides her with additional income as it shuttles passengers around the town. The businesses earn a net income of 3,000 pesos per month, which helps her pay for the education of her son and also cover some of the family's daily expenses.

Mercedez borrowed 12,000 pesos with her previous loan, and she was able to pay it back in weekly installments without any delays. She is borrowing 15,000 pesos now on her seventh loan cycle. She plans to use the money to buy a sidecar for the motorcycle to increase its income potential, and she also intends to use any money left over for the other business ventures.

*Eload - is a service that allows prepaid mobile phone subscribers to buy load from retailers so that they can continue using the mobile phone service when they have consumed the service credits on their cellular phones. Demand for this kind of service is high because cell phones are a must-have for most Filipinos, but the low-end market prefer the prepaid service because there are no fixed monthly charges; the availability of the cellphone service depends on the amount of load credits they purchase. Retailers get a percentage commission from the load amount they sell.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Las 3 Estrellas  De Slt Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  LAS 3 ESTRELLAS DE S. L. T., está conformado por doce  señoras que en su mayoría radican en la Zona Alto Santa Rosa, zona de gente humilde en la ciudad; la característica principal de sus casas, es que son de adobe en gran parte de ellas y tienen solo una planta, algunas de ellas están en alquiler. La directiva está conformada por la Giovanna, Elizabeth y Ernestina; las componentes del banco se dedican a la venta de víveres, comida, Cds, ropa nueva y usada, verduras; otras se dedican a la atención de pastelería, confección de mantas, etc. El mercado es muy competitivo en estos rubros, pero los años de experiencia con los que cuentan les ayuda a poder anticiparse a diferentes situaciones que se puedan suscitar. Ellas necesitan el crédito para realizar compras de materia prima y están muy animadas por trabajar con Agrocapital. Este grupo está emprendiendo su Cuarto ciclo, la mayoría de ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia puesto que participaron durante el primer ciclo, es un grupo de personas muy alegres responsables amistosas y solidarias.
texts.en:
The community bank Las 3 Estrellas de S.L.T. (The 3 Stars of S.L.T.) is made up of twelve ladies, the majority of whom live in the Alto Santa Rosa region, a poorer area of the city. The main characteristic of their homes is that they are made of adobe and most of them only have one floor. Some of their houses are rented.

The leaders of the group are Giovanna, Elizabeth, and Ernestina, and the group members make a living selling provisions, food, CDs, new and used clothing, and vegetables. Others work in bakeries, making blankets, etc. The market is very competitive in these areas, but their many years of experience help them be able to stay ahead when different situations occur.

They need this loan to buy raw materials and they are very excited to work with Agrocapital. This group is beginning its fourth loan cycle; the majority of them already know one another and can count on their experience since they have been together since the first loan. It is a group of very happy, responsible, friendly, and supportive people.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria R. una feliz ama de casa y madre tres hijos quienes viven con ella junto a su esposo en su hogar que se encuentra ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Ana ha instalado una venta de frutas y verduras a las afueras de su casa a pesar de tener un puesto fijo, Ana se apoya de su hijo mayor quien le ayuda en el negocio para que Ana se pueda ir caminando a otras colonias cercanas ofreciendo de sus productos de manera ambulante. El crédito que Ana esta solicitando es para hacer mejoras necesarias a su hogar, el cual ha sufrido de deterioros por el transcurso de los años.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria is a happy housewife and mother of three children. She and her husband have a home in the department of Sonsonate. Ana sells fruits and vegetables from a vending post established just outside of her home. Her oldest son helps run the business while she travels to other neighborhoods offering her products as a street vendor. Ana is requesting a loan to make improvements to her home, which has suffered damage over the years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Labour and fertilizer

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa does business in rice farming, hog raising, and duckery. She is 54 years old and has eight children to feed. She is seeking support from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to fill her financial needs and help her improve her business. She is requesting 14,000 Php to buy farm supplies, piglets, and ducklings. This loan will be very helpful to expand her business and earn more income.

loans.use: Farm supplies, piglets, and ducklings

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 45 años de edad su estado civil es casada, tiene 2 hijos dependientes, la familia vive en una vivienda que es alquilada. Con la actividad de venta de papa, chuño y tunta, comercializa en las ferias de la localidad y la ciudad, cuenta con 23 años de experiencia en el negocio, el esposo se dedica a la venta de llaveros, con 2 años de experiencia. Su competencia es media, porque Virginia es responsable con sus clientes. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería al por mayor “papa, chuño y tunta”. Este es su tercer crédito, en sus créditos anteriores trabajo de manera optima, tiene obligaciones con otras entidades financieras en las cuales esta trabajando de manera optima.
texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and married with two dependent children; her family lives in a rented house. At street markets in her neighborhood and city, she sells potatoes and two kinds of dried potatoes, chuño and tunta. She has 23 years of experience in this business. Her husband has two years of experience with selling keyrings. Her competition is average, because Virginia is responsible with her clients. The loan will be used for purchasing wholesale merchandise, including potatoes and dried potatoes.This is her third loan, and her previous loans as well as her obligations to other financial institutions are all in good standing.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase of merchandise including potatoes and dried potatoes (chuño and tunta)

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La Sra. Olga es casada con 4 hijos menores que aun dependen de ella.-
Actualmente su marido se encuentra trabajando en el extranjero y desde allí le ayuda económicamente con los gastos del hogar.
Olga se inicio en esta actividad con una amiga que le enseño a fabricar los productos y con la ayuda de sus hijos venden en despensas y casas de familias.
Ella ya tiene una clientela formada.
Gracias al sacrificio que realiza con sus hijos consigue superar la crisis y educa a sus hijos  sin mayores inconvenientes.
Gracias al apoyo que le estamos brindando ella está logrando salir adelante y cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Ella está demostrando ser una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Olga is married with 4 young children. Her husband is working outside of the country and his income helps with the household expenses. Olga began her business with a friend who taught her how to make the products. Her children help her sell to dispensaries and to private homes. Now Olga has an established customer base. Thanks to the sacrifice she and her children have made, she is able to provide an education for her children. Thanks to the loans she receives, she is able to continue to improve the quality of life for herself and her children. Olga has demonstrated that she is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to make the cleaning products she sells

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn's rice farming business is improving with the financial help offered by microfinance institutions. She has been a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., an MFI, since 2008. She has been able to finance her business with the small interest charges.

Now Evelyn has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to continue to support her rice field and piggery. She is glad that her daily needs are met with the income she brings in.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto  tiene 54 años, es casado. El socio trabaja en la municipalidad como auxiliar de operaciones en el Terminal terrestres de buses de la ciudad del Cusco.
