Ya son 12 años que trabaja con el municipio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de cuyes actualmente cuenta con 50 cuyes y requiere el préstamo para comprar 50 cuyes más.  El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Alberto  pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Alberto is 54 years old, and married. He works for the city as operations assistant in the Cuzco bus terminal. He has worked for the city for 12 years, and has done well, because he is a hard worker. He has a small business selling guinea pigs, and currently has 50 of these animals. He needs a loan to buy 50 more guinea pigs. He is grateful for the opportunity available here, and commits to repaying the loan per the schedule. Alberto belongs to the “Maria’s Daughters” communal bank, part of the Arariwa Association.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member needs a loan to buy 50 more guinea pigs.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Née le 25 Avril 1961 à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin, V. Odile réside depuis 20 ans environs à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AKOUEHOU Clément, un chauffeur, Odile est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Odile vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Odile a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Il y a environs 22 ans que Odile vend des tissus et secondairement, des glacières par le système de distribution. Odile fait ses achats à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Odile a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Odile sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Odile V. was born on April 25, 1961 in Abomey, the historic capital of Benin. For the past 20 years, she has lived in the vicinity of Agla, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Clément Akouehou, a driver, and has three children who attend school. Odile lives alone with her children and is solely responsible for them. Odile stopped attending classes before high school. For about 22 years, Odile has sold fabrics and also ice boxes using the local distribution network. Odile gets her supplies at the Dantokpa international market in Benin. She has repaid her two previous loans from ALIDé. She is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to strengthen her business activities and better meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and cloth

loans.name: Segundo

texts.en:
Segundo S., 21, is making sure that his family has enough for their daily needs. He has been managing his own variety store for quite some time now. He also rents out 6 rooms.

Segundo has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for over a year now. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with previous loans, he has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  He is consistent in paying his dues because he used the money he borrowed to expand and improve his variety store.

Now, with your help, he would like to apply for a Php 19,000 loan. This amount will be used as additional capital to buy groceries to replenish stock and to maintain operation of his expanding business.

He dreams that his business will continue to grow so that he can have a good and comfortable life with his family. He also wants to have his own computer shop as he is currently doing a computer course.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to replenish stock and to maintain operation of his store.

loans.name: Abilio Assane

texts.pt:
Abílio Assane M. nasceu na Província de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade casado e pai de 6 filhos de 26, 24, 18, 10, 6, e 3 anos de idade, todos vão a escola menos o de 3 anos. Fez 9ą classe parou porque na altura foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele.
Saiu da província de Zambézia para Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar em 1980, mais tarde resolvei não voltar a terra natal. Fixou sua residência em Boane no bairro 2 depois da sua desmobilização e começou a trabalhar numa agência de informação (jornal Noticias) como recepcionista. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 9.028.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus vizinhos que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 22.100.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, chapas de zinco e outros) para continuar com construção da sua residência.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e oferecer o melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Abílio Assane M. was born in Zambézia province in central Mozambique. He is 47 years old, married, and the father of six children: 26, 24, 18.10, 6 and 3 years old. All go to school apart from the three year old. He completed ninth grad, but stopped when he did his national military service. He lives with his family in his own home, and supports two grandchildren who live with him. He left Zambézia for Maputo when he finished his military service in 1980, and later decided not to return to his birthplace. He established residence in Boane after he was discharged and began to work as a receptionist at an information agency (Jornal Noticias). He does not supervise other employees, and earns a monthly salary of 9,028 MZN that he uses to pay his household expenses, still managing to save some in his bank account. He has never taken out loans with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through his neighbors who are already clients. This is his fourth loan, for 22,100 MZN, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, galvanized roofing sheets, etc.) to continue constructing his house. In the future he would like to apply for additional loans to complete his home and provide more comfort for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, galvanized roofing sheets and others)

loans.name: Marycris

texts.en:
Marycris B. is from the village of Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 22 years old. Marycris is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marycris owns & operates a business selling fruit like lanzones in the local community. Marycris has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marycris joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marycris is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marycris from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Mr. Hang P. is a 30-year-old married man and he is a father. He works as an electrician for a hotel in the middle of Siem Reap Province, earning a suitable salary. Another source of income for the family comes from his wife’s poultry business. This couple is blessed with three children who are enrolled in school. Hang P. always faces a problem; his old motorcycle has often broken when he rides to work or anywhere else. In order to solve the problem, Hang P. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva's partner, HKL, in the amount of $1200 to be used to replace his old motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace his old motorcycle.

loans.name: Nellys Aidee

texts.es:
Nellys P. de 48 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así por su abundancia de la flor orquídeas, calles ya de asfalto y casas de cemento) de Guayaquil. Ella tiene tres hijos de 19, 16 y 14 años de edad. 

Ella tenida un pequeño local de caña en la parte delantera de su casa, empezó vendiendo confites y bebidas. Poco a poco termino de arreglar el local y lo construyo de cemento. Pero como necesitaba mas ingresos decidió invertir sus ahorros en algunos cuadernos y lápices.

Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene una papelería afuera de su casa, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y papelería para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere permanecer con su negocio y ampliarlo con otras sucursales, y que sus hijos terminen de los estudios.
texts.en:
Nellys P. is 48 years old and lives in an urban area of Guayaquil called Orquídeas, which is named for its abundance of orchids, its now asphalt streets and cement houses. She has three children who are 19, 16 and 14 years of age. Nellys runs a small store selling sugar cane out the back of her house. She started out by selling sweets and drinks, and bit by bit she finished working on the store and built it out of cement. Since she also needed more income, Nellys decided to invest her savings in some exercise books and pencils. It was this good decision that led her to set up a stationery store outside her house, where she works from 7am to 8pm every day. With this loan she would like to buy exercise books, pens and stationery for her business. In the future she would like to maintain her business and set up other branches, and she hopes that her children will finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Exercise books, pens, paper

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Nelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop in the local community. Nelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Nelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Nelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Refurbishing his home

loans.name: Sikiya

texts.en:
Sikiya is 27 years old, married with 2 children who are 2 and 3 years old.  Sikiya has owned a shop for a long time but his capital is still low.  The hours for Sikiya to start the business are from are from 6 am to 8 pm every day.  In this shop, he sells a variety of goods including cosmetics, breads, biscuits, etc. 
 
Sikiya is now requesting his second Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  This loan will allow him to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs, which are highly demanded by a large number of his customers.  The sale of these foodstuffs will allow Sikiya to earn more profits than previously and he will start saving for a better future as well as for the stability of his business.

loans.use: A large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng S. is married with five children.  She has spent her entire life cultivating crops. She learned this skill from her grandparents when she was young. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. She has had great success growing crops. The coming rainfall is good for growing, but Sreng S. lacks capital to buy farming supplies. So Sreng S. is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Mrs. Channy T. is 27 years old and her husband Mr. Bin Khloeng, is 37 years old. They have been married since 2005 and have two young daughters. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Channy has been selling grocery items at her home for a year. She buys them from Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been driving a Tuk Tuk taxi for six years. Channy is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en: Jemima H. is a single parent taking care of two children. She has received junior high education.  Jemima sells bags of charcoal at Takoradi. Jemima uses her income to take care of her children.  Jemima will use the loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to distribute to her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Jemima plans to save to put up a structure to keep her charcoal out of the weather.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal to distribute to her customers.

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorng T. has been spending her life cultivating crops. Her husband, who is pictured, frequently works alongside her in the farm fields.

In addition to her farming job, Yorng T. makes clay stoves and saves up to one hundred sets or more before having her husband sell them around the community. Making clay stoves is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young.

Yorng T. will be using her first loan as capital to buy clay in order to make more stoves to sell.

loans.use: To buy clay in order to make more stoves to sell

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn A. is from the village of District II, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Jovelyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a general storewhere she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bonifride

texts.en:
Bonifride is 41 years old and is married with six children who are between 6 and 20 years old. She has been a self-employed businesswoman selling foodstuffs since 2000 and her business hours are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Although Bonifride has been in her business for about ten years, her capital is still too low to earn meaningfully. To solve this problem, she is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs such as peas, beans, wheat, etc.

With these additional foodstuffs, Bonifride will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs such as peas, beans, wheat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make lunches

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
Married and the father of four children, Sherali was born on May 6, 1974. Coming from an area where cattle raising is popular, Sherali has been selling cattle since 2002. He buys them in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more. Today Sherali would like to expand his business by increasing his capital, so that he can then maximize his profits. For this reason, he is requesting this first loan to purchase young cattle and fodder for them. This will be his first loan with IMON International, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. lives in the Masanafu neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has eight children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother-in-law).    

Esther has a business in poultry farming. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Esther sells her chickens at Nakasero market by means of retail.    

Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy poultry feed.  She also generates additional income through tailoring. 

The main business challenges for Esther include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding her poultry business and also to own a delivery van.    

Esther lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and transportation

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda M. is from the town of Talibon. She is 28 years old. Roda is married and has four children. She buys and resells fruits like mangoes. Since she is living in one of the islands in Talibon, she goes to the mainland to buy fruits and vegetables that she can resell on the island. She also buys ingredients for making "halo-halo," a popular Filipino dessert/snack. 

Roda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Roda is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which she will use to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Auntie Ama

texts.en:
Auntie Ama T. is married.  Ama sells maize, kenkey, and fried fish in Abura. She has no educational background.  Ama will use the loan to purchase more maize and fresh fish to fry to expand her kenkey business.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest in the sale of other cereals.

Ama is standing by a bag of maize and in her hand is a sample of the fried fish.

loans.use: To buy maize and fish to sell

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marilu; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda fotográfica, ella atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda fotográfica. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar rollos para la cámara.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “COMUZONE I” communal bank. The bank is located in the Cuzco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco. 

The member's name is Marilu. She is 37 years old and in a common law marriage. She has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with running a photography store. She works from 9 :00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. With this business, she is getting her children ahead. She wants to enlarge the photography store and is asking for the loan to buy camera film.  

The member is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy camera film.

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok M. is 54 and married with five children all of whom are single. She currently lives in Kompong Tom province. Mok M. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them to sell and also for slaughter. Mok M.’s husband sells firewood. Two of the couple’s children work in a garment factory and earn a formal salary every month. This rice harvesting season, Mok M. needs capital to purchase sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: to buy rice to store and sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 59 años, es una madre de familia muy  bondadosa y tímida, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos, estudiantes de grados universitarios. Por muchos años  Martha, tenía su bodega pequeña instalada en el interior de su casa, tiempo después cayó enferma sin embargo tenía que cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos, por lo que poco a poco, ya no tuvo capital para invertir que tuvo que cerrarlo. Es así que solo se dedicaba a su casa por un buen tiempo. Ahora se ha propuesto en reabrir su negocio, y así que está pintando los andamios que le quedaron, solo le falta capital para comprar los productos necesarios para la venta y que son de utilidad para los clientes. Espera que con esta nueva meta, poder cubrir la educación universitaria de sus hijos. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete una vez más de pagar puntualmente, y además manifiesta sentirse contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, porque todos los integrantes son muy solidarios. De obtener el crédito que solicita, los invertirá una parte en pagar la educación de su hijo y con la otra parte comprará gaseosas, para iniciar su anhelado negocio.
texts.en:
Martha, aged 59, is a very kind and timid mother of a family who lives in her own house together with her husband and their 2 children, both university students. For many years, Martha had her small restaurant installed inside her home.  Then she fell ill but, nevertheless, Martha had to pay her children's educational costs. Consequently, little by little, she lacked capital to invest and had to close the business.

As a result, for a good while, Martha could dedicate herself only to her home. Now she proposes to reopen her business and is painting the old location. She only lacks capital to buy necessary products to sell which may be useful to customers. Martha hopes that with this new goal, she will be able to cover the university education costs of her children.

This is her 12th loan with MFP and she promises once again to pay punctually. Also, Martha expresses her contentment with belonging to her communal bank, because all the members feel great solidarity. Upon receiving her loan, Martha will invest a part in paying for the education of her son and with the other part she will buy soft drinks and begin her desired business.

loans.use: TO COVER HER SON'S UNIVERSITY COSTS AND BUY PRODUCTS TO STOCK HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Las Coquetas I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Coquetas" ya que esta conformado por ocho mujeres las cuales se caracteriza por su simpatia, logrando así que el grupo trabaje en un ambiente D. armonía. El grupo se encuentra ubicado en el estado D. Hidalgo, en México. Esta conformado por ocho integrantes, cada una siendo mujeres emprendedoras. La señora C. Gómez Albina es integrante del grupo. Ella tiene 41 años D. edad, estudió la secundaria. La señora tiene un taller D. costura en su domicilio, donD. cinco personas la apoyan en las labores D. costura; la ropa que ella maquila la distribuye para una empresa granD.; por tal razón en varias ocasiones tiene bastante trabajo por los pedidos que se le solicitan. La señora Albina ya lleva poco más D. 15 años con su taller D. costura, por ello tiene experiencia en dicha actividad en donD. sus vecinos y familiares la ven como una mujer trabajadora, responsable y atenta. También se dedica a las actividades del hogar y tiene un hijo D. 4 años, ella decidió dedicarse por su cuenta a alguna actividad que le ayudará a obtener algunos ingresos para así darle a su familia una mejor calidad vida. El crédito que solicito la señora Albina lo utilizará para la compra D. otra maquina D. coser y para el mantenimiento D. las ya existentes con el objetivo D. hacer crecer su taller D. costura.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Coquetas" and is maD. up of eight enterprising women who are characterised by their friendliness, working together in a harmonious environment. The group is located in the state of Hidalgo in Mexico. 

Albina C. Gómez is a member of the group. She is 41 years of age and studied at secondary school. She has a sewing workshop in her home where five people help her with her sewing tasks. The clothes that she sews are distributed to a large company, which is why at times she has a lot of work due to the orders that she receives. 

Albina has worked for just over 15 years in her sewing workshop and she has a lot of experience in this field. Her neighbours and relatives see her as a hardworking, responsible and attentive woman. She also attends to home duties and she has a 4 year old son. 

Albina decided to work in a field that would help her obtain an income that would give her family a better quality of life. The loan that Albina is requesting will be used to purchase another sewing machine and to maintain her existing sewing machines, with the aim of expanding her sewing workshop.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine and to maintain the other sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase soles, white cement glue, ribbons, lace, metal heels, and plastic

loans.name: Hab

texts.en: Hab V., age 57, sells fresh fish that she buys from her regular suppliers or fishermen. Hab V. sells to her neighbors in and around her village. She is a widow who is blessed with six children; five of them are married and live separately, while the other one is single. She has a few sons who sometimes fish to earn money. In order to earn additional income and make her business more successful, Hab V. is requesting a loan to expand her capital in order to buy more fresh fish for resale.

loans.use: to expand her capital in order to buy more fresh fish for resale

loans.name: Nhoy

texts.en: Nhoy R. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. R. sells clothes and souvenirs to tourists, earning an income of $10 per day. Her husband sells palm sugar, earning an income of about $10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $70 on food and $50 on other necessary expenses. R. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more souvenirs to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be R.'s second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard E. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old. Richard is single and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Richard owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Richard has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Richard joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richard is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Richard from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng L., 55, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples.  L. sells groceries, earning an income of about USD 2.5 per day.  Her husband produces rice wine and raises pigs, earning an income of USD 3 per month.  Each month, the family has to spend USD 28 on food and USD 65 on the other necessary expenses.  L. is requesting a loan of USD 875 to purchase a new motorbike for her family's use. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her family's use.

loans.name: Yinis Miliana

texts.es:
Yinis, reside en Chinameca, departamento de San Miguel, ella vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos de 15, 12 y 8 años de edad, se dedica a la sastrería, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre, trabaja de lunes a viernes.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas de diferentes tipos y colores, botones de todo tamaño, esta compra le ayudara a tener disponibilidad de materia prima, siendo un gran apoyo ya que sus hijos dependen de ella.
Su objetivo es trabajar por sus hijos, ayudarlos mientras son independientes, también tiene para el futuro comprar más maquinas de coser.
texts.en:
Yinis lives in Chinameca, Department of San Miguel, with her family which includes three children (ages 15, 12, and 8). She is a tailor by profession and learned this trade from her mother. Yinis works Monday through Friday.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy fabrics of different types and colors, as well as buttons of all sizes. With this purchase, she will have enough materials on hand. This business provides a great deal of support since her children are dependent on her.

Her goal is to work so that she can help her children as they become independent. She also wants to buy more sewing machines in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and buttons.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón de  27 años de edad, es soltero y cuenta con un lavadero y gomería propios en el predio de la casa de sus padres.
Gracias a la ayuda económica de su padre, quien es empleado de una empresa de transporte, y de su madre, quien  posee un pequeño copetín, pudieron adquirir todo lo necesario para montar el pequeño taller y lavadero.
Actualmente necesita de un nuevo compresor de aire ya que el que posee está bastante deteriorado por el uso realizado en estos últimos tres años.
Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza otorgada y comenta que con el compresor nuevo estaría cumpliendo  mejor con su numerosa clientela.
texts.en:
Ramón is 27 years old, single, and has his own laundry and tire workshop at his parents’ house.  Thanks to the financial support from his father, who works for a transportation enterprise, and his mother, who has a small snack bar, they were able to acquire the necessities for starting the small workshop and laundry.

Currently, he needs a new air compressor, as the one he currently has is very deteriorated due to all the use it has had over the past three years.

He thanks the Paraguaya Foundation for their confidence in him, and comments that the new air compressor would allow him to better serve his many customers.

loans.use: buy a new air compressor.

loans.name: Shamkhal

texts.ru: Shamkhal rodilsya v 1974 qodu. On jenat imeyet odnogo rebonka. Shamkhal yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione v posolke Ashagi Seyidakhmedli vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. Uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa i uvelicheniya molochnogo produkta.
texts.en: Shamkal was born in 1974.  He is married and has one child.  Shamkal is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Ashagi Seyidakhmedli village of the Fuzuli region together with his beloved family.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for 3 years and breeds cattle.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle, develop his business and increase milk production.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Darweish

texts.en:
Darweish is farmer who has a number of cows shared with his partner. Darweish is 22 years old. His father gave him capital to start his own business. Darweish and his partner want to purchase another cow. They have part of the money for the cow and he took out a loan from FATEN for the rest, 

Darweish's dad is a worker who makes $280/month and both share the household expenses. Darweish is photographed in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Qalqilia.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel D. 54 años D. edad, vive con su esposo D. 59 años  e hijo D. 21 años en su casa D. residencia. Isabel se dedica a la venta D. mariscos en el Mercado Central D. la zona donD. habita. Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado duramente  para sacar adelante a su familia y darles una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy tempranas horas D. la mañana empieza su día  para adquirir los mejores mariscos y tenerlos listos para sus clientes. Gracias a que es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y sobre todo muy amable ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. sus clientes ya que siempre cuenta con los mejores precios y su producto es fresco y garantizado. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con  la fe puesta en Dios que podrá abastecer su negocio con mayor variedad D. mariscos y logrará obtener mayores niveles D. ganancias. Con el crédito piensa comprar: pescado, camarones, tilapias, camaroncillo, y todo tipo D. marisco que los clientes solicitan con más frecuencia.  No pierD. las esperanzas que D. esta manera su vida y la D. su familia se verá mejorada.
texts.en:
Isabel, 54, lives with her 59-year-old husband and 21-year-old son in her residence.  Isabel sells seafood at the Central Market in the area where she lives.  She worked hard for a very long time to move her family forward and proviD. them with a better quality of life.  She starts her day very early in the morning to get the best seafood and have it ready for her customers.  Thanks to her being tenacious, enterprising and, above all, very kind she’s managed to win over the trust of her customers since she always has the best prices and her products are fresh and guaranteed.

She has decided to ask INTEGRAL for this loan trusting God that she’ll be able to stock her business with a greater variety of seafood and will attain larger profit levels.  She will use the loan to buy fish, prawns, tilapia, shrimp and all kinds of seafood that her customers request most often.  She does not lose hope that through this her and her family’s lives will see improvement.

loans.use: to buy fish, prawns, tilapia, shrimp, etc.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Tras 12 años de radicar en la zona donde actualmente vive, Janeth ha establecido su familia, tiene 31 años y es madre de 2  niños que juntos viven en una casa alquilada. Decidió dedicarse al comercio de verdura en un mercado zonal de su localidad y de manera paralela arrienda terrenos para sembrar ajos o cualquier producto que  se oferte en el mercado a mayor precio. Es así como Janeth se gana la vida; vende todos los días desde muy temprano, para que sus ganancias sean diarias, por otro lado espera el tiempo de cosecha para poder recibir un capital extra que le ayude a cubrir la necesidades de su familia. Siempre tiene que contratar mano de obra para poder realizar éste último trabajo. Pero el ver que estas actividades le es rentable, procura en lo posible incrementar tanto de verdura para su negocio como también extender más su siembra para recibir más en la cosecha. Es la cuarta ocasión que esta trabajando de manera grupal con MFP, se siente muy contenta de ser parte de su grupo solidario y aunque con una cantidad reducida de personas es muy unido. El dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en el pago de alquiler de nuevas extensiones de terreno que ha visto por conveniente alquilar.
texts.en:
After 12 years of being in the area where she currently lives, Janeth has established her family. She is 31 years old and the mother of two children. They live in a rented house. She decided to become a vegetable merchant at the local market and also rent farmland for growing garlic or any other product that she could sell at the market for a good price. This is how Janeth earns her living. She sells every day, beginning in the early hours, so that she can generate a daily income. In the meantime, she waits for the harvest season so that she can obtain additional capital to help cover the needs of her family. Janeth must always hire help in order to complete the harvest. Seeing that her businesses are profitable, Janeth tries whenever possible to increase her inventory of vegetables as well as elevate the amount she plants so that she will achieve a larger harvest.

This is the fourth time she has worked as part of a group with MFP. Janeth is very pleased to be part of solidarity group since working with a small number of people has allowed her to become close with the other members. The money she requested will be invested in the rental payments of additional tracts of farmland. She finds that it is more convenient for her to rent.

loans.use: to pay the rent on farmland for cultivation.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. She has a food shop that sells banana & sweet potato cue (on a stick). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bananas & sweet potatoes.

Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 48 years old, married and has two children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by raising pigs and selling fish. She is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 44 years old and is a married woman with 2 children aged 17 and 18. She is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. Hilda plants rice and corn crops and sells her harvest at the market. She works hard to increase her harvest and earnings.

Hilda has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn better and be able to improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Leyda

texts.es: Leyda es la propietaria de un negocio de Variedades y alquiler de lavadoras, negocio instalado en la ciudad de Cartagena donde vive con su familia. Su negocio inició hace dos años,  atendiendo la necesidad de generar ingresos complementarios para genera bienestar en su hogar. Ella inició con un pequeño capital que le dio su esposo, ofreciendo unas cuantas mercancías a  crédito,  entre sus vecinos cuando los visitaba, gradualmente fue creciendo y ella como buena observadora, empezó a agregar nuevas mercancías y nuevos servicios como el de alquiler de su primera lavadora;  gradualmente compró dos mas y quiere continuar creciendo, porque no puede detener la demanda de su servicio, que cada día crece y se hace insuficiente su capacidad de respuesta.  Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, pues quiere agregar dos lavadoras más,  y comprar cosméticos y enseres para vender sobre pedidos. Este es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con esta organización logró  comprar su casa propia, con la cual su familia se siente feliz y ella satisfecha de poder apórtale  nuevos éxitos con su propio trabajo. Su negocio maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de 39,93%, una rotación de inventarios de 13 días, desde la cual auguramos su crecimiento por su gran potencial de trabajo.
texts.en:
Leyda is the owner of a variety store and a washing machine rental business. Her business is located in the city of Cartagena, where she lives with her family. Leyda started her business two years in order to address the need to generate additional income so that she could provide for the welfare of her household. She began with a small amount of capital that was given to her by her husband. Leyda offered a few products on credit to neighbors whenever she visited them. Being a good observer, she started offering new products and her customer base gradually grew. She also provided new services when she rented out her first washing machine. Over time, Leyda bought two more and wants to continue growing because she cannot stop the demand for this service. With each passing day, her capacity to respond is insufficient. It is for this reason that she is applying for a Kiva loan. She wants to acquire two additional washing machines as well as cosmetics and household products to fulfill her orders.

This is Leyda’s second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, the organization that helped her to buy her own house. Her family is very happy and she is very pleased that she has found new success in her work. Her business maintains sales profitability of 39.93% and a product turnover period of 13 days. These indicators signal growth as a result of her great work potential.

loans.use: to acquire two additional washing machines and to buy cosmetics and household products to fulfill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 35 years old. She is married to Francis, and together they have two children. She operates a fruit and vegetable stall in the town of Naivasha. She has been in the business for the last six years.  

Rachael was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, Rachael hopes to open a big greengrocer shop.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna Guitang is from the village of Villa Luna, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 55 years old, and married with 13 children. To make a living, Myrna raises hogs and operates a food production business. She has been engaged in her business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP daily.

Myrna is requesting a loan to 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed for her pigs and additional stocks of Ilocos vinegar, bananas and blankets to sell in the community. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs and additional stocks of Ilocos vinegar, bananas and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Load

texts.en: Load is a farmer and earns $5 per day. Her husband is a carpenter at home.  He earns $10 per day. They have one child, 2 years old. Every month, Load has to spend $60 on food, and $15 on other expenses. She would like a loan of $1000 to buy construction materials and to hire a worker to rebuild her house. This loan will help her husband with a bigger space for his work.

loans.use: To buy construction material and a hire worker to rebuild her house

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
A sus 43 años de edad Adriana es una microempresaria dedicada a la fabricación de productos artesanales, afirma haber tenido muy buena afinidad para este arte desde pequeña, aun así hasta hace 6 años, que tomo clases de pintura, se dedicó del todo a crear su empresa, en la cual cuenta con el apoyo de sus 3 hijos y su esposo, el cual es militar pensionado del ejército de Colombia.
Actualmente Adriana solicita un préstamo que le permita surtir su negocio con materiales e insumos nuevos, de manera que pueda  innovar, realizando para la época de Diciembre una buena producción de artículos navideños en tela, y así mejorar sus ventas, sus ingresos y proporcionalmente su entorno de mercado, ya que su sueño es que sus productos sean reconocidos en el sector, que cada vez los clientes sean mas y que su calidad de vida mejore notablemente.
texts.en:
Forty-three year old Adriana is a micro-entrepreneur whose work is making handicraft items, and she says she has had an inclination towards the arts since she was a child, as early as 6 years old. She has had art classes and puts everything into growing her business, and she has the help of her 3 children and her husband who is retired from the Colombian army. 

Adriana is applying for a loan in order to stock her business with materials and buy new supplies, so that she can create and complete by December a good quantity of Christmas items made of cloth, and thus increase her sales, her income and correspondingly her market share. Her dream is that her products become known in the industry and that her clients buy more and that her quality of life markedly improves.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and raw materials to make handicraft items

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad. de 52 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos.ella se dedica a la venta de frutas,desde 2 años y le da gracias a Dios por el apoyo brindado ya que sus ventas han mejotado y han aumentado,ahora ella nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de frutas,ya que la demanda de sus clientes es mucha y nececita mas capital para trabajar,y asi de la misma manera seguir ayudando a su familia y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: Trinidad, 52, has two children.  She has sold fruit for two years and she thanks God for the help she’s gotten for her sales have been improving and increasing.  Now, she’s asking us for this loan to buy fruit because customer demand is high and she needs more capital to work and to continue helping her family and to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Sérigne Talla

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié qui vit avec sa femme et ses trois enfants.Il tient au marché de sa localité une cantine dans laquelle il vend des habits pour femme et enfants ainsi que des chaussures.Avec son activité, il prend en charge les dépenses alimentaires, sanitaires, d'habillement et de frais de scolarité de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un prêt de 200000f de l'UIMCEC pour acheter des chaussures et des robes .Son ambition est d'élargir son commerce.
texts.en:
Sérigne Talla is married and lives with his wife and his three children. He runs a small shop in his village, where he sells women's and children's clothing, as well as shoes.

Thanks to his business, he takes care of the various family expenses (food, health, clothes, tuition). To bolster his working capital, he's seeking a loan of XOF 200'000 from Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, in order to buy shoes and dresses.

He ambitions to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy shoes and dresses for children

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: La socia Leonarda continua con su negocio de compra y venta de productos agropecuarios para los terrenos de cultivos en la zona, la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de productos como abono, fertilizante entre otros para mejorar los cultivos, la socia tambien tien terrenos de cultivo de papa y maíz. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos agropecuarios para implementar su negocio.
texts.en: Bank-member Leonarda continues her business of buying and selling agricultural products to make the zone's cultivated lands more productive. She wishes to invest her loan in purchasing products such as manure and fertilizer, among other items, to improve local crops. Leonarda also has her own fields planted in potatoes and corn. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing agricultural products to sell to local farmers.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica de 24 años convive con Nilton, de 30 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos de 5 años y uno en camino. Esta feliz familia vive en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la comunidad Puente Paucartambo en la provincia de Chanchamayo. 
Gracias a su padre pudo aprender el oficio que la mantiene y le da oportunidades de progreso. Jessica se dedica a la fabricación de cajones de madera, ideales para contener y trasladar frutas. Es así que vende sus cajones a distintos productores. “Este negocio es muy rentable, todos los agricultores necesitan llenar sus frutas en cajas, por eso no hay pierde, siempre hay ventas y pedidos”, comenta.
Así también cuenta con una hectárea de terreno agrícola que su suegro le ofreció y otras 2 que heredó de su madre. En dichas parcelas tiene sembrado café, al que cuida y limpia constantemente. Jessica siente que el trabajo del campo la tranquiliza y la libra de problemas externos. Ella ha encontrado en el campo una actividad rentable y reconfortante. De igual manera, tiene sembrado plátanos, los que cosecha cada 15 ó 20 días. En cuanto al café, afirma que estará dando sus primeros frutos en menos de 2 años. 
Jessica sueña con tener una casa propia, por eso no duda en seguir esforzándose día tras día. Éste sería su crédito número 10 que obtendrá de MFP, gracias a su ayuda, por eso menciona que será puntual y responsable en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Además se encuentra satisfecha con su banco comunal llamado “Luz  del Futuro”, por su trabajo solidario. De obtener el dinero, ella podrá adquirir 10 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus sembríos de café.
texts.en:
Jessica is 24 years old and in a common-law relationship with Nilton, age 30. They have two children, a five-year-old and another one on the way. This happy family lives in a rented house in the community of Puente Pucartambo in Chanchamayo Province.

Thanks to her father, Jessica was able to learn the trade that enables her to support herself and provides opportunities to make progress. She makes wooden crates for holding and transporting fruit. Jessica sells the crates to different producers. She says, “This business is very profitable. All of the farmers need to keep their fruits in crates so that they don’t spoil. I am always generating sales and orders.”

Jessica also has a hectare of farmland that was offered by her father-in-law and two more hectares that she inherited from her mother. These parcels are used for growing coffee, which she cares for constantly and is always removing weeds. Jessica feels that her work in the fields is peaceful and frees her of outside problems. She has found this business to be both profitable and comforting. Jessica also grows bananas and harvests them every 15 or 20 days. She says that her first coffee crop will be ready in less than two years.

Jessica dreams of having a house of her own, so she strives without doubts day after day to reach that goal. This will be her 10th loan with MFP. Because of this assistance, she says that she will be punctual and responsible with her monthly payments. In addition, she is pleased with her Communal Bank named “Luz del Futuro” (Light of the Future) because of the close-knit work that she and the other members do. The money she will obtain will be used to acquire 10 bags of organic compost for her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of organic compost.

loans.name: Saban

texts.en:
Saban, 45, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is an A KOUR cake vendor (decorated eggless cakes). Her husband and her son are mechanics who repair motorbikes and bicycles at home. She also needs to look after her mother who is very old. 

Therefore, Saban is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to run a new business by carrying yams to resell. By doing so, she can make more money to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to run a new business by carrying yams to resell.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de carne de chancho,carne de cordero y carne de res,ella vende en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es vender al por mayor la carne y distribuirlo a las diferentes tiendas que venden carne.La socia solicita el credito para comprar carne de res,cerdo y cordero al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guadalupe continues making her living by selling pork, lamb and beef. She sells in the market from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. Through this business, she wants to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to sell meats wholesale and distribute meat to the different stores that sell it. She requested the loan to purchase beef, pork and lamb at wholesale. 

She is happy for the loan and commits to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase beef, pork and lamb at wholesale.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is married and has three children ranging in age from two years to ten years. She describes herself as an honest and humble woman. She runs a general store where she sells items such as Blue Band (a brand of margarine), water jugs, steel wire, razor blades, and other goods. She has been in this business for the last two years. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to buy additional stocks of the goods she sells.  She will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy more sugar, Blue Band, water jugs, steel wire, and other items. Tabitha's hope and dream is to run a wholesale shop within the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, margarine, water jugs, steel wire, and other goods.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is married with three children. Lucena is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lucena is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan to purchase three sacks of fertilizer. 

Lucena has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Tujikaze Group

texts.fr: Aimée est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Tujikaze», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un mécanicien, âgée de 50 ans, mère de 5 enfants dont 1 scolarisé et 4 sont déjà mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique avec divers articles manufacturés. Elle va acheter les piles, les huiles, sucre, riz, savons, sardines, biscuits, etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir son enfant. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à souligner que l'un des clients porte son bébé.
texts.en: Aimée is a trader and a member of the Tujikaze banc villageoise, a client of IMF Hekima. She is 50 years old and married to a mechanic. Together, they have had five children, one of which is currently receiving an education while the other four are already married. She started her business with funds given to her by her husband. She runs her own stall where she sells various manufactured goods. She wishes to purchase batteries, oils, sugar, rice, soaps, sardines, biscuits, etc. She wishes to obtain further loans so she can grow her business and provide for the child who still lives under her care. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support they give to entrepreneurs outside of the banking system. We would like to point out that one of the clients is holding her baby.

loans.use: to purchase batteries, oils, sugar, rice, soaps, sardines, biscuits, etc

loans.name: Twuzuzanye Group

texts.en:
Alodie, age 42, is a group leader. She is married with four children aged between 12 and 21 years; three of them go to school. The group is called TWUZUZANYE, which means “Collaborate” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses for making their future better. She sells foodstuffs, and has been doing in a business for the past seven years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, maize and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children, and to make savings for her better future.

loans.use: to buy more beans, maize and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the business

loans.name: Samad

texts.en: Samad is an Internally Displaced Person from the Lachin region and now resides in Beylagan. In 2003 he applied to the Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $300 and started  his cattle breeding in his native region. He breeds cows and sells milk. Now he wants to add more cows and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Leonice

texts.en: Leonice T. lives with Jean Claud Alfonso and together they raise her three children, Pedro Danilo , age 12; Usmilena, age 7; and one-year-old Jesus Manuel. Leonice is 32 years old and is from Haiti. This is her first year in business. Even though she has the equivalent of a 4th grade education, Leonice has now successfully completed business training and has demonstrated that she is able to handle this loan of $200 to expand her inventory of shoes and clothing, which she sells to the local community.

loans.use: Increase inventory of shoes & clothing

loans.name: Belkin Anabel

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Belkin Anabel and my main source of income is a grocery retailing business. I depend on a small pulperia (a traditional grocery store that sometimes sells prepared foods) in my house that allows me to help my family and contribute to household expenses. I've been operating the pulperia for a year. My future plan is to supply more merchandise so that I can offer my customers a variety of products and thereby increase my income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Belkin Anabel, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, la que permite atender a mi familia y generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi hogar, tengo un año de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad. Mi planes futuros es surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer a los clientes variedad de productos, logrando asi mejores ingresos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Señora Carmen Huamán Cárdenas is a 49 year-old, persevering woman who with much sacrifice was able to complete her studies of pedagogy (education), which she completed through an evening school. The knowledge of this field has allowed her to set up a little booksotre in her home, in which she spends most of her time when she is not teaching classes. The lack of a family has worked out well for her, because she takes care of her niece along with her daughter, who lost her parents at a very young age; they have been a great joy for Carmen. It is for this reason that she wants to increase her income in this activity and jointly open up sales for sewing items with the little extra space that she has available. Carmen requires your collaboration to grow economically and become a provider for her niece and niece's daughter, who are now a part of her heart. Your collaboration is very important for her to continue carrying out such a noble job and continue providing for the well being of her two loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Carmen Huamán Cárdenas, de 49 años, es una mujer empeñosa que con mucho sacrificio pudo concluir sus estudios de pedagogía, que llevaba a cabo en una escuelita por las tardes, el conocimiento de esta actividad le ha permitido acondicionar una pequeña librería en casa, en la cual pasa el mayor tiempo cuando no esta dictando clases. La carencia de una familia se ha visto muy bien copada, por la presencia de su sobrina, ya que perdió a sus padres muy joven y a su pequeña hija, a quién alberga muy gentilmente ya que se ha llegado a convertir en una gran alegría para ella.Es por ello que desea incrementar su inversión en esta actividad y conjuntamente aperturar una mercería en el pequeño espacio que tiene a su disposición y aún no ocupa.Carmen requiere de su colaboración para crecer económicamente y convertirse en un sostén para su sobrina y su sobrina nieta quienes ahora forman parte de su corazón.Su colaboración es muy importante para que siga desempeñando tan noble labor y siga generando bienestar a sus dos grandes compañías

loans.use: Increase the quantity of articles that she offers in her little bookstore.

loans.name: Brada

texts.fr:
Mrs. Brada W. is a 38 year-old woman who lives in the village of Amégran. She is married and has three children. She is a seamstress by profession but also makes money from other activities, such as selling fruit juice and ice. The two secondhand freezers she has been using to date have broken down. This has caused a drop in business and also her income. She would like to buy a new freezer so that she can relaunch her business. She would also like to buy a sewing machine for dressmaking. To do this she is asking for a loan of $500. This will enable her to improve her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Brada W. est une dame de 38 ans qui vit dans le village d’Amégran. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Couturière de profession, elle mène d’autres activités génératrices de revenus comme par exemple la vente de jus de fruits et d’eau glacée. Les deux congélateurs d’occasion qu’elle utilise jusqu’alors sont en pane. Ce qui a fait chuter son activité ainsi que son revenu. Elle veut aujourd’hui acheter un congélateurs neuf afin de relancer ses activités. Egalement, elle veut acheter une machine à coudre pour sa couture. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $500. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer sa revenu

loans.use: To buy a freezer and a sewing machine

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: I am Saima T. from the second big city in Pakistan, Lahore. I am married and a mother of two sons. My elder son is in kindergarten, whereas the other is only one and a half years old and therefore does not attend school. We live here in Lahore in a three-room mud brick house.My husband is a welder and needs a loan of $350 for his welding shop. He intends to buy a grinder, a drill machine and a new welding plant with your loan.

loans.use: Buy welding machine, drill machine and a grinder for the business

loans.name: Clavelitas Group

texts.es:
The "Clavelitas" is an enterpreneur women's group with very low profile. These extremely shy women come from Santa Rita de Najuala, a very rural community located in the town of Solola.

Even tough they come from a very humble home, many of them are very successful business women. Seven out of the twenty-five are requesting loans higher than the usual amount, the rest are just requesting the common amount requested. It is very important to point out that this success has been achieved in less than three years.

The majority of these women are weavers who make traditional dresses. Most common items are: huipiles (cotton blouses), cortes (skirts), skirts and shirts.

Many of these women have improved their life because the sell their goods to local merchants. However, with the credit they are requesting, they are hoping to become merchants themselves. The majority of the women are going to use the money to buy fabrics and threads to make these traditional dresses.

They hope to improve their their business, homes and even purchase some land! The success of their business depends of the capital they are able to acquire. This is why your support is so important!

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Las Clavelitas es un grupo de mujeres muy emprendedoras, pero de perfil muy bajo. La timidez yace en que las clientas de este banco comunal provienen de Santa Rita de Nahuala, una comunidad rural muy retirado en el departamento de Sololà.

A pesar de que las clientas provengan de un origen humilde, muchas de ellas son empresarias muy exitosas. Siete de veinte y cinco clientas están solicitando los montos más altos dentro de la institución, mientras que la gran mayoría están solicitando préstamos promedios. Es importante notar que esta carrera éxitosa lo han logrado en cuestión de dos a tres años.

La gran mayoría de mujeres en las Clavelitas son dotadas tejedoras que trabajan elaborando trajes típicos autóctonas del área rural en Guatemala. Los productos más comunes son: huipiles (blusas de algodón), cortes (faldas), fajas y blusas (poliéster).

Estas mujeres salieron adelante en el mundo textil porque antes muchas elaboraban el tejido para un comercializador, sin embargo ahora con el crédito que reciben ellas se han convertido en tejedoras y comercializadoras al mismo tiempo. La mayoría de señoras van a utilizar su préstamo para comprar hilos y tejidos para elaborar sus trajes tradicionales. Otras van a utilizar su préstamo para comprar ganado para su respectiva crianza y venta.

Las señoras de las Clavelitas esperan prosperar para poder ampliar su negocio, su casa o comprar un terreno. El éxito de su negocio depende del capital que puedan obtener para ampliar su negocio. ¡Es por eso que es importante apoyarlas!

loans.use: This loan is going to be used to purchase threads and other goods in order to be able to make traditional dresses. They also hope to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Irene S.. She is married with one child, aged five, and has one other dependent, her niece.

In 2004 Irene established a general store. She now plans to diversify her business by selling soft drinks and needs a loan to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To diversify her business by selling soft drinks, and to purchase stocks of soft drink in bulk.

loans.name: Generosa Mario

texts.pt:
Generosa Mario M. was born in Chicumbane in the district of XaiXai in Gaza. She is 42 years old. She studied until the 10 th grade and had to stop attending school because she became pregnant. She lives with her son and 7 brothers. In 1998 she started working at the Boane conservatory as a technical assistant, she has been there ever since. She joined the Tchuma credit program before but did not continue because the interest rates were too high.

Generosa was introduced to HLUVUKU by her co-workers. With the loan of 10,000mt she wants to buy construction material to build her home. In the future she wants to have enough credit to furnish her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 6 - Boane Cliente: Generosa Mario M. Actividade: Habitação Valor de credito: 10.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 10/03/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Generosa Mario M. Nasceu em Chicumbane distrito de Xai Xai provincia de gaza a 42 anos. Estudou ate a 10ª classe e teve que parar porque ficou gravida sem ter planificado. Tem actualmente um fiho pequeno e 7 irmaos sendo ela a 3ª. Saiu de Xai xai a Boane com os pais, ela ainda era criança e vieram para aquele distrito acompanhando o pai que tinha sido transferido. Em 1998 começou a trabalhar na conservatoria de boane como assistente tecnica dos registos e notariados onde esta ate então.

Ja foi cliente da cooperativa de creditos de nome Tchuma e abandonou porque considera os juros altos. Descobre a HLUVUKU graças a converças com colegas do trabalho. Com emprestimo de 10.000,00MT pretende comprar materiais de construcao para dar continuidade com as obras da residencia familiar. A sua prespectiva futura é ter outro credito para aplicar na compra de alguns bens de uso familiar.

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: María Felipa

texts.es:
María B. is married and the mother of 2 children. They live in a rented house in Encarnación. María was born and raised in another city, but when she was older came to live with her husband and started her own business.

Previously María and her husband sold different goods by request, which they brought from Ciudad del Este and sold in Encarnación. After seven years and thanks to good profits generated by their sales, they were able to start up their own store. Today, after three years of operation, the business has grown quite a bit and they now have a van which they use for deliveries and to buy their goods.

The name of their store is "Nueva Esperanza" and they sell a variety of merchandise such as articles for the home like plates, flatware, pitchers, pictures and other various goods such as toys, flip flops, shoes, dolls, wading pools, etc. They have two employees to take care of the store and, thankfully, things are going well and they are able to support their family.

Now they are requesting a new loan to buy more merchandise so they can keep a greater variety of stock in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María B., es casada y madre de 2 hijos, ellos viven en una casa alquilada en Encarnación, María nació y creció en otra ciudad, pero de grande vino a vivir con su esposo y monto su propio negocio.

Anteriormente, María y su esposo, se dedicaban a la venta bajo pedido de artículos varios que traían de Ciudad del Este y que vendían en Encarnación; luego de siete años y gracias a las buenas ganancias generadas de sus ventas, ellos montaron su propio negocio fijo. Hoy día ya el comercio ha crecido bastante luego de tres años de funcionamiento y ya tienen también una camioneta que lo utilizan para repartos y compras de mercaderías.

El nombre de su tienda es “Nueva Esperanza” y en la misma comercializan distintos tipos de mercaderías como artículos para el hogar como platos, cubiertos, jarras, cuadros; artículos de bazar como juguetes, zapatillas, zapatos, muñecas, piscinas de plásticos, entre otros. Ellos emplean a dos personales más para la atención del negocio que gracias a Dios marcha muy bien y les permite ganarse el sustento para la familia.

Hoy día solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar más mercaderías para de este modo poder mantener mayor variedad de stock en el negocio.

.

loans.use: Purchase plates, glassware, flatware, toys, shoes, flip flops, frames, tablecloths, wallets, stationery supplies, etc.

loans.name: Chuks

texts.en: Mr. Chuks E. is 43 years and married with three children. He lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. He is a motorcycle rider. He learned his trade over four years and started riding in 2000. He needs a loan of $875.00 to buy a motorcycle. He is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Originally from Keve, a village located 40 kilometers northwest of Lomé, Mrs. Akossiwa K. was born April 18th, 1965. She is a widow and is caring for four children. After the death of her husband in 2005, she started doing business selling fabric in the Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. She has to travel around ten kilometers by foot each day to make good sales. She is seeking for the first time a loan to buy 100 lengths of Hitarget brand fabric. With income from retail sales, she will be able to pay next year’s school fees for her children.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Originaire du village de KEVE, localité située à 40 Km au nord ouest de Lomé, Madame K. Akossiwa est née le 18 avril 1965. Elle est veuve et a 4 enfants à charge. Après la mort de son mari en 2005, elle a commencé le commerce de pagne dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle parcourt en moyenne 10 km à pieds par jour pour pouvoir bien vendre. Elle sollicite pour la première fois ce crédit pour acheter 100 pièces de pagne de marque Hitarget. Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants pour l’année prochaine.

loans.use: Purchase 100 lengths of fabric

loans.name: Thuan

texts.vi:
Her family has many children but littL. land to cultivate. Currently she has 3 acres of land but was only abL. to plant 200 roots of the green dragon plants due to lack of money. Income from growing the green dragon plants is not much. Last year she made 90 USD because of limited technology, and because the business is new so production is low. Her family needs the guidance and technology of the experts in the agriculture field. Presently, she and her husband want to raise cows not only to save up for their children, but also to use the manure to fertilize the green dragon plants. Average income 12 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Gia đình thuộc diện đông con nhưng đất đai canh tác thì ít, hiện tại có 3 sào đất nhưng mới trồng được 200 trụ thanh long vì không có vốn. Thu nhập từ thanh long chưa cao, năm rồi thu được 14,5 triệu vì kỹ thuật trồng còn hạn chế, mặt khác do mới trồng nên năng suất thấp. Gia đình rất cần sự hướng dẫn kỹ thuật của các chuyên gia trồng trọt. Hiện tại vào lúc này vợ chồng muốn nuôi bò vừa tích lũy cho các con vừa lấy phân để bón cho thanh long. Thu nhập bình quân 200.000 đ.

loans.use: Grow Green Dragon

loans.name: Zoila Belinda

texts.es:
Miss Zoila Belinda is 44 years old. She studied the career of Early Education for special children in the city of Lima for 9 months, but she had to stop because she has to start working to support her parents, her Dad didn’t have a job at the time. Zoila later came to the Port of Chicama; she got married and now she has 5 children. They all are independent, work, and live in the District of Razuri in the Province of Ascope at the Department of La Libertad. In order to support her husband economically she started selling ceramics and artificial flowers 12 years ago. Later, she received an invitation from a friend to be part of the Communal Bank “MALABRIGO II”. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. With the first loan of $300, she bought flowers, vases, musical plush animals, sweaters, etc. With this loan of $400 that she will repaid over a period of four payments; she will invest this money in buying blankets, sweaters, ponchos, caps, gloves, vests, coffee pots, pictures, briefcases, etc. The partner wishes is to keep on being employed at Manuela Ramos, an be able to buy a showcase to display her products to the clients and to keep on investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zoila Belinda, tiene 44 años, estudió la carrera de Educación Inicial para niños especiales en la ciudad de Lima durante 09 meses pero se retiró porque tenía que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, su Papá no tenía trabajo, la socia después vino al Puerto Chicama, se comprometió y ahora tiene 05 hijos, los cuales son independientes y trabajan, vive en el Distrito de Razuri en la Provincia de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad.
