Para ayudarse económicamente empezó hace 12 años a vender cerámica, flores artificiales para apoyar a su esposo y seguir adelante. Posteriormente recibe una invitación de una amiga para participar en el Banco Comunal “MALABRIGO II”, tiene 02 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió, invirtió en la compra de flores, floreros, peluches musicales, polos, etc. Con este préstamo de S/.400.00 que cancelará en 4 cuotas, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra de frazadas, polares, ponchos, gorros, guantes, chalecos, cafeteras, cuadros, maletines, etc. La socia sueña con seguir trabajando en Manuela Ramos, comprar una vitrina para mostrar los productos al cliente y seguir invirtiendo en el negocio.

loans.use: Buy blankets, sweaters, ponchos, caps, gloves, vests.

loans.name: Sikuzani

texts.en:
Sikuzani is 29 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages 8, 6, and 2. She is a clothing and cake seller. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM at her business.

Sikuzani is now requesting a loan to improve her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: To improve her business by increasing her current stock

loans.name: Bol

texts.en: Bol R., 57, is married and lives with two of her four children in the Prey Veng, Cambodia. She is a true entrepreneur who has a business selling porridge in the village. She has been doing that business since 2001 and is able to make US$3 per day, while her husband is a construction foreman and makes US$3 as well. Bol R. is asking for a loan from Kiva via CREDIT, a local partner, to purchase land for resale whenever the land price is high.

loans.use: To purchase land for resale.

loans.name: Gueider

texts.es: GUEIDER TIENE 39 AÑOS, SU ESPOSA 35 AÑOS, TIENE 3 HIJOS, Y LA VIVIENDA ES PROPIA. EL SEÑOR SE DEDICA AL SECADO DE ARROZ EN UN INGENIO ARROCERO, RECIBE RENTA DE 3 MOTOS Y SU ESPOSA ES EMPLEADA DOMESTICA. EXISTE BASTANTE COMPETENCIA EN EL TRANSPORTE DE MOTO, PERO TAMBIEN BASTANTE DEMANDA, PARA EMPLEADA DOMESTICA HAY BASTANTE DEMANDA. LA RENTA QUE RECIBE POR MOTO ES DE 30 Bs por dia, Y TIENEN SUELDO FIJO POR EL SECADO DE ARROZ Y POR LAS LABORES DOMENTICAS. EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGO E INFOCRED NO PRESENTA ASPECTOS NEGATIVOS.
texts.en:
Gueider is 39 and his wife is 35. They have 3 children and own their own home. Gueider dries rice in a rice refinery. He also rents out 3 motorcycles, and his wife is a maid. There is quite a lot of competition in motorcycle transportation, but there is also a lot of demand. There is also a lot of demand for maids. He receives 30 bolivianos ($4.25) per day from renting out the motorcycles. They have a fixed salary from drying rice and working as a maid. Gueider does not present any negative aspects in terms of credit risk.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
At 60, Beatriz is still assiduous about their farming business. She is married to a responsible man and they have nine children; four of them are already married and three are still studying. The family is living happily in the community even though life is quite difficult.

She and her husband manage a .06 hectare rice field, .05 vegetable field and a two fish ponds as their main source of income. Sometimes when they are not busy with their own farm, they work as farm laborers for others.

Beatriz and her husband observed that managing a vegetable farm is more profitable than planting corn and rice. So she wants to prioritize and expand her vegetable business and she is asking for a loan capital of PHP20, 000.00. She will utilize her loan to maintain her vegetable plants and her rice and corn fields.

She believes that God is merciful to those who do everything in life just to succeed. Thus, Beatriz really works hard for she knows that God will answer her prayers at an unexpected time.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
This small loan will go to three women, and the group leader, Mrs. Un S., is 40 years old. She is a vegetable market seller, selling different kinds of vegetables such as cabbages, morning glories, and cucumbers. She currently earns an average of US$ 7 a day to sustain her family. She began this business in 1999. She is widowed and has three children, all of whom are still young and attend school. Her older sister is living with her. She makes a living selling mixed fruit juice and helps meet the family's needs.

To improve her business, S. is applying for a loan to buy more vegetables for sale, as well as for her older sister to enlarge her business.

The two other borrowers are:

Em N., 46, who is selling rice and porridge, etc. She's requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her family to ride.

Pich C., 45, is a Cambodian military person. She needs a loan to begin a new business as a hairdresser.

The borrowers live in Steung Meachey Commune in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Hilda Agustina

texts.es:
Hilda se dedica a su bodega de abarrotes desde hace cinco años. Nos contó que la suya fue la primera tienda de este tipo en la zona. No obstante, desde que ella empezó con su negocio han aparecido muchas otras bodegas y la competencia ha disminuido las ventas.

Sin embargo, Hilda sigue en el negocio porque de esta manera le queda tiempo y energía para dedicarse a sus dos hijas de 11 y 8 años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a hacer limpieza en locales lejos de su casa, pero este trabajo le quitaba mucho tiempo, lo que le impedía hacerse cargo de sus dos hijas, por lo que prefirió abandonar este empleo.

Ahora, a sus 33 años, tiene el tiempo para cuidar a lo que es realmente prioritario para ella: su familia y su hogar.
texts.en:
Hilda has worked in her grocery store for the past 5 years. She tells us that hers was the first grocery store in this area. Since she began her business many other stores have appeared and the competition is affecting her sales. However, Hilda continues with her store because in this way she has enough time and energy to dedicate to her two daughters, 11 and 8 years old. She used to work cleaning in places far away from her home, but that job took up too much of her time and interfered with caring for her daughters, which is why she left that job. Now, at 33 years old, she has time to care for what really matters to her: her family and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in her store

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia está casada, y utiliza las ganancias de su negocio, al que se dedica desde hace diez años, para cubrir los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo. Tienen cuatro hijos, dos varones y dos mujeres, pero todos ya son casados e independientes. 
Eugenia tiene un pequeño bazar en su casa, donde vende productos variados como  abarrotes, dulces y gaseosas. Además tiene un negocio de salchipapas en el cual también invierte.
A pesar de que tiene préstamos por EDAPROPSO desde hace cuatro años, ya anteriormente ahorraba sus ganancias para la mejora de su hogar. Junto a su esposo construyeron su casa desde que no había nada, y a sus cincuenta y tres años sus planes para mejorar su nivel de vida continúan. En un futuro le gustaría abrir un restaurante o quizás, como su hija es estilista, un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Eugenia is married and uses the earnings from her business - which she has had for the past 10 years - to help her husband take care of household expenses. They have four children, two boys and two girls, who are all married and living on their own. Eugenia has a small convenience store in her home where she sells a variety of goods such as groceries, candy and soft drinks. She also has a business selling salchipapas (a type of fast food that consists of thinly sliced hot dogs and french fries, mixed together). In spite of the fact that she has had loans from EDAPROPSO for the past four years, she used to save her profits to make improvements to her home. Together with her husband they built their house from nothing, and at 53 years old her plans are to continue to improve her standard of living. In the future she would like to open a restaurant or maybe, since her daughter is a beautician, a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, beer and candy.

loans.name: Dominika

texts.en:
Dominika M. is 35 years old and married, with three children ages 15, 6 and 3. She sells bites (snacks) in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She has been selling bites for seven years. She works 12 hours per day at her business and earns an average monthly profit of $310.

Dominika is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy ingredients so that she can expand her business by selling more bites. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her profits, thereby enabling her to grow her business, improve her home, provide more food for her family, pay school fees for her children, and save money for the future.

loans.use: To buy more items so she can prepare more bites for sale and expand her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. is forty years old. She is divorced due to a misunderstanding that ensued between her and the husband and she has remained a single parent ever since. She is a mother of three children. Two of her children are in the senior high school while the first born is in the Polytechnic. Currently, Cecilia lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Elmina, near Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. 
Cecilia is a restaurant operator. She cooks and serves foods such as rice and stew, yam slices, etc. in her restaurant. She procures the food items from the wholesalers from her community. She has been in this business for eight years. She wants a loan to procure food items and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane G. manages a small "sari sari" store. She is 39 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband, Ozne G., supports her all the way in her business. She wants to grow her store even more. In that way, she will be able to send her kids to school. She wants all of them to graduate college so that when they are older they can look for better jobs to support their future families.

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her business. The loan will help her attract more customers. In this way, she believes she will be able to increase her income and better support the needs of her children.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It is organized to respond the need of small businessmen. CEVI does not just provide loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: My name is Naseem and I am 27 years old, residing in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan--a city famous for its sweetmeats and festivals. I have been in this city for the past six years. My husband's name is M. P.. He has a livestock business. He buys different kinds of animals (buffaloes and goats) and sells to clients who are in the market for the animals. He has been in this business for the past three years. I’m applying for a loan to buy another buffalo so that my husband is able to complete his orders and earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
"My husband and I are now preparing for our next planting. We have been busy preparing everything, the labor as well as the equipment to use. We started farming since the start of our marriage. Our harvest is mainly our source of income to pay the school, books, and other needs of our five children," says Helen D., a farmer from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao.

She would like a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI (a Kiva field partner). She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and other farm inputs.

CEVI is helping farmers sustain their livelihoods. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lysan

texts.en:
Lysan J. is from the village of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Lysan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lysan owns & operates a food stall situated near the school where she sells meats, snacks & other delicacies. Lysan has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lysan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lysan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lysan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income to the family and to improve the house. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Nelson Francisco

texts.es: Nelson Francisco Carrión R. tiene la edad de 32 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. El inicio este medio de vida  realizando las ventas de refrescos, naturales y golosinas al principio sus clientes solo compraban sus refrescos pero sus clientes demandaban otros productos, por lo que es así como decide invertir en granos básicos entre otras cosas. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo  para la compra de vitrinas, golosinas, granos básicos. El sueño de Nelson es proporcionarles una vida digna a su esposa y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelson Francisco C. R. is 32 years old and he is a married man. He has 2 children in his care. He runs a grocery store. For the past 6 years he has been running this business. He started out by selling soft drinks, snacks and fresh foods. At first his clients only bought drinks but then they started buying his other items too. He has decided to invest in the purchase of basic grains and other items. The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital, to purchase display cases, snacks, and basic grains. Nelson's dream is to provide a dignified life to his wife and children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Koudjoukalo

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’atsanvé non loin d’agoè au nord de la ville de lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des objets plastiques. Le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de bien vendre et de  subvenir aux charges de sa famille, pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 03 douzaines de seaux plastiques moyen, 02 douzaines de seaux plastiques grand et 02 douzaine de glacière. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de ce commerce, elle contribue aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and the mother of three. She lives with her family in the Atsanvé district, not far from Agoè in the north of the city of Lomé. She earns revenues from selling plastic items. The inventory she currently has does not allow her to sell much and to meet family expenses. To do so, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 3 dozen medium-sized plastic buckets, 2 dozen large ones, and 2 dozen coolers (insulated containers). With what she earns from her commerce, she helps with covering household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic products to sell

loans.name: Mukama Talemwa A Bageya Jessica Group

texts.en:
B. Jessica is using this loan to purchase yeast, millet and so forth, for making local brew to sell. The loan is improving her business so that she is able to pay school fees for her children and look after her family's needs. Her hope is to set up a cloth business in the future for extra income.

B. Jessica is the representative of her group. She is 35 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are going to school and she is looking after three dependents that also go to school.

loans.use: To purchase yeast, millet and so forth for making local brew

loans.name: Katia

texts.en:
Katia M. D. is 36 years old and is married with four children.  She sells vegetables.  Katia’s husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver.  

Katia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and belongs to the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage).  Katia plans to invest this loan of 1000 soles in local agricultural products to sell at her vegetable stand.  Among other items, she will buy lemons, yucca, sweet peppers and cilantro at wholesale prices.  Since Katia first began working with Manuela Ramos, her business has grown bit by bit.  The organization’s short loan repayment periods enable her to have a good capital flow for her business.         

Katia’s goal is for her family to have their own motorcycle taxi.  (At the moment Katia’s husband is a driving a motorcycle taxi which belongs to his sister).

loans.use: Lemons, yuca, sweet peppers, cilantro and other vegetables to sell at a stand.

loans.name: Janibichi Group

texts.en:
Martha is a member of the  Janibichi borrower group in Mwanjewa, Mbeya, She is 48 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 28,25, and 22 years old.

Martha has owned a food business selling Tomatoes,potatoes for 8 years. She works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Martha`s  first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more potatoes, tomatoes etc.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Martha hopes to save more money and expand her business.


Hilda is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, vegetable, potatoes

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 44 años, es una madre muy amorosa y vive en su casa propia junto a  su hijo Ronal de 18 años, a quien desea dar unos buenos estudios superiores. El puesto de venta de fibra de alpaca de Elena está ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca). Su negocio es muy concurrido, ya que sus clientes saben que ahí podrán encontrar fibra de buena calidad y a un bajo precio, lo que ha hecho que su negocio marche muy bien. Lo que más le gusta a Elena de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 14 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer en su puesto de venta todo el día. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el tercer préstamo de Elena con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una de las socias más responsables. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más fibra para implementar mejor su puesto.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Solano Group

texts.es:
Hortencia Leonor S. V., Darling de los Ángeles F. y Ulises Fernando M. conforman el grupo S.. Ellos son provenientes del reparto Martín Castellón de Nindiri. 

S. V. de 24 años es la coordinadora del grupo. El negocio de ella consiste en la venta de comida a domicilio, trabaja haciendo entrega de comida casera a los trabajadores de algunas empresas del lugar.  Darling F. desde hace nueve años vende tortillas y Ulises M. distribuye huevos. 

Ellos necesitan el préstamo para lograr que su negocio prospere y brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: para comprar granos básicos, carne y otros ingredieste para cocinar

loans.name: Ajok

texts.en:
Ajok M. is 26 years old and is widowed. She has 2 children and her children go to school.

Ajok is in the business of selling beer at the bar. She requests a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. 

With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is the 45-year-old married mother of five children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Most of the town's inhabitants are involved in farming and other trading activities. Esther is in the fish selling business. She buys smoked fish from nearby fishing communities, then hawks her goods in her own community as well as selling at the local market. Esther has been in this business for 15 years. She hopes to obtain a loan to procure goods in bulk in order to expand her business. She believes the loan will help her inject more working capital into her trade in order to enable her to make enough income to support her family and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Tapaga

texts.en:
Tapaga L. is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Taga. She is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Tapaga owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Tapaga has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities. In 2008, Tapaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tapaga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Tapaga is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Tapaga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
la sra. Balbina G. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en union libre y tuvo 7 hijos de los cuales solo cuatro dependen de ella, ya que los otros ya formamon sus hogares.
Balbina se dedica a la venta de baleadas, panqueques, osmil, café, leche con cereal, rosquillas y tamales. estas comidas tiene mucho tiempo de venderlas en la ciudad de langue; negocio con el cual le a dado el sosten a su familia durante muchos años, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean personas honorables y buenos profesionales.
Balbina necesita el credito para poder comprar los ingredientes para la fabricacion de sus comidas, comprandolas al por mayor tiene mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Balbina G. is 54 years old and she has a common-law marriage. She had seven children, only four of whom still depend on her as the others have set up their own homes. Señora Balbina sells baleadas (a wheat-flour tortilla filled with beans and other ingredients), pancakes, osmil (oatmeal), coffee, cereal with milk, rosquillas (ring-shaped pastries) and tamales. She has been selling this food in the town of Langue for a long time. This business has allowed her to support her family for many years. Her greatest wish is for her children to be honorable and professional people. Señora Balbina needs a loan to buy the ingredients with which to prepare the food she sells. She purchases the ingredients wholesale to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, firewood, beans, butter, cheese, honey, coffee, milk and oats

loans.name: Concepción Group

texts.es:
El grupo Concepción está integrado por Alma Nubia M. C. quien hace 20 años inicio vendiendo 10 pares de zapatos los cual con el tiempo fue creciendo gracias a los préstamos y sus estrategias de mercado.

 Sus compañeras Gladis V. R. de 24 años también vende zapatos y Rosa Argentina S. desde hace quince años tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste  en alimento fritos como tajas con queso, enchilada, carne asada, cerdo asado, frito, pollo etc.
texts.en:
The group Concepción is integrated because of Almba Nubia M. C., who 20 years ago initiated selling 10 pairs of shoes, with which in time she grew her business thanks to loans and her market strategies. Her partners are Gladis (24 years old) who also sellis shoes, and Rosa, who for 15 years has had a fried snack shop, a popular restaurant which consists of fried food such as cheese bread, enchiladas, barbecued meat, barbecued pork, chicken etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes and sandals

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old farmer Virgilio plows a rice field. He strives hard, working on his farm to support his five children. He wants his children to have a bright future. He wants to improve his farming to have a greater income.

He heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner that offers financial assistance to entrepreneurs like him. He joined and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos to support his farm.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Antonio Josè

texts.es:
Para Antonio José la zapatería siempre ha sido en pan de cada día en su casa, pues es una  tradición familiar que él ha continuado; Su negocio de elaboración de calzado iniciò cuando desde muy temprana edad ayudaba a su papá en el oficio; este fuè su primera fuente de aprendizaje, donde aprendió a valerse por si mismo,  para posteriormente trabajar en varias empresas de calzado en la que fortaleció su experiencia inicial;  como sus ganancias como empleado  no le satisfacían, porque tenia el deseo de ser independiente,  dio el gran salto e iniciò su primera unidad de negocio con mucho esfuerzo y  desde hace cuatro años tiene un taller donde fabrica calzado para damas caballeros y para niños, los cuales produce  por encargo de sus clientes.
Antonio diseña los modelos de acuerdo a la moda, requerimientos y necesidades de sus clientes, su reto mas significativo es la innovación para estar a la vanguardia, por eso debe estar atento a   revistas especializadas, visitar almacenes de calzado, observar los artistas, en fin estar pendiente por todos los medios de la oferta, la demanda y la moda, pues debe ofrecer a su cliente lo mejor.    
Antonio, tiene 35 años y es una persona alegre y tranquila, vive en su casa del Municipio de Soledad, la tierra de la butifarra-embutido y el bollo de yuca, que està ubicado en el Departamento del Atlántico; es casado y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 14 años a quien quiere ver estudiando insistentemente,  para que sean unos profesionales con oportunidades de bienestar; quiere que su negocio crezca pues ello le representa mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
Este es el primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y solicita $1.500.000, dinero que invertirá en la compra de materias primas en un mayor volumen, como material sintético para capelladas, suelas,  cuero, puntillas y especialmente en pegantes; él sueña con tener  su propia línea de calzado y se prepara gradualmente para ese fin.
texts.en:
For Antonio José, shoemaking has always been the source of his family’s income because it’s a family tradition that he is now continuing. His shoemaking business began when he was still a young boy and he used to help his father. This was his first training in this field, where he learned how to be on his own. Later on, he worked for several shoemaking companies where he deepened his knowledge and experience. However, his salary as an employee was not sufficient because he wanted to be independent. He took the leap and started his own business. It was quite an effort but, for the last four years, he has had his own cobbler’s shop where he manufactures shoes for women, men and children. He works based on prior orders from his customers. Antonio designs the shoes according to the latest fashions and his customer’s needs and wishes. His greatest challenge is to be up-to-date on innovations so that he can always be on the cutting edge of his field so he must be aware of what’s in the latest kraft journals, he must visit shoe stores, observe artists, and do whatever is necessary to be tuned into supply, demand, and the latest fashions, in order to offer his customers the very best. Antonio is 35 years old and is a cheerful and calm person. He lives in his own house, which is in Atlántico department. He’s married and has two children, 11 and 14 years old, who he wants to see intensely studying so that they may become professionals with opportunities for well-being. He wants his business to grow because that represents improving his family’s standard of living. This is his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation; he’s asking for $1.500.000 which will be used to buy raw materials in larger quantities such as, synthetic strap material, soles, leather, toe pieces, especially glue-on. He hopes some day to have his own line of shoes and is gradually preparing himself for that end.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoemaking raw materials.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson M. is a young entrepreneur who is 31 years old.  He has been married to Isabel Ayala for 12 years and the couple has four children:  ages 3, 9, 11, and 12.  The family lives in the San Isidro neighborhood of Coronel Oviedo.  Wilson learned his trade as a repairman from his father Heriberto, and with much sacrifice, decided to go off on his own.  Little by little, he gained clients, and now he has an established client base.  He is seeking a loan to purchase replacement parts for the electronics that he repairs for his clients.  His goal is to open his own workshop to provide his clients with better service.

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C., 59, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Enrique C., a driver/carpenter and they are blessed in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own wood-handicrafts business for seven years now.

Remedios has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eleven times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her wood handicraft business. 

Now, with your help, Remedios would like to obtain a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying equipment and expanding her wood-handicrafts business.

Remedios dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education so that they can have a good future. She also envisions her family living a well-off and peaceful life.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy equipment and expand her wood-handicrafts business

loans.name: Jecebel

texts.en: Jecebel is a mother of seven children. She is 36 years old and married. She has been involved in farming for more than a few years now. She cultivates her land for her rice crop, which is a main necessity among Filipinos. She has financial struggles so she joined a microfinance institution. She said that CEVI’s program is very helpful to farmers like her. She is now applying for a loan amounting to PHP14,000. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Romelo

texts.en:
Romelo O. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 39 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Romelo owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Romelo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Romelo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan he has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Duong's Group

texts.en: Mrs. R., 62, is a married woman and the mother of seven children. Four of them are married and work at different occupations. R. lives with her 61-year-old husband. They have been fishermen since 1995, earning approximately US$6.00 per day to solve the financial crisis of their family. The family living conditions are not so good because their house is too old and cracks down. Because of this problem, R. is looking for money to mend her old house. Mrs. R. is the leader of the four-member group who will jointly repay the Kiva loan. Mrs. S., 37, is a clothes seller who is asking for a loan to sustain her business growth.  Mr. S., 27, is a fisherman who is requesting a loan to buy more fishing tools. Mrs. C. has a job as a fish catcher. She needs a loan to buy a boat machine to use for fishing.

loans.use: To mend her old house.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. JUANA,  ella tiene 49 años de edad, es separada y tiene 1 hijo menor, Nuestra socia alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos agrícolas y animales menores, también a la agricultura y ganadería, ella viene trabajando con esta actividad desde hace 20 años, La socia compra ganados de la feria ganadera y los cría, también vende lo que sus terrenos producen, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaquita pequeña.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción" (Virgin of the Immaculate Conception) Village Bank. She lives in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco. She's forty-nine, separated, and has one dependent child. She divides her time between her housework and her retail business. She earns her living buying and selling agricultural products and young animals in addition to farming and raising cattle. She's been doing this for more than twenty years. She buys cows at the cattle fair and raises them. She also sells the produce she grows. She is seeking a loan to buy a young cow. Juana appreciates and values the support she gets from the bank, and she promises to pay her loan back in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juana is seeking a loan to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 62 years old. He is married with five children who are all now adults. He is a farmer from Eastern Kenya in Nkubu. He has been farming for 30 years and his products are milk, cabbage, potatoes and carrots that he sells to the local market. Stephen is also a carpenter and earns income from the carpentry services he offers to the local people.

Stephen has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 47,700 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will be saved to buy land in future which he intends to develop commercially. In five years' time, he intends to increase the number of his dairy cows to four and develop a commercial plot.

He says that through Juhudi he has realized that dairy farming is a business like any other.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Edi Elizabeth

texts.es: Edi Elizabeth C. D. M. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijos D. 21, 9 y 5 años D. edad, los cuales con mucho esfuerzo D. parte D. Edi se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, en donD. comercializa diferentes tipos D. productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar y productos alimenticios, su tienda es bastante granD. y surtida ya que posee diferentes tipos D. productos algunos en pocas cantidades, pero gracias a esto, que Edi cuenta con una gran demanda, ya que es una tienda bastante fuerte, en la cual ofrece sus ventas a muy buenos precios. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para poder incrementar la cantidad D. productos que posee, así mismo invertir en nuevas marcas D. refrescos, golosinas y detergentes, D. manera que tenga mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Edi es una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora, quien se dedica mucho a su familia y que así mismo cuenta con el enorme deseo D. darle todo lo mejor a sus hijos, los cuales son el mayor incentivo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Edi Elizabeth C. D. M., 39, lives in the Llopango municipality with her three children ages 21, 9 and 5, who study thanks to Edi's hard work. She has a store in her home, where she sells different household staples and food products. Her store is fairly large and stocked with different products, some in small quantities; but thanks to this, Edi has a lot of demand and the store is quite strong and offers items at very good prices. She is requesting this loan to gain the necessary money to increase the quantity of her products and to invest in new brands of soft drinks, candy and detergents so that she will have more variety to offer her customers. Edi is a very strong and hard-working woman, who is very dedicated to her family and also has an enormous desire to proviD. her children with all the best; they are her greatest incentive to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japeth M. M. is 36 years old and married. He has two children, aged 6 and 4 years old. His business is located at MaasAi market in Kisumu city along the Kisumu-Nairobi highway. He has been selling curios, necklaces and bangles to the local and international tourists. He has been in this business for the last 11 years. 

He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints due to high transportation costs. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy beads to make the bangles and necklaces to grow his business.  

In the future, he hopes to open a tours and travel company, which is his passion. He describes himself as hardworking, persuasive and outgoing.

loans.use: Beads

loans.name: Akello

texts.en:
Akello O. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and saddles imported from Khartoum to Juba, and is requesting a loan to stock shoes to sell. She is 34 years old and married with a husband who is a driver. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop to keep her items safe from rain.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock shoes to sell

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en: Restituta J. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Restituta owns and operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Restituta has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. Restituta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Restituta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Restituta is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua E. sells cooking utensils at Takoradi. Ekua has received senior high education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. Ekua has been selling cooking utensils for some time now. She responsibly helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more utensils for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more utensils for sale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie S. is from the town of Trento. She is 48 years old. Rosalie is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosalie also raises hogs for fattening.

Rosalie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and livestock feed. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosalie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and livestock feed

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana D. is from the village of Brgy. Calaocan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Joana is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Joana sells fruits and vegetables in the local community. Joana has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan is Joana's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 42 years old and he is married with six children who are between 4 and 16 years old.  Jean Damascene is commonly known in the business of selling goats and this is his 6th successful year in this business at which he works from 6 am to 5 pm every day.

Jean Damascene needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  Once accorded this loan, Jean Damascene will buy additional goats so as to increase the goat sales per day.  Once these sales increase, he will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will hopefully allow him to start the business of selling cows.  By using this loan, Jean has a goal of a better lifestyle for his family and keeping saving for his family's future.

loans.use: More goats to fatten for sale

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn P. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 23 years old. Renelyn is married. To make a living, Renelyn owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Renelyn has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Renelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Renelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. Renelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Renelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.en: Muzafar G. is 58 years old. He is married and has four children. Muzafar was born into a simple, rural family and has worked with livestock for many years. He is very experienced and has the special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock and sells meat and milk. Muzafar is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to enable him to purchase a second dairy cow. The second cow will enable him to increase the milk produced and will provide income security to the family when one of the cows is with calf. The income will enable Muzafar to provide for his family, take good care of his cows and supply his neighbors with quality milk. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for expanding the business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, a 50 year-old father of four, has requested a loan of Kes. 70,000 to purchase products including pawpaws, pineapples, watermelons, potatoes, onions, carrots, bananas, oranges, pumpkins, green peas, and cabbages. He operates a grocery store in a good location in Nairobi with a steady flow of customers. He describes himself as hardworking, polite, and humble and plans to buy a piece of land in the future. He also hopes to open other outlets in other areas of the town in five years time.

loans.use: To purchase products including pawpaws, pineapples, watermelons, potatoes, onions, carrots, bananas, oranges, pumpkins, green peas, and cabbages.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben is a 44-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He lives in a rented house and his mission is to build his own house in the next three years. For two years he has been selling shoes in the market. Financial challenges make it hard for him to meet the specific demands of his customers. Ben is requesting a loan to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Félix Ramón Servían, tiene 45 años, está casado con la señora Natividad de Jesús Cardozo con quien está viviendo más de  5 años, cuenta con 1 hijo, viven en la ciudad de Ybycui  en el Barrio Santa Teresita.
    Félix Servían se dedica al negocio de la construcción y refacción de viviendas, gracias a la responsabilidad y buen trabajo demostrada lleva trabajando más de 15 años  en la mencionada actividad, posee una clientela formada dentro y fuera de la zona.
      Ante el aumento de la demanda en el rubro de la construcción, se ve obligado a la compra de mas herramientas de trabajo para ofrecerles a sus clientes mayor atención y rapidez, motivo por el cual se acerco a la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya  con el fin de solicitar un crédito para poder cumplir con estas falencias.
texts.en:
Félix Ramón Servían is 45 years old.  He is married to Natividad de Jesús Cardozo with whom he has been living for 5 years.  He has one child.  They live in the city of Ybycui in Santa Teresita neighborhood.

Félix Servían builds and refurbishes houses.  Thanks to his responsibility and the good work which he does, he has been in this business for 15 years.  He has a regular customer base both in his district and outside his district.

The demand for his building work has increased so he needs to buy more work tools so that he can offer his customers a better and quicker service.  For this reason he is approaching Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan.

loans.use: To buy tools for his building work

loans.name: Manuel Isaac

texts.es:
Manuel, tiene 27 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, posee una farmacia de la que recibe las ganancias para los gastos  del hogar, él vive con su esposa  y su hija, este negocio primeramente fue administrado por su abuela y en los últimos años se la heredo para que fuera quien le diera seguimiento al negocio.
Por el compromiso de dar continuidad a la farmacia Manuel solicita un préstamo para realizarle inversiones en medicamentos a dicho negocio, con esta ayuda fortalecerá la farmacia y será mejor el servicio y la atención que brindara a los clientes.
Su objetivo es cumplir con el mantenimiento y buen servicio de la farmacia contando con clientes quienes desde hace mucho le conocen, también con el fortalecimiento del inventario de medicamentos busca generar más beneficios para la familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 27 years old.  He lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  He owns a pharmacy from which he makes profits to cover his household expenses.

Manuel lives with his wife and daughter.  This business used to be run by his grandmother and he recently inherited it so that he could keep it running.

In order to keep his pharmacy running, Manuel is requesting a loan so that he can make some investments in buying medicine for his business.  This will help to strengthen the pharmacy and help him to provide a better service to his customers.

Manuel's goal is to keep the pharmacy running and to keep providing a good service to the customers who he has known for a long time.  By strengthening his inventory of medicines, he is looking to make more profits for his family.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 25 years old married to Janet who does not produce any income.  He is supporting three members of the family; his kid is one year old. He runs a food kiosk and he has been in business for 2 years and right now his monthly income is Kshs 6,000.

He is borrowing a loan of Kshs 20,000 and he plans to use it as follows; Kshs 10,000 to purchase wheat flour and Kshs 10,000 to purchase hotel utensils. He will use the anticipated profit to buy cattle and resell them to the middle men who supply them to Kenya Meat Commission when the prices appreciate. When this interview was conducted he was at the group meeting venue and not his business thus we have not captured his business.

His dreams of owning a lorry(truck) so that he can supply cattle to the slaughter houses.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and hotel utensils.

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es:
José, de treinta y cinco años de edad, reside en Usulután, junto a su esposa y dos hijos, residen en casa propia, él posee una tienda de granos básicos, su forma de vender es visitando colonias, barrios y cantones de la zona, a bordo de su vehículo prácticamente es una tienda móvil de granos básicos.

Por el momento necesita invertir en mercadería ya que se le ha agotado, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra, esto le ayudara a tener una mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a los clientes, ya que en su mayoría vende productos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, café, sal, entre otros.

Para don José su propósito es siempre mantener el negocio activo, ofrecer a los clientes productos de calidad y no descuidarse de las zonas donde ya tiene clientela.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old and lives in Usulután with his wife and two children. They live in their own house. He has a store that sells staple grains. He sells them by visiting neighborhoods, districts and townships in the area aboard his vehicle; his business is basically a staple grains store on the move. 

At the moment he needs to invest in merchandise because he has run out of products. He is requesting a loan to make this purchase. This will help him have a greater variety of products to offer to his customers. He mostly sells products such as rice, beans, corn, coffee and salt, among others.

José's goals are to maintain an active business, provide quality products to his customers and not neglect the areas where he already has customers.

loans.use: Buy products.

loans.name: Munhuu

texts.en:
Munhuu, 37, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Their home is located on land that they own. Her older daughter attends a local secondary school and her younger son goes to kindergarten. Munhuu was born in Gobi-Altai province, in southwest Mongolia, where she finished high school. Then she obtained her bachelor's degree in biology and finance management at the National University of Mongolia in 2007 and 2011 respectively.

She started to operate a public transportation business with her husband in 2007. They have their own microbus, which her husband drives while she is a conductor. Now their business has become more stable and their daily profit is 50,000 MNT. Munhuu is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT as they need money to buy a new microbus.

loans.use: To buy a new microbus

loans.name: Akoélé Georgette

texts.fr: Mademoiselle   Georgette  a 31 ans.  Elle  est  née  à  Kovié   et  habite quartier  Wuiti.  Elle fait la vente du  riz et gari. En effet, elle   s’approvisionne  au marché de Kovié et d’Aflao  au Ghana  en gros et  revend  en détail.   Elle cumule 3 ans dans cette activité. Elle sollicite de  Wages  un prêt pour acheter  5  sacs du riz  et  4 sacs  de gari.
texts.en: Ms. Georgette, age 31, was in Kovié and lives in the Wuiti neighborhood in Lomé. She sells rice and tapioca. She buys her supplies wholesale at the market in Kovié and Aflao in Ghana, and resells retail. She's been running this business for three years, and is now seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Wages, in order to buy 5 sacks of rice and 4 sacks of tapioca.

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of rice and 4 sacks of tapioca

loans.name: Nasitasia

texts.en:
Nasitasia is a farmer from the town of Kitale, in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 5 years. Her main products are eggs and milk, which are all sold locally.

She recently repaid her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES for poultry farming. Her major challenges in farming have been diseases and lack of enough animal feeds. She plans to expand her poultry farming in the future and also to acquire a motorbike for transporting her products to the market. 

Nasitasia is 45 years old. She is a widowed mother of 6 children, aged between 3 and 25 years. Three of her children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To invest in poultry farming.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is a married woman who lives in Negros Occidental, Philippines.  She earns her living by buying and selling fruit/root crops and operating a livestock business. Her husband Romeo is 60 years old and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are 20 to 36 years old. Eliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000 to purchase fruit and root crops so that she could continue to save up for future family needs. Eliza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and root crops

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha C. (pictured above) is 41 years old and her husband, Mr. Savan Moul is 53 years old.  They have six children, five sons and one daughter   who go to school. The family lives in a village off of National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chantha and her husband are farmers. They grow various vegetables on their farmland in the village. They sell their vegetables to a middleman who visits their home to buy them.

Chantha hopes to put an addition on her house, to make their home better for their family to live in.  She is applying for a loan of $500 which will be used to build that addition.

loans.use: To put an addition on her house.

loans.name: Erdenee

texts.en: Erdenee is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their own house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His daughter and two sons, age 9, 13 and 15, all attend local secondary school. He manages a clothes trading business with the help of his wife. He started his business in 2000 with working capital of 1,000,000 MNT. He travels to China once in a month in order to import his goods. He managed to build a good relationship both with his customers and suppliers. Now his working capital has reached 2,500,000-3,000,000 MNT. He is a diligent man who says, "I never borrowed money from bank before. But I think that if one will use the loan wisely it is good thing for business expansion." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT to buy summer clothes and increase his business sales.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Viviana Narcisa

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras partes del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Viviana, ella tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y fruto de esta relación tiene una hija de tres años de edad. Su esposo es comerciante. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la fiscal de pagos del Banco y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también vende en su casa ya que hace poco compro unas vitrinas en las cual muestra sus productos a sus clientes, nos cuenta que tiene varios clientes que le realizan pedidos ya que la ropa que ella vende es seleccionada. Trabaja los sábados y domingos desde las 8h30 hasta las 15h00, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Nos cuenta que lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es tener algún día su propio almacén.
texts.en:
In the parish of Ayacucho in the Santa Ana canton, the members of the village bank Friends Forever meets every 15 days. The area is known for its vegetation and for its beautiful freshwater spas that are visited frequently by local tourists and visitors from other parts of the country. 

This is where 22 year old Viviana lives. She is in a relationship and has a three year old daughter with her partner. He is a merchant. Viviana has been in the communal bank since it began and is the auditor of bank payments. She likes the bank because of the benefits she receives from it. 

Viviana is a very good homemaker and she also works selling all types of clothing door to door. She also sells clothes from her home and recently bought a display case so she can show her products to clients. She tells us that she has various clients who order from her because she has a good selection. She works Saturdays and Sundays from 8:30 in the morning until 3pm in the afternoon. She offers credit and charges her customers every 8 days. She has been doing this work for three years and it has gone quite well for her. 

This credit is to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing. 

Her dream is to have her own store one day.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing.

loans.name: Juntas Progresaremos Group

texts.es:
Olinda es una mujer muy emprendedora, que ha sabido dar la educacion a sus hijos, tiene mucha energia la cual la aplica para su negocio de la venta de comida (desayuno, almuerzo), el cual se dedica las mañanas para su preparacion y distribucion pues tambien reparte a domicilio a negocios o a quienes no tienen tiempo para cocinar y por las tardes en su propia casa se dedica a enseñar a leer y escribir a adultos quienes no pudieron hacerlo en su niñez, olinda les enseña como madre enseña a un hijo, con mucho cariño.
Olinda es tesorera de la Alcancia Comunal JUNTAS PROGRESAREMOS, quienes vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por mas de 2 años, la alcancia esta formada por personas responsables quienes buscan un apoyo para continuar y hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios, tambien entre ella se encuentran alumnas de Olinda quienes ya estan aprendiendo a leer y escribir.
texts.en:
Communal Bank Juntas Progresaremos (Together We Will Progress)

Olinda is a very hard working woman who knew to provide for the education of her children.  She has a lot of energy which she applies to her business of selling food.  She prepares the meals in the mornings and distributes them to homes and businesses, to people that do not have time to cook.  In the afternoons she teaches reading and writing to adults that have not been able to learn when they were young.  Olinda teaches lovingly, like a mother would teach her children.

Olinda is the treasurer of the Communal Bank Juntas Progresaremos who has been working  with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for mO. than 2 years.  The bank is made up of responsible people who are looking for support in their goal to continue to grow their small businesses.  Among the members are some of Olinda's students who are already learning to read and write.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel es una madre D. familia que tiene  42 años D. edad, elL. es casada y tiene un hijo menor D. edad, elL. vive con sus familia en una comunidad pequeña llamada Tembladera, perteneciente al departamento D. Cajamarca, provincia D. Contumazá, distrito D. Yonan.

Isabel se dedica aL. venta D. Mariscos (lifes ). Cuenta con 5 años D. experiencia en dicha actividad.  Su producto lo comercializa en L. comunidad D. Tembladera.

Isabel está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000  nuevos soles para que pueda adquirir una mayor cantidad D. Mariscos, y D. esta manera incrementar sus ventas y por consiguiente aumentar su ganancia , para poder tener una mejor calidad D. vida.

Isabel es una persona  muy responsable y tranquiL., cuenta con buenas referencias por parte D. las personas que L. conocen.
texts.en:
Isabel is a mother who is 42 years of age. She is married and has a young son. Isabel lives with her family in the small community of Tembladera, which is part of the District of Yonan in Contumazá Province, Department of Cajamarca.

Isabel sells seafood and has five years of experience in this business. She sells her products in the community of Tembladera.

Isabel is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can acquire a larger quantity of seafood. This will enable her to increase her sales and continue generating more income. As a result, she can have a better quality of life.

Isabel is a responsible and peaceful individual. She received good references from the people who know her.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of seafood.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 37 years old and married with two adult children. She has a retail shop where she sells a  variety of different products in the community.

Rosalinda is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to buy noodles, shampoo, soap and basic cooking ingredients to sell. Each month, Rosalinda earns about Php 4,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, shampoo, soap and basic cooking ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en: Maria lives in Danli, Honduras where she makes a living by purchasing bulk quantities of milk and reselling it in smaller quantities throughout her community. She also makes and sells various types of cheeses that are made from the raw milk she purchases. Maria is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 to purchase bulk quantities of milk given that she is always able to resell whatever amount she purchases.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of milk.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 28 years old and married with one child who is 8 months old. Nine months ago, Stella opened a small cafe in which she sells coffee, tea, and various pastries. In addition, she sells beauty products to a number of different clients. The items include hair products, perfumes, and facial cleansing products. With a 900 USD loan, Stella plans to purchase the latest beauty supplies so that her clients can receive the best possible products. She is a very hardworking woman and is committed to making all of the loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy the latest beauty products to sell to her clients

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 29 years of age, married, and has four children. Two of them are studying while the other two are not enrolled in a school yet. 

Her husband operates a Punjabi food restaurant. He offers his clients good seating arrangements along with good quality food and tea. He is known among his customers for his good customer service and for serving quality food in a quality way. 

Shazia also supports her husband financially by operating a tailoring business. She is very skillful in her work and receives a good number of orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her husband in his business. With the loan, he will buy required ingredients such as lentils, spices, cooking oil, rice, etc. for preparing better quality food and increasing his sales. 

He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Shazia is hopeful that an investment will help him make his business more profitable. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for a Punjabi restaurant

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru:
Расул честный и добросовестный человек.  Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей.   Расул занимается производством лепёшек. С детство он был знаком с этим бизнесом, его отец занимался и он помогал. Более 19 лет уже он занимается этим бизнесом, и он набрал достаточный опыт, чтобы расширить этот бизнес.  Только его жена помогает ему в данном бизнесе. Дети у него еще маленькие. Получая прибыли, он мечтает, устроит своих детей в лучшую школу и университетах, чтобы его дети выросли образованными и честными людьми.  Расул финансируется в Имон Интернэшнл более 28 циклов и у него положительный кредитный досье. Расул запрашивает кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки муки и уголь с целью расширение бизнеса. Заранее благодарить Кива и Имон за поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rasul is a conscientious and honest man.  He's married and has three children. He makes flatbreads for a living. He's been associated with that business since he was a child.  It's what his father did and he helped out.  He's been had his business for more than nineteen years and he has amassed enough experience to expand it.  He has only his wife to assist him; his kids are still small.  Once he has some returns he dreams of sending his kids to a better school and to college so they can grow up educated and honest people. Razul has done more than twenty-eight loan cycles with IMON International and he's got a good credit record.  He is requesting a loan of 3000USD to buy flour and coal in order to expand his business.  He wants to thank Kiva an IMON in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy flour and coal.

loans.name: Nanzaddorj

texts.en:
Nanzaddorj is 51 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Govisumber province of Mongolia. His wife is retired and taking care of the business. 

Nanzaddorj started his business activity in 2007. He operates a grocery trading business. He successfully expanded his business by selling foods as well as also clothes at his shop. He also works as a security guard at the People's party building. During the evening, he is a taxi-driver. Because his shop is located right next to the high school #1, he can sell foods and retail products easily to the market. He is planning to expand his business activity and he is a loyal customer of Xas Bank. He is a diligent man who says "I want to expand my business activity and increase my family income." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to open a new vegetable counter.

loans.use: to open a vegetable counter.

loans.name: Marta Luz

texts.es:
Marta con su anterior credikiva comprò cartulinas boligrafos, làpices borradores y utiles de papelerìa en mayor volumen con lo que ganò descuentos y generò mas ingresos. En la actualidad està aplicando a su segundo credikiva con el cual comprarà nuevamente en mayor volumen,articulos de papelerìa para ofrecer mejores precios y tener un stock de mercancias, para responder a su creciente clientela. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Es un apoyo muy imprtante ya que con esto se estan ayudando muchas familias en Colomia a cambiar su forma de vivir y a salir adelante con sus proyectos y metas." Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Marta ingrese al siguiente enlace: 
http://kiva.org/lend/218627
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Marta was able to buy cartons of pens, pencils, erasers, and writing supplies in large volumes so that she could obtain discounts and generate more income. She is currently requesting a second Kiva loan so that she can make another large purchase of writing supplies, which will enable her to offer better prices and maintain her stock of merchandise in order to respond to her growing customer base.

Marta sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “Your support is very important because it is helping many families in Colombia transform their lives and move forward with their projects and goals.” To learn more about Marta’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/218627

loans.use: to purchase writing supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old and an enterprising business lady. She and her husband Benson are blessed with two children who are 12 and 7 years old. She has been running a green grocer for the past 11 years with the monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET LTD after successfully repaying her previous loans. Josephine will use this loan to buy green vegetables, green maize, and fruits to add to her business stock for sale.
