With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a salon that will cater to her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables, green maize, and fruits to add to her business.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 30-year-old divorced woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling food in a restaurant in the town of Buluk in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Joice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase flour, beans, and rice for her restaurant with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that with the extra income from this loan she will build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, beans, and rice for her restaurant.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Carmela has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Carmela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Carmela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del centro poblado de Chinumani, distrito, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene  58  años de edad, estado civil casada y tiene tres hijos independientes.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de animales, ellos venden productos de la región como papa, chuño, cebada, habas y occa.  Nos cuenta que ella también se dedica a la venta de helados en la localidad de Yunguyo y Desaguadero, trabaja desde hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, comprará azúcar, esencias y barquillos para vender los helados.  Trabaja sola en el negocio su esposo se dedica a los animales.

La señora desea seguir trabajando en el negocio, le gusta de su Banco Comunal la facilidad del préstamo y su ahorro.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of Santa Barbara Communal Bank in the town of Chinumani, located within the District and Province of Yunguyo, and the Department of Puno. She is 58 years old, married, and has three children who are now independent.

Together with her husband she works selling animals, as well as regional products such as potatoes, chuño (freeze-dried potato), barley, beans and oca (an Andean tuber). She tells us that she is also engaged in selling ice cream in the towns of Yunguyo and Desaguadero. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past two years.

With this new loan of 300 PEN (Peruvian Nuevos Soles) she will buy sugar, flavoring and cones to sell ice cream. She works alone in this business and her husband tends to the animals.

Andrea would like to continue with her business. At her communal bank, she likes the credit facilities and her savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flavoring and ice cream cones.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LOS COMERCIANTES”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosario;  La socia tiene 30 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 12, 8, 4 años de edad, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de pasto en sus tiempos libres pero también la socia es trabaja prestando sus servicios del hogar como limpieza, arreglo, cuidado de menores como empleada del hogar; la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de pasto al por mayor para vender gradualmente. La socia desea ahorrar para poder poner un negocio propio al cabo de unos meses. 
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Rosario, 30, belongs to the “Los Comerciantes” (The Merchants) communal bank located in Andahuaylillas District in Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.  She’s single and has three children who are 12, 8 and 4 years old.  She is a fodder merchant but in her free time she also provides housekeeping services as a domestic employee like cleaning, straightening up and babysitting.  She wants to use the loan to buy fodder at wholesale to resell gradually.  She wants to save up so that she can open her own business in a few months.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to follow the installment payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy fodder at wholesale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a widowed woman, age 35, who is blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. For the last 7 years, Ruth has been selling clothes to bring up her family. She also practices dairy farming to increase her income. She has employed one person to assist her to manage the business. Ruth has requested a loan of 70,000 KES to buy skirts, blouses and shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses and shoes

loans.name: Kelvis Israel

texts.es:
Kelvis de 21 años, trabaja en un taxi que compro con la ayuda de su mama que trabaja en el exterior.

Trabaja todos los dias desde las 8:30am hasta las 7:00pm.

El único problema que posee es la delincuencia que hay en las calles.

Es padre soltero y tienes dos hijos ( 3 y 2 años) que a podido sacar adelante con la ayuda de dios y esfuerzo de su trabajo.

El sueño que desea alcanzar en comprar una casa propia para poder vivir cómodamente con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Kelvis, age 21, works as a taxi driver. He bought his taxi with his mother's help; she works in another country.
Kelvis works every day from 8:30 am to 7:00 pm.
His only problem is street crime.
He is a single father of two children (ages 2 and 3). He is able to get them ahead with God's help and thanks to his hard work.
His dream is to buy his own home in order to live comfortably with his children.

loans.use: to modify and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 47 años edad, está casada con Luis. Ambos tienen 2 hijas, pero solo vive con una de ellas: Jhellica, de 15 años. Esta familia habita un hogar propio en el anexo de Puente Paucartambo. Olinda es una mujer trabajadora. En toda su vida como madre y esposa aprendió distintas actividades con las que mantuvo a su familia.  Así inició un negocio de carnes, el que considera más rentable por el manejo de dinero de todos los días. “Vendo carne de pescado, pollo y res, pero lo que se vende más es el pollo y pescado”, comenta.
El río de la zona es rico en peces, es así que también pesca, ofreciendo sus productos a los visitantes del lugar.
De igual manera se dedica a la venta de frutas, las que compra de su zona y del mercado mayorista para venderlas en la ciudad de Lima. Ahí sus productos son bien recibidos y comprados al instante.
Y como si fuera poco, Olinda también se dedica a la agricultura. En sus propias parcelas siembra café, plátanos y paltas. El café lo comercializa en la ciudad de La Merced, mientras que los plátanos y paltas los lleva para Lima junto con su cargamento de frutas.
Olinda espera con ampliar y decorar su tienda y carnicería, con el fin de captar más clientela. Por ahora está contenta con sus logros. Gracias a su ayuda, Olinda podría acceder a su préstamo número 10 de MFP, por ello se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Comenta que le agrada trabajar con su banco comunal por la solidaridad y crecimiento en equipo.
Con el dinero podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de frutas. Así visitará el mercado mayorista y comprará frutas al por mayor.
texts.en:
The local river is rich with fish.  This is where she fishes, offering her products to visitors to the area.

She also sells fruits, which she buys in her area and at the main market, and sells them in Lima.  Her products are well received there, and are bought immediately.

As if that was not enough, Olinda also farms.  She raises coffee, bananas, and avocadoes.  She sells the coffee in La Merced, and takes the bananas and avocados to Lima, along with her fruits.

Olinda hopes to expand and decorate her store and butcher shop in order to attract more customers.  For now she is happy with her other achievements.  Thanks to the help she’s gotten, Olinda can access her 10th loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time.  She says that she likes working with the communal bank because of the unity and growth as a team.

The money from this loan will allow her to buy merchandise for her fruit business.  She will buy fruit in quantity at the main market.

loans.use: to buy fruits in quantity.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has operated a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan for two years.

Leila is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Deang's Group

texts.en:
Deang is 57 years old, widowed, and has five children. Three of her children are dependent on her: two of them work in Thailand and Malaysia, while the last one works at the family’s rice farm. A widow in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Cambodia, Deang has struggled to feed her children as a farmer. This has been her primary business for 35 years. 

Deang received a loan from VisionFund one year ago. The loan has helped her grow rice successfully in order to support her daily living expenses. She completely repaid the last loan with VisionFund. Now she leads a group of two female members in applying for another loan of 250 USD each. She will use this loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland. This loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and gain more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco, aged 75, is a widower with four children, residing in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

He operates a raising crops venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community to earn a living and has been in this business for five years. Each month, he earns 10,000 PHP in this business.

Francisco has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2004, he joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Francisco wants to save to establish a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa, quien se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Miguel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional Mecánica Automotriz, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus pequeños.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Miguel trabaja como carpintero, en especial brinda servicios de elaboración de puertas, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos acabados y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de herramientas, tales como martillos, lijas, brocas, cepillo eléctrico, entre otros, de esta manera Miguel tendrá su taller mejor acondicionado y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda y tener otro taller de carpintería.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 44-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica with his loved wife and children. He is a very friendly, enthusiastic and hard working individual. His wife sales hamburgers and they both do their best effort to provide for their family. Unfortunately, due to financial constrains and because he needed to work to cover his expenses, Miguel was not able to become a professional in the field of automobile mechanics, although he would have loved to. In his free time he enjoys playing with his children. 

On his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Miguel started to work as a carpenter. In particular, he builds doors and he works every day from very early in the morning for approximately 12 hours. He feels good with his job and believes that he has succeeded due to the quality of the finishes he provides, and the friendly service that he offers his customers. 

Miguel is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because with their help that he will be able to purchase tools, such as hammers, sand paper, drills and a power brush, amongst others. In this way, Miguel will have his workshop better equipped, allowing him to serve more customers. Thus, he will continue to work and put all of his efforts into achieving his dream of building his own home and another carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to purchase tools.

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en: Khom, a local farmer from Pursat province, is = 29 years old and a married mother blessed with two children. She secures the basic need in her family via rice cropping and fish-catching business for resale. This is not the original loan for Khom with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan completely and now her living condition is getting better than before. Now, in a group of five, she is a leader. For Khom, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba is a low income person from Baku. She is married and has children. She started her own profitable business in 1997. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two times a total of $1,500 from the Normicro Baku branch. Now she would like to borrow an additional $1,200 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To expand trade goods inventory.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has 5 years' experience with her restaurant business. On her own initiative, she started selling candies at home. Then her grandmother encouraged her to start selling snacks. Thanks to that motivation she doesn’t only sell snacks but she also sells lunches. She works everyday from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. and the weekends from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. Her mother helps her serving the clients at her eatery. With this business, she has been able to recondition the premises and provide a better service for her clients. She also has a small store that generates and additional income. Her younger sisters help her with the sales.

Maria wants to use the credit money to invest in kitchen utensils for her eatery like pots, pans and plates. She would like also to invest part of the money in her small store.

Maria is single. She is 34 years old and she lives with her parents, who have helped her undertake her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene una experiencia ya de 5 años con su negocio de venta de comida. Se inicio vendiendo golosinas en su casa por iniciativa propia. Su abuela la motiva a que comience a vender meriendas y lo hace. Gracias a esa motivación hoy no solamente vende meriendas sino también a incluido venta de almuerzos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 9 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. y los fines de semana hasta las 12 p.m. Su madre es una de las personas que le ayudan con la atención del comedor. Por medio del negocio a logrado adecuar su local para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Además tiene una tienda la cual le genera otros ingresos. Sus hermanas menores le ayudan con las ventas.

Maria desea el crédito para invertir en utensilios para su negocio como lo son ollas, platos, y una parte desea invertir en su tiendita.

Maria es soltera. Tiene 34 años y vive en la casa de sus padres. Los mismos que le han ayudado en emprender su negocio.

loans.use: Invest in kitchen utensils for her eatery

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mr. Guadalupe is married and has two small children. His wife is pregnant of their third child. He works for a company, but when he bought his own house, they started to discount the mortgage payments from his salary. And as a result he could not pay for all the household expenses, and he decided together with his wife to start selling groceries two years ago. This way they obtain an extra income that allows them to live better. They together work in the business and were able to make it grow and they want to turn it into a great success.

Since he started their store, he was able to increase its clientele and in order to provide them with a good service, he is requesting a loan of $325, which he will use to buy merchandise to increase is assortment.

Guadalupe commits himself to return this amount in five months. Play an important role in the well being of this family. Help them grow their business; they sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Guadalupe es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos y está en espera de su tercer bebé. Él trabaja en una empresa pero al adquirir su propia casa, comenzaron a descontar los pagos hipotecarios de su salario, por esta razón no se podía cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y entre él y su esposa decidieron iniciar con la venta de abarrotes desde hace dos años, de esta manera obtienen un ingreso que les permite vivir mejor, juntos atienden el negocio y han logrado sacarlo adelante, pero ellos desean que pueda creer y desarrollarse exitosamente.

En el tiempo que tiene su tienda ha logrado incrementar sus clientes y para darles un buen servicio ahora solicita un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para incrementar su variedad, Guadalupe se compromete a regresas esta cantidad en 5 meses. Se parte importante en el bienestar de esta familia, ayúdalos a hacer crecer su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is 39 years old, and is married with four young children who are in school. Her husband is a carpenter and they live in a house which took a lot of work to build. Maria is a very enterprising woman, and because she and her husband come from humble families, Maria decided to start her own business in order to help her husband with the household costs. She decided to open a kiosk, starting from very little, initially selling only drinks and ice cream, and later, after some time had passed and she generated more profits, the business grew to include more products to sell such as fruits and bread and sodas. Maria is a well respected woman in her community for her leadership characteristics, and she's already started a commission in her neighborhood with the objective of improving the streets. Maria would like to continue growing her business and diversifying her sales, so she is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as vegetables, crackers, dairy products, frozen foods, etc. for her grocery store.

La señora María tiene 39 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos son aún pequeños y están en edad escolar. Su marido es carpintero y viven todos juntos en una casa que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, y debido a que ella y su marido provienen de familias humildes, María decidió montar su propio negocio para ayudar a su marido con los ingresos de la casa. Fue así que decidió abrir un kiosco; empezó el negocio desde muy abajo ya que en principio solo vendía bebidas y helados luego con el correr del tiempo y con las ganancias que generaba el negocio fue ampliándose e incorporando nuevos productos para la venta. Vende diferentes tipos de productos, como golosinas, gaseosas, frutas, pan, etc. María es una señora muy respetada en su comunidad por su carácter de líder, ya que integra una comisión de su barrio con el objetivo de mejorar las calles del barrio. Ella desea seguir progresando y diversificar sus ventas, por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar más mercaderías como verduras, productos enlatados, galletitas, golosinas, lácteos, etc.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Soeum

texts.en: Mr. Some V., 49, lives with his wife and five school-aged children in Batambong province, Cambodia. He works next to a market, driving a motor-taxi, earning around US$5 a day, while Mrs. Chea Sokha, his wife, runs a small butcher stand at an open-air market, earning up to US$62 a day in revenue. The couple is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to expand the inventory (pork and sausage) of Mrs. Sokha's butcher stand to meet the growing customer demand.

loans.use: Expansion of inventory (pork and sausage)

loans.name: Sadiah

texts.en: Sadiah is 34 years old and is a mother of a 12 year old daughter. She has a small shop which sells some snacks and household goods. She could earn $10 per day. Her husband E. is a laborer who earns a $2 salary per day. She requests a $125 loan to fill her shop with more goods and make it more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the shop

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: It is the first time that I am acquiring a loan. I require this loan for my husband’s small shoe factory. I am a mother of four: two sons and two daughters. Currently, only three of my kids attend school, whereas the fourth one is too small to attend school. Whenever I get time away from my household chores I stitch clothes for the women in my area.

loans.use: expand shoe business

loans.name: Yahe

texts.en:
Yahe A. is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. Yahe's wife stays at home and takes care of the family.

Yahe is the main breadwinner in his large family. For ten years he has been selling carrots, cabbages, potatoes, and garlic in the center of the biggest market in the city. Yahe has many clients every day, so the business generates a stable income for his family all year.

Yahe has received loans from IMON several times and had shown himself to be a reliable client. Today Yahe requests 3,450 somoni ($1,000.00 in US dollars), to increase his stock of goods to sell in the market. He requests this loan for the term of nine months.

loans.use: To increase his stock of goods, such as carrots, cabbages, potatoes, and garlic, to sell in the market

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
This is 57 year-old Neema K.. She is married with four children, aged between 20 and 37.

In 2007 Neema established a general store, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: San Cristobal Group

texts.en:
The women of the ‘San Cristobal’ village bank are entering their second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and are eagerly awaiting the approval of their newly requested loans. The fifteen women know each other well, living as neighbors in a rural village just outside of Chimaltenango. Now, in addition to being neighbors, they are learning to become confidants and support each other in business, sharing ideas for success, and helping one another overcome obstacles. After the success of their first loan, other women took note and have joined the group. The veteran members will teach them about solidarity and responsibility within the group. They are confident of their ability to repay, and excited to take on this new challenge.

All fifteen women are weavers, crafting beautiful "huipiles," the traditional Mayan blouse, whose intricate designs reveal a woman’s hometown, marital status, or beliefs. A single huipil C. take up to three months to produce, working all day. After an initial investment of about $30-$50, it C. be sold for up to $200. The women also save money by weaving for themselves, rather than buying from others.

They are asking for a loan of 24,000 quetzales, about $3150 USD, with which they will purchase thread in bulk to weave the huipiles, as well as skirts and belts and other crafts. Some of the women sell their weaving in markets in the nearby town of Chimaltenango, and most are well known in their own village and receive orders from friends and neighbors. Buying in bulk drastically lowers the cost of thread, and it also cuts back on the trips that must be made to the market to buy materials, saving on time and travel expenses.

The women are excited about their loan and the possibility of better providing for their families. They dream of being able to support their children in school past 6th grade, opening up opportunities for them that will help stop the cycle of poverty within their families.

(The two women who are not pictured had come to the meeting but left to take care of their children before the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Bé, 53 years old, lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên with her family. She has 2 children: 1 son and 1 daughter, both are grown up. She owns an internet cafe. Since people use internet as a mean of communication, her cafe is always busy. Since it is open all day long, her husband and her children would drop by and help her out whenever they have free time. The income form her internet cafe is stable so making the weekly payment is not a problem for her. The internet cafe brings in, on average, 220 USD a month. She wishes to expand her cafe e.g. buy more computers. She is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to expand her business to better serve her customers and to increase her revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Bé, 53 tuổi, sống cùng gia đình tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Chị có hai con, 1 trai, 1 gái đều đã trưởng thành. Công việc của chị là kinh doanh dịch vụ internet. Trong thời buổi hiện nay, nhu cầu tìm hiểu thông tin rất nhiều nên cửa hàng của chị Bé luôn đông khách. Cửa hàng mở cửa cả ngày nên chồng và các con những lúc nhàn rỗi luôn phải hỗ trợ trông coi. Thu nhập đều đặn nên việc hoàn trả tuần cũng thuận tiện. Hàng tháng chị Bé thu trung bình khoảng 220USD. Công việc kinh doanh phát triển nên chị luôn muốn mở rộng quy mô dự án. Vòng vốn này chị Bé xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm máy mới đáp ứng thêm nhu cầu người dân, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. is 40 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She sells timber wood at the intermediary stage, such as planks and plywood. She learned her trade over a year and then started her business in 1996. She has been an LAPO member since 2003. She needs a loan of $450.00 to buy more wood to sell.

loans.use: To buy more woods to sell.

loans.name: Maxima Lidia

texts.es:
Maxima H. dedicates herself to the business of farming and livestock in her municipality of El Sauce in the city of Leon. With a lot of work she has been able to improve her business as a result of her great efforts to help her two small children in their studies.

The necessity the she is currently faced with is the need to acquire the economic resources to purchase pregnant cows. For this reason she is seeking a loan through Ceprodel to purchase the cows so that she can continue with her livestock business in the municipality of El Sauce.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Máxima H. se dedica al negocio agropecuario en su municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos pequeños en sus estudios.

La necesidad que ella actualmente atraviesa es que necesita adquirir el recurso económico para la compra de vacas en preñez. Por este motivo busca en Ceprodel un crédito para la compra de las vacas y de esta manera continuar con su negocio de ganado en el municipio de El Sauce.

loans.use: Purchase of pregnant cows.

loans.name: Lucero De La Mañana Group

texts.en:
Yocelyne J. is an ambitious young woman from Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. She is 25 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She will use this loan money to purchase new pants, blouses, shoes, and cosmetics from the nearby city of Santiago. Then, she will go on to sell the purchased goods in a local flea market. She hopes that her business will continue to thrive and aspires to own her personal business in the future.

Yocelyne J. is part of a 10-person micro-bank, Lucero de la Mañana, which means "Morning Star". Each woman has her own personal business but all of them unite to pay their loan as a group. The purpose of the group loan is to assist each other in case someone defaults. The Kiva loans will be divided among the group to pay back.

We thank you for your support on behalf of Yocelyne, the Paz and Amor group, and the entire team at Esperanza International.

loans.use: Purchase new pants, blouses, shoes, and cosmetics to be sold in the local flea market.

loans.name: Nereida Elena

texts.es:
Señora Nereida Elena is married and 62 years old. She grew up in a farmhouse in Paiján, and she worked as a young woman in Chimbote, where she met her husband. After an earthquake, she brought her family to the coastal city of Trujillo, where her sister lived. Nereida's five children all currently work.

To help out financially, she began weaving and travelled to Chimbote to sell her work. She continues to weave but now also has a small grocery store. At the beginning, she sold little because she bought little merchandise. Since she began working with the microfinance organization Manuela Ramos, she has earned more profits. Her daughter-in-law recommended the Communal Bank "Nueva Esperanza II" (Fresh Hope II), and with her first 300 Sol loan, Nereida bought oil, a sack of rice and a sack of sugar.

With her current four-month 600 Sol ($US 250) loan, she plans to invest in boxed pasta, soft drinks, snacks, soap, salt, and detergent. Nereida plans to save money to pay for legal documents on her house. She's happy to be working with Manuela Ramos because it gives her peace of mind; she doesn't feel desperate paying her credit installments.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nereida Elena, está casada, tiene 62 años, estudió hasta 4to grado D. primaria, se crió en la chacra D. Paiján, cuando era señorita trabajó en Chimbote donD. conoció a su esposo, después del terremoto regresó a Paiján y como tenía una hermana que vivía en la ciudad D. Trujillo, ella decidió emigrar para prosperar con su familia, tiene 05 hijos, se encuentran trabajando actualmente, vive en el Distrito D. La Esperanza en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente, empezó tejiendo y llevaba a Chimbote a vender sus tejidos, actualmente sigue tejiendo pero como le gusta el negocio tiene además una bodega; al comienzo vendía poco porque compraba poca mercadería, desD. que empezó a trabajar con Manuela Ramos ha obtenido mayor ganancia. Su nuera la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “NUEVA ESPERANZA II” ella aceptó el préstamo porque necesitaba para trabajar en la bodega y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró 01 lata D. aceite, 01 saco D. arroz, 01 saco D. azúcar. Con este préstamo D. S/. 600.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. fideos, gaseosas, golosinas, jabón, sal, detergentes, etc. La empresaria piensa ahorrar para pagar la declaración jurada D. su casa, ella está feliz D. trabajar con Manuela Ramos porque le da tranquilidad, no se siente desesperada para pagar las letras.

loans.use: Buy products for her grocery store: soap, detergent, pasta, salt.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi C. is 44 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2002. She used her first loan for pig raising, then she borrowed another loan to buy a milling machine to serve the villagers in her area. At present, her family's earnings come from pig raising, rice milling, and the salary of her husband, a builder. She now wants to borrow VND 6 million to buy unhusked rice, husk it and sell it to people to earn more money for her family.

loans.use: buy unhusked rice to husk and sell

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run P., age 28, is a mother of one child and lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She has a grinding mill and rents this machine to the people in the village. She earns a profit of $2 each day. 

She also grows rice, but her farming just supports her family members. Her husband is a construction worker and makes $4 per day. 

Run P. would like to take a loan of $1000 to purchase cow to help plow her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase cow to help plow her farmland.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: DOÑA LILIANA TIENE UN SOLO DEPENDIENTE DE 16 AÑOS DE EDAD; TIENE CASA PROPIA. DOÑA LILIANA  TIENE UNA PENSION EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO; POR OTRO LADO TIENE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO LA CUAL ES ADMINISTRADA POR ELLA Y SU HIJA. TIENE 5 1/2 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA. LA COMPETENCIA EN LA VENTA DE COMIDA  Y DE LA TIENDA DE BARRIO NO SON MUY ALTAS YA QUE ES UNA DE LAS POCAS PERSONAS QUE TIENEN UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO Y ADEMAS VENDEN ALMUEZO Y CENA EN ESA ZONA. LA CLIENTA PIENSA AMPLIAR SU VIVIENDA CON LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN HALL MAS GRANDE PARA LA VENTA DE SU COMIDA . EL CREDITO ACTUAL ES SU 3 OPERACIÓN,TUVO PRIMERO EN UNA DE LAS PROVINCIAS CON EXCELENTES REFERENCIAS DE PUNTUALIDAD.
texts.en:
Ms. Liliana P. has one 16-year-old dependent child. She has her own home, which also serves as a guesthouse. Additionally, she has a neighborhood general store, which is managed by her daughter. She has 5 ½ years of experience. She does not have very much competition as far as food sales and general stores are concerned because she is one of the few people who have a general store in her neighborhood. She also sells lunch and dinner in the area. This client plans on expanding her home by building a bigger dining hall for her food sales. This is her third loan. Her first loan was in one of the provinces, and she has excellent references in punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating costs

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi: Chị Mai Thị Thử năm nay 46 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 5 năm. Ban đầu khi mới tham gia Quỹ chị vay mức vốn 700.000đ và đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Đến nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn T. rất ổn định từ dịch vụ  cày ruộng T.ê của chồng.. Với mức T. nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Thử đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn , hai con của chị cũng được đầu tư cho ăn học ngày càng tốt hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm máy bơm  nước và 1 máy cày mới nhằm  phục vụ ngày càng tốt hơn nhu cầu của người dân địa phương
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Thi Mai, 46 years old, has been participating in the Fund for 5 years. In the beginning, she borrowed 700,000 VND to invest in raising livestock. Besides livestock, the family also has a very stable income stream from her husband's field tilling service. With an income of 3,000,000 VND/month, Mrs. Mai's family is seeing a steady improvement in their quality of life. Her two children can also go to school. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in a water pump and a new tilling machine to provide better service for the locals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy water pump and plow

loans.name: Sela

texts.en: Mrs. Sela P. is a farmer who lives in Doun Pen village in Kampong Cham province. Her husband, Mr. Khom Sokha, uses electricity to recharge batteries to earn an income. In this business, he now faces an obstacle because his machine is too old so he needs to spend a lot of money on fuel. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sela P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new machine to generate electricity to recharge  batteries. Mrs. Sela P. is 34 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new machine to generate electricity to recharge batteries

loans.name: Noemi Flor

texts.es:
Noemí es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Noemí es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres, de profesión policía, Noemí viaja a la ciudad de Lima semanalmente en donde compra abarrotes por mayor y luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas los realiza a las tiendas por mayor.
Noemí necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz por sacos.
Noemí sueña con tener una tienda estable y vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Noemi is a member of the community bank Triomphe. Noemi is single, 22 years old, and lives with her parents. Noemi is a policewoman, and travels to Lima on a weekly basis, where she buys wholesale groceries. She then transports the groceries to the city of Ayacucho, where she sells them to stores. Noemi needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sacks of rice. Noemi's dream is to have a stable store where she can offer goods at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is divorced with a daughter. She lives in Zaporozhye and works in Yubileynyi market selling animal feed and accessories. There are very few other vending kiosks with the same type of inventory. Oksana has been in this trade for 10 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about 50,000 Grivnas.

Oksana is requesting a loan of 2,500 Grivnas to purchase the fourth vending facility in the market and improve the financial situation in her family. She believes in success for her venture and is willing to learn and work hard to be better at what she does. We think Oksana’s ability to find her niche, put her customers' needs first and take care of them will be instrumental to her business success.

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility

loans.name: Nicholas Otieno

texts.en:
Nicholas Otieno A. is a 27-year-old father of three children aged 6, 4 and 1. He is in the "boda-boda" business. In Kisumu, a boda-boda is a bike with a seat on the back where passengers can sit. It is simultaneously a very affordable way to get a ride and a tough way to make a living. If Nicholas is able to make a profit, he hopes to expand and purchase a poultry coup to provide extra food and security for his family and maybe sell eggs. He is concerned that he will be driven out of business by those in the "piki-piki" (motorbike) business.

Nicholas recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW he will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of his community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. His work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Spare parts for bikes

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
El señor Catalino C.  tiene 52 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos. El es propietario de tres vacas lecheras con cria y se dedica a la venta de leche y a la produccion de queso. La misma esta ubicada en la Compañia Cerro Real de la ciudad de Caacupe a cinco kilometros de centro.
 
El cliente realiza sus ventas por los alrrededores y en sudomicilio ya que no cuenta con un medio de trasporte tambien comenta  que con los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar dos vacas con cria . Esto hizo que su venta aumente  y asi pudo llegar a mas  clientes.

Su objetivo a muy corto plazo es comprar un medio de transporte para agilizar su venta y llegar a mas cantidad de potenciales clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Catalino C. is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. He owns three milk cows and works selling milk and making cheese. His business is located in the Cerro Real Company in the city of Caacupe, 5 kilometers from the downtown. He sells in the surrounding neighborhoods and also from his home, since he does not have a car. He shared that with previous loan from Fundación Paraguaya he was able to buy cows. This increased his sales and then he was able to reach more customers. His short term goal is to buy a means of transportation to speed up his sales and be able to reach a larger quantity of potential clients.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two milk cows

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Chanh Group

texts.en:
"C. Nguyễn Thị (20201020028) is a 41 year-old female living in the town of Thị trấn Chờ- Yên Phong Bắc Ninh.  C. is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Nguyễn Thị C. (13).


C. is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, C. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  C. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201020029) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20201020030) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Nghiêm Thị Thuỷ (20201020031) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn THị Lý (20201020032) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20201020033) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


6.  Nghiêm Thị B. (20201020034) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


7.  Đặng THị L. (20202010035) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Nguyễn Thị (20201020028) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thị trấn Chờ- Yên Phong Bắc Ninh.  C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nguyễn Thị C. (13).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201020029) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20201020030) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nghiêm Thị Thuỷ (20201020031) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn THị Lý (20201020032) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20201020033) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  Nghiêm Thị B. (20201020034) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


7.  Đặng THị L. (20202010035) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Mrs. Bou L. is 52 years old and married. The older couple has five children. Four of their children are married and living separately and one is single and sells fish paste in the market.

Bou L. and her husband currently grow a rice crop. Bou L. also sells sugar cane juice in front of her house for additional income. She has applied for this loan to expand her sugar cane juice business. The family will earn more income because of this loan.

loans.use: To expand her sugar cane juice business.

loans.name: Mellie

texts.en: Mellie A. is from the town of Mantik, Tangub City. She is 50 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. Mellie owns and operates a business fishing and selling fish. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mellie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for fishing. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for basic family needs and for her children's education. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for fishing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase long hair, razor and hair dryer.

loans.name: Adelayda Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Adelayda del Carmen se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos lácteos como lo son el queso seco, queso fresco, queso mozarela, quesillo, cuajada y crema.

Todos estos productos son ofertados por ella misma a diario y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar sus productos lácteos y así venderlos en su establecimiento el cual atiende desde hace 15 años.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua, Adelayda del Carmen runs her business selling dairy products such as dry white cheese, fresh cheese, mozzarella cheese, string cheese, curd cheese and cream cheese.

She offers all these products herself every day. She has gone to Ceprodel to apply for a new loan to buy raw materials to make her dairy products. This way she can sell them in her establishment which she has run for 15 years.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Patricia Ynes

texts.es:
Patricia es socio del Bancomunal Los Sureños, es casada tiene dos hijos de 9 y 7 años que están en el escuela estatal.
Patricia  no pudo estudiar por que tenia que trabajar para ayudar a sus hermanos en la alimentación, ella se dedica a las ventas desde que estaba el colegio, ella trabaja por las mañanas cocinando y limpiando y por las tardes cuida aun niño. Y se dedica ala venta  de productos de belleza por catalogo. 
Desde que Patricia esta en Finca ha aprendió ahorrar y a invertir el dinero que recibe del préstamo.
Patricia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.
El sueño de Patricia es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the Los Sureños Community Bank. She is married and has two children. The children, who are nine and seven, go to the state school. Patricia could not study because she had to work to help feed her siblings. She has been in sales since she was in school. She works in the mornings cooking and cleaning. In the afternoon she takes care of a child. She sells beauty products by catalog. Since Patricia has been with Finca she has learned to save and to invest the money she receives from the loan. Patricia needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy beauty products by catalog. Patricia’s dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products by catalog

loans.name: Silverward Nakakade Florence Group

texts.en: N. Florence has a grocery store which she has been operating for over three years. She is 24 years old and a married lady blessed with one child who is going to school. She is also looking after four dependents who also go to school. She is using this loan to purchase grocery items such as tomatoes, passion fruits, avocados, onions, etc. Her business is improving so fast. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: For purchasing grocery items such as tomatoes, passion fruits, avocados, onions, etc.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es: Maria Graciela V. Mejía tiene 53 años de edad. Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de recargas telefónicas. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que tenía que buscar el medio de sobrevivir, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y siempre le ha gustado comunicarse con sus clientes y brindarles los servicios necesarios. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre satisfechos porque el espíritu de Graciela es muy alegre y además es muy cariñosa. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de para la compra de recargas de las dos compañías y así ofrecer un mejor servicio. El sueño de Maria es obtener otro medio de ingreso como es una pulpería.
texts.en:
Maria Graciela V. Mejía is 53. She is a single mother, and she has two independent children. She sells telephone cards. She has had this business for over three years. She had to look for a way to survive. She is a very hard working woman, and she has always liked communicating with her customers and offering them necessary services. The majority of her customers are always satisfied because Graciela has a very happy spirit, and she is very kind. The loan is for working capital to buy telephone cards from the two companies, which will offer better service. Maria’s dream is to get another means of income such as a mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana has been selling kitchen utensils for the past five years. She is 54 years old and married with four children. Christiana lives in Lagos State, Nigeria with her family. She hopes for loan of N150, 000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase  more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Jane Njeri

texts.en:
Jane Njeri is 40 years old and married with three children. She lives on her farm in Kangari. Her primary business is selling milk to her customers. She has been doing this for about nineteen years, making a profit of about 71,700 KES a month. 

Jane Njeri was introduced to KADET by a friend and has never been part of a MFI before. She has applied for a loan with which she would buy an extra cow so as to meet customer demand for her milk. She would like to use her milk profits to start a vegetable farm. By selling vegetables as well as milk, she hopes to improve her living standards.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET at: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy another cow and invest in vegetable farming

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es: DAnilo G. A., tiene 41 años de edad, casado,  y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Gracias al prestamo de Fudecosur, pudo comprar una vaca para la produccion de leche. Hace muchos años que se dedica al campo y la ganaderia y quiere crecer.Es el segundo prestamo que ha recibido de Fudecosur. El manifiesta que no tenia problemas en el campo hace cinco años, pero desea crecer, por tal razón decide realizar el prestamo y ver la posibilidad de crecer. Además, él desea brindar a su esposa e hijos un futuro mejor y estable. También, desea que sus hijos se superen y estudien y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Danilo G. A. is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children who are his first priority. Thanks to the loan he received from Fudecosur he was able to puchase a cow for the production of milk. For years he’s been dedicated to farming and cattle, and would like to expand. This is the second loan he’s received from Fudecosur. He says he didn’t have any challenges in the past 5 years in farming but he wishes to grow, so he took out the loan to have the opportunity to do so. Besides this, he wishes to provide his wife and children with a better, more stable future. He also wishes that his children better themselves, study, and grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 40-year-old widow with four children, aged between 10 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with five people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Alice doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a stall selling charcoal in Kabowa Suuna zone and doesn’t pay for transport costs to and from shopping because she buys from her place of work. She buys her charcoal from suppliers who get it from the villages.

Alice works seven days a week. On average she receives about 20 customers a day. She works on the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business fifteen years and with MCDT five years, servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group-mates. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees, and medications. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which hinders her customers from coming to her stall because she works in a muddy place.

Alice wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and to start buying directly from producers.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Daba S. est une femme de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend du poissons séchés, fumés et divers condiments sur étal. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son commerce et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Daba S. is a 40-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children. She sells dried and smoked fish and various condiments in her stall. This loan will allow her to bolster her business and to do better in providing for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To run a business selling fish and a variety of foodstuff

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy L., 44, is a widow and lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has five children: 4 sons and 1 daughter. One of them is married and lives outside the family home; one has full-time employment and the other three attend school.

Channy has been a silk weaver for 4 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una joven dinámica y emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 21 años, es madre de un niño, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Ella tiene una bodega y paralelamente se dedica a la venta de menús, actividad que realiza desde su casa.
Margarita esta contenta de ser socia D. Movimiento Manuela Ramos ya que ahora tiene un pequeño capital propio y esto le permite progresar en su negocio. Forma parte D. Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace un año y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtiò en productos de abarrotes.
En la actualidad Margarita necesita un crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà un carrito sanguchero para vender por las tardes y asì aumentar sus ingresos. 
La meta de Margarita es surtir su bodega y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is a dynamic and hardworking young person who likves in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 21 years old and married with one child, and her husband is dedicated to selling clothing. She has a store and she also sells menus, which she does out of her house. Margarita is content to be a partner in the Manuela Ramos Movement, now that she has a little personal capital which helps her progress in her business. She has been part of the Las Rosas Community Bank for a year, and the first credit she received was for $125 which she invested in the purchase of groceries. Currently Margarita needs a credit of $350 with which she can buy a cart from which to sell in the evenings, and in that way increase her profits. The goal of Margarita is to stock her store and improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of a cart

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana P. is 32 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Ana has many years of experience in this business.  Ana needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 750 talas or US $313 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Ana joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Ana P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar M. is from the village of Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Maricar is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Maricar owns & operates a business buying and selling fish around the village and nearby places with her husband who used to drive their motorized vehicle designed for fish vending. Maricar has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maricar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maricar is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maricar from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Samen

texts.en:
Mr. Samen S. is 36 years old and lives with his family in Samchat village, Takeo province. He and wife, Mrs. Sarom Prak, are farmers who own a 1.7-hectare field for cultivating rice. They now face a problem with their farming because they do not have enough money to support the field. Thus, Mr. Samen S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for supporting the farming crop. 

Mr. Samen S. is also a construction worker and can earn a small salary to support his family members. He is the father of three children, two of whom are students in the local school and the other one is too young to study or work. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Gicela

texts.es:
Gicela, de 34 años, vive en una casa alquilada con sus dos hijos; Anthony (15) y Johanna (1).
Desde hace un par de años se dedica a brindar el servicio de llamadas telefónicas por celular de manera ambulatoria, por las calles de su localidad. Según cuenta es una actividad muy rentable porque tiene 4 celulares y los que alquila a precios muy cómodos de acuerdo al destino donde llaman sus habituales clientes. Le gusta mucho esta actividad porque la realiza en horas fijas, de 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, donde hay más afluencia de público y mayor ganancia, así no descuida a su pequeña hija; tiene además la ayuda de su hijo mayor, quien es muy maduro y trabajador; juntos pagan el alquiler de su casa. Y como es una mujer muy trabajadora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un centro de alquiler de llamadas, para que sea más estable y obtenga mejores ganancias.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y está segura que será muy puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con el grupo que la ha acogido y le ha depositado su confianza. Gicela tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de un equipo celular nuevo. Además de golosinas, pues quiere emprender un negocio ambulante de venta de golosinas.
texts.en:
Gicela is 34 years old and lives in a rented house with her two children, Anthony (age 15) and Johanna (age 1). For the past two years, she has been providing mobile phone services as a traveling vendor through the streets in her neighborhood. She considers her business to be very profitable because she has four cellular phones that she rents out at very reasonable rates and encounters regular customers who need to make phone calls. Gicela enjoys her job because she is able to work regular hours from 7am until 4pm, which is when she can serve most of the general public and earn the most money without having to neglect her young daughter. She also has the help of her oldest son, who is very mature and hardworking. Together they both work to help pay the rent. As a hardworking woman, Gicela has future plans to open a call center so that her business will be more stable and generate more revenue.

This is her first loan with MFP. Gicela will be sure to make each of her payments on time because she does not want to disappoint the other members of her group who have welcomed her and placed their trust in her. She will use the money to purchase a new cellular phone. Gicela wants to start a street vending business selling candy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a mobile phone

loans.name: Poyiba

texts.en:
Poyiba E. is currently in the business of selling bread at the market and is requesting a loan to buy bags of sugar to sell. Poyiba is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a police officer. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. 

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy bags of sugar to sell

loans.name: Bit

texts.en:
Bit R. is 41 years old and married. She lives in Kompong Tom Province where she earns a living by cultivating various crops on her land in the village. She has been running her business for more than four years and currently earns approximately $2 each day.

She has five teenage childR., two of whom are employed: one is a garment worker and one is a fisherman. Her husband assists her in planting crops. Bit R. is applying for a loan as capital to buy more materials for her farming business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her farming business.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn B. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Madelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Madelyn has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Madelyn joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Madelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Madelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.en:
Isaias was born in the Inhambane province in Southern Mozambique but emigrated to Namaacha, near the Swaziland border, in the search of a better life. He is 41 years old and married. He studied up to the 11th grade but had to stop due to family matters, something common at the time. He has five children between the ages of 4 months and 15 years.

He is currently working as a security guard for the local telecommunications company, working both day and night shifts. He is looking for a loan to fund a clothes-selling business he runs in his spare time. With the money lent from Kiva he will buy shoes and clothes and sell them to clients from house to house. He has been doing this since 1990 when he first moved to Namaacha.

Isaias dreams of saving enough money to have his own stall and not have to sell door to door. If the business goes well, he hopes his next loan will finally fund his own stall.

loans.use: Shoes and clothes for his sales business

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mr. Savy S. (who is not in the photo, his wife is available instead), age 40 and his wife, Mrs. Sarom Tin, age 38, live in a small village along National Road Number 5 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1987 and have five children: one daughter who works in a garment factory, and four sons. One son is a construction worker and the other three attend school. 

Savy has been a construction worker for two years. His wife has been selling lotus for five years. In addition, he hopes to create a new business driving a motor taxi. He will be able to earn extra income to support his family. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo E. is already 41 years old. He is now married and blessed with three school-aged children and his family is happily living in the village of San Jose. Alfredo's source of living is through planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP whenever he sells his harvested rice. His earned income from the business is of great help in supporting his family’s needs especially the education of his children. In 2006, Alfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his eighth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de un familiar. Hace mas de 5 años se dedica a vender “cebiche” plato típico peruano, que en compañía de su esposo y su cuñada la ayudan en la atención de los clientes que van a su establecimiento. Su punto de venta es un local arrendado, ubicado en una calle céntrica de su ciudad, es así que todas las mañanas hasta las 3 de la tarde ofrece este platillo, ya que es el tiempo en que más demanda tiene, además por la buena sazón en que esta preparado este platillo. Su mayo anhelo es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, será muy responsable con sus pagos, por lo que se compromete desde ahora. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará cerámicas para mejorar el piso de su local, además comprará también platos.
texts.en:
Victoria is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their family home. For more than five years she has worked selling ceviche, a common Peruvian dish. Her husband and her sister-in-law help her to serve the customers. Her rents a space located on a central street in the city for her restaurant. She works selling her dished every morning until three in the afternoon because that is the hour of highest demand. Her ceviche is also in demand for the great flavors. Her greatest wish is to improve the infrastructure of her restaurant. This is the first loan she will receive from MFP, and she pledges to be responsible with making her payments. With the loan money she will buy tiles to improve her restaurant's floor as well as new plates.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tiles and plates

loans.name: Zansi

texts.fr: Z. Zansi est née en 1958 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Zansi est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont encore à sa charge. Zansi vit avec ses deux enfants au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou. Zansi subvient seule aux différentes charges familiales. Zansi n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins, Zansi mène comme activité, la vente de maïs et aussi de crevettes à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Zansi prépare et vend de l'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs). Zansi s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Zansi désire renforcer son activité et augmenter ses stocks de produits, en vue de mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est donc pour élever le niveau de son activité que Zansi sollicite un cinquième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Zansi Z. was born in 1958 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Zansi is a widowed mother of three children, all in school, of whom two are still in her care. Zansi lives with her two children in the Agbodjèdo area in Cotonou. She provides for the family by herself. Zansi never went to school. To meet her various needs, she runs a business selling maize, as well as shrimp, at her home. As a secondary business, Zansi prepares and sells akassa ( a local food made from cornstarch). She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She is a longstanding client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), having already obtained four previous loans that were all repaid properly. Zansi wants to strengthen her business and increase her stock of products, in order to better meet requests of her clientele. It is thus to raise the level of her business that Zansi is seeking a fifth loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Operating a farm has been a tremendous business venture for B. Grace from Kakungu, Ntungamo. Having a family of ten children, of whom four are dependents, and with a not-so-caring husband who does no productive work, Grace worked tooth and nail to start up the sale of bananas alongside her milk sales from her farm. Bananas are commonly used to prepare a local dish by customers here in Uganda.
